brand_copy.brand_copy_description: Japanese design brand

-Love, Ana is a Croatian furniture, lighting and accessory brand that spontaneously evolved after its first exhibition at Clerkenwell Design Week in 2011. Everything is designed with love by Ana and produced in small series with the help of local craftsmen. The first official store was opened in 2014 after three successful years of webshop sales and studio work. All products are hand made and carefully handled with lots of details that make your experience with my products more personal.

Founded in 2012, .flxble was initially the brand behind the Bike Dock. Today .flxble is a design manufacture based in Berlin which creates the finest wooden lifestyle accessories.
.flxble manufactures the finest lifestyle accessories combining traditional woodworking with modern digital techniques. Inspired by retrospective vintage designs and abstract geometric forms, our goal is to create a better everyday experience with a regard for style.
 The .flxble team consists of a multidisciplinary collective of makers experimenting with organic materials and digital craftsmanship. Came together driven by passion and artisan energy, now we are family of creatives characterized by a strong culture of curiosity.
Our workshop is where where we get excited, where we play, get happy and struggle through life. It’s the place where emotions and inspirations interact. It’s where we get tired and we relax. There is where we create our goods and beyond that where we create ourselves.

13&9 works across a range of disciplines, creating entire furniture and lighting collections from concept through production, to developing industrial and signature designs for international companies, XAL, VITEO and Artifort Lande.
13&9 designs represent the culmination of creative skills honed by founding partners who also happen to be an architect and a fashion designer.   Keeping the brand’s integrity at the forefront, the team’s interdisciplinary design approach brings a fresh aesthetic and assures functionality.
DESIGN LABEL
In addition to designing for outside brands, 13&9 has established its own label and develops, produces and sells stand-alone collections of furniture, lighting, fashion apparel and accessories.  A tenet of 13&9’s philosophy is to involve small and local resources, manufacturers and craftspeople in the process, adhering to high standards and quality in products and supports the brand’s home region. 
WORK
13&9’s array of products exemplify the brand’s interdisciplinary approach to design.  This approach reflects 13&9’s diverse capabilities, talents and interests that range from collaborating as design partners with outside brands to launching individual product lines of furnishings, lighting, fashion apparel and accessories as well expertise in electrical and sound design systems.

In 1882 the Johnson Brothers began producing ceramics in the heart of the Stoke-on-Trent Potteries. 134 years later 1882 Ltd. continues the Johnson legacy with the company name evoking the deep routes of the family heritage. 1882 Ltd. was formed in 2011 by fifth generation Emily Johnson and her father, Christopher, who has worked in the industry since 1958.

1882 Ltd’s mission is to champion inventively designed ceramic products from lighting to domestic ware whilst employing the manufacturing heritage of North Staffordshire and promoting the British ceramic industry. In collaborating with exceptionally talented designers to realise their interpretation of a very traditional material and craft 1882 Ltd. will bring innovative ceramics to a wider audience while supporting a valuable UK resource.

Our story starts with the belief that one person, literally, can change the world. Millions of people need food, medical attention and clean water. And there are millions more that can help change that. One person has the power to feed a child, quench a thirst and find a cure.
Be the Face of change with 1Face.
Our model shows how one person can change the world. We want to increase our impact and allow our supporters to help a variety of people and causes.
1Face supports nine causes; cancer, hunger, breast cancer, clean water, disaster relief, environment, AIDS, education, and animal rights, and have partnered with different charities to bring global change. Each cause has a specific metric that tells you exactly what you purchase does. From building wells to providing a year of education, 1Face is committed to bringing about change, worldwide.

3DWalldecor is a young design company, which focuses on the development of three dimensional wall decoration. Since 2010, we have been providing an innovative range of three dimensional wall panels. We supply through various channels, warehouses or dealers at home and abroad.
We provide Bamboo Wall Panels and Mineral Wall Panels.  
Bamboo Wall Panels by 3DWalldecor are a unique wall covering. Modular, easy to
apply and paintable. Furthermore, our panels are made of environmentally friendly bamboo pulp and are perfectly suitable for decorating walls and ceilings in homes, shops, restaurants, offices and meeting areas. 
Mineral Wall Panels are made from reinforced industrial gypsum. These easy-to-install tiles have a seamless surface and a perfect automatic pattern repeat, and can be painted in any desired colour. Relatively light weight due to hollow backside composition and still very strong due to glass fiber reinforcement.

We have created a company driven by passion for excellence in gastronomy, in order to continue the long Greek tradition in olive oil. We have the ambition of creating one of the finest premium olive oil brands in the world, with sensational packaging layout and excellent product quality. The selected design is elegant and contemporary yet at the same time also reminiscent of potion bottles from old times while the figure “5” was chosen as a fitting brand name, with “FIVE” standing for the quintessence. As we have amassed a total of five worldwide design awards for 2012 and 2013 our recognition took off in the olive oil industry. The packaging design helped us stand out in the global market. 

5 Olive Oil was awarded at the 2012 Pentawards, the worldwide competition exclusively devoted to packaging design. ""5"" won a Gold Pentaward in Paris at the Luxury category for gourmet food products. In addition to that 5 Olive Oil was awarded over the international jury of experts at the 2012 Red Dot awards in the category of communication design. In the same year 5 Olive Oil was awarded with the silver award of ED Awards in Helsinki, the european competition exclusively devoted to packaging design. More specifically ""5"" won a Silver ED Award at the category of Packaging Food & Beverages, at the same time ""5"" won the first place winner in the Food B category of the 2012 Dieline Package Design Awards, the worldwide competition devoted exclusively to the art of brand packaging. The latest distinction was at the New York International Olive Oil competition where 5 Olive Oil was awarded as the best olive oil package design for 2013.

A company created to respond to a major concern of consumers and people nowadays around the world: protecting the environment for a safer future
The company goals are:
 
 –﻿﻿ Corporate environmental responsibility

 –﻿ Manufacturing products solely using environmentally friendly practices and materials

8pandas design products are ecological, biodegradable and made out of renewable resources:
They are made out of bamboo, ground into a fine powder and mould heated into the designed shape.

Our products are ecodesigned and are based on the principles of sustainability. They represent a high level of aesthetics and functionality. Our philosophy is to offer always a high variability or an additional benefit. This is what our international award-winning designers stand for. We hope you enjoy your 8pandas products.﻿

AGATA BIELEŃ is a raw contemporary jewelry brand established in Poland in 2010.
Her statement pieces are easily recognized by subtle geometrical lines and lightweight elegance.
Main inspiration for her work is a straight line – the basic unit of geometry, length without extension,
straight stretched between two points. Formed in space turns into an object.
Since 2010 AGATA BIELEŃ has released couple collections of jewelry exploring this main motive.
The line broken, bent and bonded in space creates three-dimensional forms. Creates small sculptures that live
in close proximity to the body. Their usability is priority. Forms are light, delicate, and despite the strong
geometrical shapes – comfortable and functional, with clear and raw simplicity.
Each form is handcrafted of stainless steel, silver or gold with the utmost attention towards detail following the idea
that simple is beautiful and less is more.

AIAIAI is an audio design company dedicated to developing high quality audio products for everyday use. AIAIAI’s modern, minimalist headphones and earphones deliver clear, amplified sound.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, AIAIAI is proud to contribute to Denmark’s worldwide reputation as leader in acoustic and electro- acoustic design and engineering. Informed by a heritage of Scandinavian design, AIAIAI strives to create high quality, accessible audio products that deliver value far beyond trend-driven aesthetics.

AIAIAI boasts a world-renowned network of industrial designers, audio technicians and DJs as part of its unique and highly collaborative development process. Exploratory and experimental, the process enables AIAIAI to develop new products on the leading edge, independent of current market trends.

Our work always tries to establish the principle of making one’s home a place of individual personality as unique as people themselves are. The products we use everyday are of different importance to us and in common spaces things are all alike, mass produced and we share these. Our home should be quite the opposite, made of stuff that is exclusively ours. We try to make products to reflect this, to create a story for you through recycling symbolism and tradition of the everyday.

Altek Italian Design is an Italian manufacturing company dedicated to the study of innovative and original furniture for all the common areas, included lounge, work and public spaces.

The company reflects the heritage of four generations, which have been involved since 1920 in the production of furniture.

The passionate study and dedication in developing exquisite Italian design products has been the reason for the success of Altek Italia Design. The high reputation gained in the international arena has led the company to work with over forty Countries all over the World.

The product itself and the services offered are the result of a continuous dialogue between architects and designers who are studying every day what it means to live and work in environments that need to be practical as well as pleasant, representing an efficient investment too.

The desire is to offer products where creativity and design are free expression, thanks to that unique feeling and manufacturing experience gained through decades of work.

All Altek Italian Design products are certified CATAS and BIFMA.
N/A

We scour archives, drawings and museums to reveal what makes for mastery. The result? Architectmade is a glimpse into a few, rare design objects that some of Denmark’s leading architects created along their way to fame many years ago.

Why do we do it? Our passion goes beyond form and function. We believe in moving away from a throw away culture and celebrating timeless products that last. These are products you don’t get tired of looking at, and with excellent craftsmanship alongside three rounds of quality control, they are made to stand the test of time. The Architectmade objects are designed to share, for generations to come.
These products, as stated by one of our favorites, Kristian Vedel, “emerge from the inside out.”Each Architectmade object is designed with architect-precision and personal vision that comes from the heart, reflecting the individual values, beliefs and ways of life of some of the greatest Danish architects of our time.

Testament to their elegant simplicity and refined craftsmanship, they’ve become icons, standing the test of time and serving as reminder that in today’s trending world, quality is still timeless.

The thread of design
Woven wool, furnishing accessories, a laid table, the feel of the material under your fingers, an idea that represents a break from the usual interpretations. An armchair that transmits its comfort in an irresistible, almost telepathic manner, a lamp that emits its light. Tables, coffee tables, round, oval, large, small. Mirrors, candlesticks and lamps reflect beams of light and shade like in a dream. Then there are vases, boxes, containers and trays to hold life’s everyday items. Every object is contextualised to last in time, to stir the emotions: if merely displayed they would only lose their poetry. And so they pose and wait, dialogue with the others, a study in consistency and simplicity: underneath there is a common thread that unites them.

Unconventional aesthetics
Atipico is a project that breaks the mould of design and makes it part of everyday life. Strictly ‘made in Italy’, it seeks to make every aspect of our daily lives more beautiful. No traces of immobility, a continuous flux of ideas and relations, an amalgam of visions: decorative aspects and functionality form an indissoluble union. Fusions of materials - cement, cork, fabric, iron, glass - result in a minimalist, highly elegant aesthetic.

We choose people, not just ideas
There is continuous research behind the Atipico project, a rewarding dialogue with young designers, a rich exchange of ideas, a joint effort that brings together visions, concepts, practices, techniques. Suggestions stem from personal paths, from a preference for this or that material, from the inventions of a specific moment. Everything is fertile, never seen, embraced and compared with the Atipico philosophy and its passion for design. The result are objects designed for those that are looking for something new, different in form and functionality, consistent in their strength, in their beauty, protagonists of a lifestyle that is different, better.
AUX  designs and manufactures innovative household kithenware with unique design concepts.

Adolfo Abejón © is the meeting point for the handmade process, for believing in small production and in limited short series. It gathers work based on respect for the local craft and that highlights the communication between every aspect involved in creation; it banishes the mass production concept and understands collaborative mentality.

This design concept merges humble aesthetics and quality philosophy; the conscious essence of the materials and the comprehension of their honesty. Calm and purity are two lines of work that peacefully coexist with their environment. These are presence exercises.

Adolfo Abejón is also the person behind the brand; based in Barcelona, he still believes there’s a place for furniture with a soul.

aëdle is a Paris based company made up of engineers, designers and music lovers. 
Striving for perfection, we are dedicated to make beautiful products that carry your music in the best possible way. 

Our products boast of: 

* High-end design with exclusive use of noble and high-technicity materials such as aircraft grade aluminium and lambskin leather
* Audiophiles were not forgotten as our audio system integrate outstanding 40 mm titanium drivers with a particular attention to stereo and immersive frequencies enhancement.

Our headphones are hand-assembled in France.

Music is a journey!

agustav is a joint venture of designers and furniture makers Agusta Magnusdottir and Gustav Johannsson. Inspired by the available space on the walls of their apartment, they began conceptualizing functional products to accommodate their needs for storage. Once the apartment was fully furnished their creativity needed an outlet and that's where "agustav" came to life. Multipurpose furniture and items with an edge to their function is a keynote in their design process. It's the beauty in the offbeat that makes up their drive and what centers the whole company.
Currently located in Denmark they hand-build each and every item in their workshop in Copenhagen.

The current collection is comprised of uniform multipurpose house-ware items designed to lighten and brighten everyday living. Each item’s foundation is a wall mounted piece, the rack itself. Each piece is designed to be able to take on any type of pin. In that way today’s book rack can double as tomorrow’s coat – or bed side rack; simply by mixing and matching the pins to suit whatever purpose fits best for the specific space it is placed in. The racks are designed to complement the items they carry and in their minimalism work as a stylish addition to any home.

‘Alban’ is derived from ‘Albion’ an old historical English name for Britain and ‘Alba’ a Scottish Gaelic name for Scotland We are a small, independent London based studio that designs and manufactures limited edition production runs of lifestyle, recreational and urban bicycle bags. Our ethos is to produce bags that look as good on as well as off your bike, designed for people who just want to jump on their bike and ride. Alban aims to offer inclusive, affordable, stylish cycling and the design story is borne and influenced by a British, utilitarian and minimalistic aesthetic.  We use traditional materials of canvas, vegetable tanned leather and nickel hardware across our range, to deliver a modern and timeless range of styles as well as a cycling practicality and functionality. We collaborate with London based design partners and, depending on the project, work with both design students and specialist designers with experience in high end fashion and sports brands. We also partner and collaborate with specialists in materials and fabric for testing, R&D and development and future projects.  All our bags are handmade in small batches, each designed to be a timeless addition to your bike, and your wardrobe.

With _All The World’s A Page_, typographic designers from Berlin studios State and Troppo have proven that it is possible to print great works of literature on a single sheet of paper. The idea behind this collection of unusual prints is as simple as it is fascinating to behold: every single word of a literary or scientific classic reproduced as a 70 x 100 cm poster. Type sizes vary, but never exceed 5.5pt. Art created by designers,  who know every trick in the book.

Allocacoc was founded by Yixia Jiang and Arthur Limpens, two industrial design engineers from the Delft University of Technology in the Netherlands. 
Since its inception, Allocacoc focuses on setting a different standard, and as such a standard is not limited to a country’s borders we had a strong international focus from the start onwards. In fact, our first order did not even come from the Netherlands, but from Germany.

AMAZONAS was founded in 1995 and is the biggest wholesaler of hammocks, stands and accessories in Europe and among the top manufacturers of hammocks worldwide. Since almost 20 years we constantly follow our maxim to provide the best quality at an attractive price!
AMAZONAS Headquarter is located in the near of Munich, Germany. We additionally run an office in Shanghai, China. Furthermore, the production plant in Brazil is our own factory. Together with a Brazilian, we bought the complex in 1996, renovated the buildings and purchased new modern weaving looms. The pace of growth was so fast that, in 2002, the old buildings were torn down and replaced by a new, state-of-the-art production hall. The modern hall has been equipped with additional looms and a new dust extraction system to ensure a dust-free working environment. As the factory works exclusively for us, the cooperation between the production in Brazil and our head office in Germany is very close.
We visit the production facility several times a year, which enables us to regularly verify the working conditions and product quality in the Amazonas manufacture. We guarantee that only skilled adults are employed there—so that their children have the chance to attend school regularly!
The export of AMAZONAS hammocks today provides more than 100 workers with a secure job. The majority of them is paid two to three times the minimum legal wage, which offers them and their families a steady income. In addition, they enjoy social standards which are largely unheard of in the rural areas of Brazil, such as social security, health insurance and paid holidays. Exports to Europe provide further benefits for the workers. The quality of the raw materials we use corresponds to European standards.
The environmental compatibility of the dyes used does not just help the rivers and streams in Brazil, but also means a healthy working environment for the workers who process the dyed cotton. Also, ear muffs for hearing protection are used practically nowhere else except in our factory. In order to ensure the high quality of our products, we furthermore have our hammocks analysed at regular intervals for azo dyes, heavy metals, formaldehyde and other pollutants. As environment protection is one of our core principles, we use a straightforward technique to turn remnants back into yarn. Because the fibers are shorter than during the original process, they are stabilized by adding a maximum of 15 % polyester threads. Only materials are used in which the dyes have been strictly monitored (for example, tested for skin sensitivity). That's why we at AMAZONAS produce our (coloured) hammocks this way – and help preserve the world's natural resources and protect the environment. In order to complement the regular quality checks performed by independent test institutes on our behalf, AMAZONAS has installed its own test bench in its office premises in Gräfelfing. This test bench, which has been specially developed to test the load-bearing capacity of hammocks, hanging chairs and stands, enables a maximum stress test of up to 600 kg (by means of filled sand sacks in 10 kg increments). We are thus now able to test new models for their load-bearing capacity ourselves, while existing tests of currently marketed hammocks and hanging chairs will of course continue to be performed. In this way, we are able to guarantee the special quality of our products on a constant basis. Last but not least we donate every year € 20.000 to "The Little Nazareno Association", an aid project for street children of Fortaleza, Northeast Brazil. Our contribution benefits the children directly. So you can relax with complete peace of mind and don ́t forget... Hammocks make you happy!

Ana Zaja Petrak is a graphic designer and illustrator, working and living in Zagreb, Croatia.
After finishing Graphic Design at the Faculty of Architecture / School of Design, she worked for many years in the graphic design field, then a few years ago she returned to drawing which has always been her first love. 
Since then she has worked on illustration projects for clients all over the world, most of them food related: Carluccio's, Jamie's Magazine, Whole Foods Market, Fairtrade Foundation UK, IKEA, Conde Nast, Penguin Random House, BBC, Pams, Papyrus, Paris Baguette...
When not creating in her studio, she enjoys spending time with her 2 amazing little boys.

And Then Design is a Nottingham based furniture studio established in 2008 by Samuel Wright.At And Then Design we are passionate about producing fresh and imaginative design solutions. Quality is very important to us, and we are proud that all our our products are designed and made it the UK, mostly across the Midlands, and where possible we source our raw materials and components from the UK also.Alongside our core range, designed by Samuel Wright, we also support other young designers to bring their exciting new products to the market. We are dedicated to supporting the next generation of young designers. Oliver Hrubiak has collaborated one developing Charlie and Oscar whilst The Lean Collection is by Frank Flavell and The Wire Collection by Chris Oswin.

Our factory has been present on the leather accessories market for over fifty years as one of the most important handmade-bag factory in Naples, a place where there is a strong and old tradition in working leather products. 
In 2004 the factory has begun an innovating process, through marketing strategies, focused on product and brand image repackaging. It has focused its attention on a young target, and for this purpose it has created very original collections, whose masterpiece is the helmet covered with leather in the most fashion colours and patterns that can be also matched with bags and belts. 

On the basis of market trends studies, the factory has developed an international strategic policy and has become a modern company whose products are distributed worldwide. The participation at international fairs, such as "Mipel" in Milan, "Premiere Classe" in Paris, "Bread & Butter" in Spain, as well as advertising and promotion actions have brought ANDREA CARDONE srl to the attention of a large number of buyers, press and distributors from all over the world. The company is characterized by a young and friendly environment. 

Andrea, leader and soul of the company, represents the new management generation. Thanks to his creativity, tradition and innovation have found their common point in a product that is produced according the 50 years experienced know-how, but following the needs of in-fashion and dynamic buyers. 
The development of our company has been accompanied also by the transformation of our Company Brand that now is easily recognizable for colours and effective graphic design, and is coherent to the new aimed target.

Angle & Curve is a headphone manufacturer based in London's Old Covent Garden. We are a collective of designers, audio engineers and DJ's. Our binding passion is music and we aim to create exciting headphones with  distinctive yet clean lines and superb audio performance.

In 2002, Anne Linde graduated from Manchester Metropolitan University, England, with a degree in Three Dimensional Design, after which she returned to Denmark. Originally creating designs for a number of furniture companies, in 2003, she made the bold decision to produce the designs herself, in order to fully realize her vision.  

”Coming from the fashion industry I ventured into a new world of materials like metal, wood and glass and lost my heart to metals. I find metal fantastic. I love its sleek elegant expression that can be formed, bent, cast in infinite ways. It is a living, strong and durable material which is timeless. The organic aspects of my designs add a soft and sculptural feel to the metal that fit into all kinds of interior”

Anne Linde lives in Hellerup, Copenhagen with her husband Christian and their two children.

Anour is a Danish design company established in 2007 in Copenhagen.

The name Anour is derived from the founder, Architect Arash Nourinejad, and in short means light in Farsi. 

We manufacture handcrafted quality lamps for the discerning customer.
A lamp of uncompromising design, visionary functionality, quality and exquisite materials. 

Our company is based on sustainability in design, production and technology.
We focus on the proud traditions of craftsmanship and work hard to preserve Danish made designs as a central part of our identity.

Areaware is a New York City based producer of everyday objects that are functional and unusual. Our goal is to create thoughtful products that inspire an emotional response. We like to think we have a good sense of humor and that our objects are poetic. We wish to create a forum for young and local talent and together become a strong voice for American design. We believe that appreciation for beauty is central to what it means to be alive and want to embody this principle in even the simplest things.

Elastico was born in 2008 from a simple concept: an elastic bandage in tension between two elements on the wall. The bookshelf is the perfect, innovative solution to hold and display books, pictures and various kinds of objects. All thanks to the elastic strength, the shape of the shelf itself is infinitely variable, depending on what you store and how you choose to display it.

Ariel, a graduate of “Shenkar” institute of design, is an independent designer for “Keter”, one of the world's leading companies in plastic consumer products. He has also designed a wide range of products, including DIY items for the North American and European market, outdoor and indoor storage solutions, and solar lighting designs. Ariel specializes in consumer accessories, furniture and lighting.Products designed by Ariel has been exhibited in museums, galleries, and published in magazines and the media.The approach of smart and simple serves as a guiding in his work, and it implemented in the product. The studio applies a fresh and innovative approach leading to an appealing and unique design culminating in a smart and simple product which makes sense to the user.

"WHOA!! DON'T GET ME WRONG: I hate it just as much as I <3 it! I'm thrilled by its constant transformation, following seemingly pointless paths that ultimately reflect or sometimes are even ahead of the Zeitgeist!! I'm inspired by the way it gives tangible shape to ideas and theories, the way it ignites epochal changes because everything that is aesthetic is also deeply if tangentially political! You know. I'm amazed how a symbioses of optical physics and the vibrance of light create shape, which, far from being static becomes, thanks to design, a porous membrane that can be drastically reconfigured at any time!

Unlike any other sculptural medium light is constantly in motion, traveling in straight lines! These objects explicitly engage the spatial and sensory aspects of light, it's aesthetics and it's immaterially, by unfolding the complexity of our encounters with the myriad aspects of the raw material light! 'Light Design' is quite simply the clamorous demonstration that the material is shaped by the immaterial, and not the other way around! Yay!!"

We are a London based Design Studio who design & produce contemporary British furniture. We are proud to have built up a reputation for designing quality pieces that are manufactured employing the best of British craftsmanship and use the highest quality materials that have been carefully selected for their function, aesthetics and durability.  We design & create quality products which are comfortable, refined and built to last.

Our picture of the world is never static

Atmosphere - a collection of stylish and contemporary globes - is created for the ultimate viewing experience. The maps are designed individually and the globes are manufactured to perfection.
A globe should be part of every home - for decoration and more importantly, for education. Because it is the only true representation of our world - the only way to understand the distance between continents, the diversity of countries and the vastness of the ocean.

Atmosphere brings the globe to your home. Now there´s no excuse not to own one.

Atolyia creates textiles of the highest quality, using natural fibres and traditional techniques. 
We build on our strong textile heritage in Turkey to create items that are luxurious and authentic with a contemporary edge. Atolyia was founded in Istanbul by close friends, Shenol and Verity Kizek, and Sena and Ozer Ozturk, with a vision to share the rich heritage of Turkish textiles, while bringing a fresh and modern take to these authentic items via Australian design touch.

The word «ANYSETIERS» does not exist in the dictionary. It originally stems from the word «ANISE» in old french. The word «ROY» means king in old french.
«AUX ANYSETIERS DU ROY» was first a restaurant located in the old PARIS quarters, L'Ile Saint-Louis (Saint-Louis Island), near Notre-Dame. The building is classified as one of the historic monuments in PARIS.It dates from the 17th century. At one time it used to be a cabaret.
The restaurant was specialized in provencal cooking, using olive oil, aromatic herbs, garlic, etc... It was one of the first restaurants to offer grilled meats seasoned with Provence herbs, as the LOMBARD family originally came from Provence. It was very fashionable to frequent this restaurant in the 60's, where you could meet celebrities such as Salvador Dali, who signed a small Provence herbs crock, as well as Brigitte Bardot, Jerry Lewis, ...
At the end of his/her dinner, each customer was offered a small gift : the small «Herbes de Provence» crock, special blend prepared by LOUIS LOMBARD, who was the first to include lavender flowers in the aromatic herbs.
The success of this little crock gave us the idea to produce and commercialize a line of speciality items packed in clay and stoneware pots. They are made in a small village in the Drôme, near VALENCE (south of LYON). 
We create our own recipes: special blends of aromatic herbs and spices, mustards, vinegars, marinated olives, olive oil with herbs, sea-salts and aromatic pepper with herbs, teas, honeys, flavored sugars, chocolate fondues... The crocks and bottles are filled up by hand.
Olive oil amphoras and vinegar bottles are closed with a wax seal. It is a craftmanship production, original and exclusive.

Ever since its foundation in 1966, B&B Italia has been a leader in the contemporary furnishing sector. 
The company has won international acclaim as a representative of Italian furniture design, both for homes (B&B Italia home division) and public areas (B&B Italia contract division). 
The group’s headquarters are located north of Milan, in a prestigious building designed by Renzo Piano and Richard Rogers.
B&B Italia’s furnishings collection stems from the group’s capacity to represent contemporary culture and respond quickly to the new needs that emerge from today’s evolving lifestyles.

EVOKE SENSES

B&O PLAY delivers stand-alone products with clear and simple operations - portable products that are intuitive to use, easy to integrate into your daily life, and deliver excellent high-quality experiences.

We want to evoke senses, to elevate the experience of listening and watching. We have spoken to musicians and studio recorders who all love the fact that more people listen to music in more places, but hate the fact that the quality of the listening experience has been eroded. We want to provide the opportunity to experience media in a convenient and easy way but still in outstanding high quality.

OUR HERITAGE

Firmly grounded in our 88 year history in Bang & Olufsen, we interpret the same core values for a new type of contemporary products: 

Design         
We seek design that matters. Design that naturally makes our products express how they want to be used. To us, design is not just the beautiful shape we wrap our technology in. Our design approach flows through all aspects of product development – from crystalizing the fundamental user needs in early concept development through the engineering phases. This allows us to deliver products where we never compromise on the basic product idea.

Performance  
We deliver best sound and acoustic performance in our class of products – natural and balanced to best reproduce the emotions that the artist wanted to convey.

Humanization
We adapt technology to fit human needs, not the other way around.

Craftsmanship
We are always honest in our material choices and pay attention to every detail in the design and assembly.

BALMUDA Inc. was established in 2003 in Tokyo. Since our founding, we have designed our products to be manufactured, sold, and used under one guiding philosophy: To make the most from the minimum.

This means using the minimum number of parts. Pursuing beauty through minimalist design and providing the greatest benefit with minimal use of energy. This approach isn't achieved through just a single burst of inspiration. It's the result of years of continuous effort and research.

Making the most from the minimum. And developing technological innovations to benefit the user. 
We hope our products and their features will give you a sense of our vision for the future.

Antique oak wood which for years have contained unique wines now become support for glasses is definitely unique. Transparent frames and tinted lenses as berries.. Our grandpas called them "barricole", for us are Barriqule.

“I was in the cellar where my family has been producing wine for several generations, when I noticed a few barrels stacked in a corner, ready to be burned having exhausted their task: to hold for several years the precious wines that have made it so famous our territory. And from there the idea. Reuse aged oak barrels, turning them into temples, for shades coloured of the wine that they “jealously” guarded until now. “

Lorenzo Del Tufo - founder
Aesthetic and functional design pieces of furniture inspired by nature, created by two Finnish sisters.

Stay positive with BIXBIT furniture.

BIXBIT is a young, Poland-based furniture brand that follows the idea of connecting young, creative minds with over 20 years’ experience in furniture industry in the desire to make a contribution to the international design scene.

BIXBIT develops its own aesthetical language with great attention to practical and functional design aspects.  Designed and manufactured in Poland with unique value for its creators that results in exquisite craftsmanship.

The brand name comes from a rare gemstone that enhances positive energy and brings harmony around.

BIXBIT product range includes coffee and side tables, cabinets , sideboards and bookshelves. 
More information: www.bixbit.com / www.shop.bixbit.com

Form follows function’ Architect Louis Sullivan said in 1900s. This statement has affected many modernism architects and designers in many ways. Even till today, it is considered to be the truth and BLC Brand also evolves from this statement. However, BLC also adds philosophy and identity beyond performance to the brand so that the functionality comes within the bag rather than from the bag. BLC also tries to create a form that is subtle but rebellious.

BMIX, established October 2012,
translates everyday objects into emotionally expressive items through design.
 
BMIX is made up of three designers in product and furniture design and builds its position
as the design oriented company through participations in several aspects of designproduct salesand design fair participations with the start of  '2012 Seoul Art Fair',  '2012 Seoul Design Festival' and '2013 Paris Maison & Objet' and activities within the designers' group.
 
All BMIX products are designed and produced in Korea with the three designers responsible
from product and graphic design to new concept build-up and product promotion.
BMIX reaches out to you with outstanding quality and design that aims for fusion between art and design, classic and modern, and analog and digital.
 
BMIX strive to produce the best design products through research and development that answers the needs of the customers with the aim of producing practical and useful products.
We hope all our customers can sympathize and enjoy the products we designed with delight.

At first glance, tradition and innovation stand in opposition—but that's not always the case. Take a close look at BOJ and it's clear: founded in Eibar in 1905, the Spanish label has always kept its sights on innovation and reinvention, both of itself and its refined collection of wine accessories. The award-winning label is dedicated to handcraftsmanship, a value that has taken its products to the permanent collection of Eibar's Museo de la Industria Armera and the pages of countless publications. First created in 1954, designer David Olañeta's wall-mounted corkscrews bring the concepts of innovation and tradition into flawless harmony.

The minmin furniture line from Branka Blasius Bureau draws on wide-ranging experience in the fields of architecture, exhibition and product design to create objects and furniture that reflect a basic commitment to simplicity and everyday relevance. The label's current collection ranges from multifunctional modular systems to individual sideboards—all underpinned by a belief in the role design can play in providing intelligent solutions for everyday life.Thoroughness, objectness, and the integration into various areas of everyday life are its main features. Furniture = object.

All work is designed and made by Jakub Velinsky (from idea up to the end product). Our interior concrete products are suitable for modern. interiors like homes, offices, bars, restorants... characterized by simple industrial unusual design thanks to contrast of grey structured concrete and coloured materials. Each concrete item has original design due to air bubbles which are not on purpose removed from mold completely. So there are no two identital products. We face the concrete.

Bamboobee is a brand that incorporates timeless style into your everyday life. With products crafted to be only of the highest quality. 
These products are a perfect match for those, who appreciate the iconic inspiration that nature provides, as well as unique design and high attention to details. 
The very nature of the bamboo grass ensures that every Bamboobee product is unique. All artisans at Bamboobee are expertly trained to select only the finest bamboo and transform it into beautiful works of functional art.

Bellila is a furniture design brand. Founded in 2013, it is the result of a collaboration between independent designer Paul Bellila, young entrepreuneur Julien Bitan, and marketing and communication expert Sophie Bellier.

"Bellila offers a range of interior furniture that allows nature to enter your home. Thanks to an innovative concept, the customizable Volcane collection allows you to create your own landscape : zen garden, Mediterranean, or even a kitchen garden, the choice is yours. The top quality selection of wood comes from eco friendly forests, and the the expertise of our manufacturers provide a production that is 100% made in France."

For over 90 years, Bialetti has been telling the story of the values of our tradition through a path of aromas, colours and flavours that speak of the home, of daily habits and conviviality; it speaks of the dedication to design, attention to details, of knowing how to simplify every gesture in the kitchen; transmitting quality, passion, experience and reliability. 

A witness to an era and a culture that have helped to spread in the world the originality and innovativeness of Italian design, Bialetti has revolutionised the pleasure of preparing coffee, and strong in its expertise it continues to evolve and renew its own products to cater to the needs of each individual Italian kitchen.

Still today it is a testimonial of experience and of the will to add value and beauty to everyday life in the kitchen with products of rigorous functionality, great technology and reliability, with a modern design and a quality of absolute excellence. From coffee makers to the world of espresso and pots and pans, the Bialetti brand continues to be synonymous with genuine pleasure, expertise and passion.
Changing the way people listen to the world.

Block was formed in 2000; I had finished a degree in the applied arts which gave me a love of form and proportion. To translate this aesthetic into a producible product range I then went on to do an engineering course, this gave me the practical knowledge I needed to translate the aesthetic I now had into a working product range.

Twelve years on I’m still the lead designer at Block, we now have a small team of designers who are just as passionate as me. We have a very distinctive style and a love of colour, our passion for colour is the inspiration behind every design.

Contemporary design tends to be stark, minimal and in very masculine, corporate colour ways, we want to show that cutting edge design can be produced in confident, modern and trend driven colour ways.
Bluedive

Under the creative direction of Dominic Symons, the Bluelounge team is a vibrant collective that champions ingenuity and embraces the imagination to fuel innovation.

The constant drive to invent problem-solving products you didn't know you needed, but can't live without, has landed Bluelounge more than a dozen design awards, patents and distribution in over 46 countries.

Booo is a consumer electronics brand that is specialized in lighting for the home/design and the professional market, best known for its Booo Design Lamps, the Surface Tension Lamp and Smart Booo. The Brand collaborates with some well-known designers from all over the world and together present innovative and beautiful products.  
The company is based in Eindhoven, the Netherlands and employs people from many different nationalities.

Designer Jaanus Orgusaar is an award-winning Estonian designer, who became famous in the early 90-ies as a shoe- and fashion designer. He turned to product design five years ago founding his own studio Borealis in 2010 and now also practices as architect combining the two. His creations stand out of trends, they are autonomous and unquestionably original. His main feature is his three-dimensional thinking. His stock in trade is modelling 3D objects out of two- dimensional sheet materials. His mind travels on a trajectory following the path of bionic structures and patterns of universe. Borealis has been noted for its high quality uniqe and modern plywood furniture since 2010, exhibiting in various fairs over Europe.

Boskke is derived from the old English word ‘bosky’ which means ‘a small forest’ — and that’s exactly what you can create with our intelligent, eco-sensitive designs.Our studio has been developing new urban gardening products since 2007. We stand for evolved garden design, and encourage greenery in homes and workplaces. Boskke products celebrate all growing things, because we know that spaces that can sustain plants are beautiful, healthy and bring vitality to the built environment.
The first Polish creativity incubator focusing on young designers. We dig up fresh and beautiful projects and turn them into very well crafted products with an excellent price tag.

Time has evolved since the establishment of the Brdr. Krüger in 1886, yet the company’s dedication to craftsmanship and their passion for wood hasn’t changed a bit. 

Brdr. Krüger’s design dna is born out of the aesthetics of the mid-century Danish modern movement, reinterpreted for a contemporary audience. With a design philosophy that encourages originality, honesty and playfulness, Brdr. Krüger seeks to bring a new turn on tradition, in close creative partnership with prominent designers and architects of the times.

Founded in 1886 by the two Krüger brothers Theodor and Ferdinand, the company was originally a woodturning workshop and is today a self-producing design company, where the commitment to quality and craftsmanship has been nurtured for five generations, ensuring the same high quality in every piece that leaves the family-owned workshop.
I am an artist, illustrator, and painter. My designs are mostly illustrative with colourful burst. My approach is either surreal, minimalist, or simple and friendly.

Bulb Attack is a Spanish brand longing for simple, applicative designs, and the nostalgic warmth of a bulb filament. We take pride in offering a wide choice of power cord colours, as well as great fixture and lampshade customizability. The power cord may vary in length, which paired with a practical and supple suspension system allow ample freedom in interior lighting designs.

It all started with an idea of using the timeless image of a light bulb. It is a symbol of lighting and... of a good idea!

Bulbo is an Italian start-up born from the confidence that food revolution starts from our homes, turning them into places of knowledge and protection of nature.

We want to promote a relation between urban people and nature by raising city dwellers awareness about agriculture through a direct day-by-day experience. We envisage smart and creative solutions for indoor farming in urban environments all year round.

Bulbo designs and produces highly innovative LED lights for growing vegetables, herbs, flowers and succulents at home. Our products are beautifully crafted and incredibly easy to use. They perfectly match the natural element and combine functionality, advanced technology and Made in Italy top class design.

After several years of scientific research and experimentation, in 2012, Bulbo won the Spinner European competition which provides funds to young entrepreneurs in order to promote research and create business opportunities in the field of technology. From the very beginning we tried to apply the same principles both to agriculture and industry by looking for smart solutions for industrial production in times of crisis. The entire production process is made in Italy, working along with specialised artisans and using high quality materials only.

The project, which started in 2009 as a technological research in the Industrial Design Faculty at the Politecnico di Milano, has developed its scientific research in collaboration with Research Center in Urban Enviroment for Agriculture and Biodiversity, Department of Agricultural Sciences, University of Bologna – Alma Mater Studiorum.

A rowdy nightingale from a beloved fairytale inspired the name of Danish label Bulbul, and Lars Larsen, Bjarke Ingels and Jens Martin Skibsted—the three creatives behind design trio KiBiSi and Bulbul's first collection—take a fittingly unconventional and free-as-a-bird approach to their work. With works from their numerous projects on display in the collections of museums like New York's MoMA and the Centre National des Arts Plastiques in Paris, KiBiSi's minimalist wristwatches for Bulbul are set to fly right into the realm of design classics.

CM AOX is a collaboration between German product designer Alex Freudenberger and Swiss fashion and textile designer Caroline Minar, both alumni of Central Saint Martins. Each CM AOX item is produced with the use of modern laser cutting technology and hand finished in London.

LESS DESIGN MORE STORIES

Cool enough studio explores various characteristics of the ordinary objects we interact with everyday.
These ordinary objects have people’s emotional attachment and we believe they can be physically integrated into the products.
We observe & recreate the meaning of ordinary objects.
 
We create products that reflect our lives.

With the strength of aesthetic tradition which combines the concept of elegance with that of simplicity, COVO, italian DNA and international roots, has made itself the perfect interpreter of these two terms developing an autonomus and distinctive language, capable of marrying tradition and contemporaneity classicism and avantgarde design. With its first steps through the severity of form and signs exported from Orient, it gives character to its products while at the same time remaining faithful to its origins, enriching them progressively with new and costant stimulation from the world of design. With and sensitive eye, it directs and manages research that ranges from the skilful uses of materials to the giving body to the voices of designers, permitting itself an occasion to go with an ironic spirit into the field of experimentation, without overstepping the limit into useless showmanship. The fantasy of form and attention to materials become the protagonists and the final product shines with a fresh and extremely personal aesthetic without sacrificing functionally. A strong identity founded on a primary need of feasibilty, a harmonius marriage of form and content, a brand capable of seducing and conquering the attention of an ever more vast public thanks to the unceasing serch for a point of balance, in real and not apparent terms.

Crane Bell Co. is a Osaka based company specialized in making some of the most beautiful and best sounding bicycle bells on the planet. 

The designs have remained unchanged for decades, the company`s goal is to provide users with top-of-the-line products. 

Once you ring a Crane Bell you`ll quickly realize why Bikers all over the world agree that when looking for a bell, the Crane Bell Company is the first on their list.

"At CRUX Supply Co. we believe that quality outlives notoriety, that heritage outshines glamour, that integrity solidifies personality. We believe in the hearty laughs of our grandfathers, in well-worn suits, in tools that show their toil. We believe that quality comes before quantity, and that craft ages with grace and substance. Whether it be leather that grows more supple with wear or hammered brass whose patina deepens with every year, CRUX Supply Co.'s products are chosen for their staying power -- their power to carry stories of work and adventure from one generation to the next. 


All men seek to weave their own tales of adventure and daring. And while we believe that men are made of what's inside, a dash of dapper never hurt. At CRUX Supply Co., we furnish your stories with apparel, accessories, and grooming products that are built to last. Our vintage collections have survived the test of time, matured with dignity and strength, and are ready for new life with a new generation. Whether our customers are seeking dapper digs, utilitarian bags, or a clean shave, CRUX Supply Co. prides itself on being a premium vendor for reliable, well-designed goods. As we say, fine goods for fine men."

Origin: United States

Light and colour – two things that together lift our mood, make us smile and generally put a spring in our step. And that’s where Cable & Cotton can help. We sell colourful fairy lights in thousands of colour combinations to liven up your living room, pep up your office, add some mood to your place of inspiration or act as a soothing night light for your child’s bedroom.We are here to add a splash of colour to your life.

Both the products and our company have their origin in a newly purchased kitchen lamp. Looked great, but there was a problem. It was impossible to get the ceiling rose to fit right. With an interest in interior design, this was a disturbing element in an otherwise fully satisfactory kitchen. The actual idea of being able to turn a ceiling rose inside out came to our designer Lars Wettre while he was trying to sleep. The morning after he started work with making a rose that could be turned inside out so as to meet all the demands placed on a ceiling rose. Lars and his colleague Jonas Forsman worked together in developing the innovative and multiple awarded function and design of the ceiling rose, which received the name CableCup. 

We are careful with quality at all steps and the material is the most important factor for the product’s function. Due to this, considerable emphasis has been put on choosing the right material and the right supplier – a supplier with the necessary skills for transforming the material into the finished product. Production is conducted in Sweden by experienced injection moulders using modern machinery. Assembly is on our premises and each product is inspected for quality at least twice before being placed in shop packaging. They are then packed and sent out to our resellers.

The most successful design integrates itself organically into our living spaces, and not just on a superficial level. It also has to get it right in terms of sustainability, mastering the environmental sense as much as the aesthetic. Young Swedish label Calabaz does exactly that with its lighting: long-lasting, energy-saving LEDs that live inside harmoniously constructed lightwares, each designed to take the cradle to cradle principle to heart. Unafraid to get a bit inventive, Calabaz's stylish lighting collection is the future of eco-friendly design.

Cameron Design House is a lighting design and manufacturing company, founded by designer Ian Cameron in 2013 to offer the ultimate purchasing and product experience in the interior lighting design market. We intend to build a global brand offering and promoting innovative, conscientious and quality design.

Cameron has adopted a unique design aesthetic, amalgamated from his childhood visits to the tranquil Scandinavian countryside and his urban upbringing in the bustling city of London. With an equal attention to form and function, Cameron combines natural, engineered, and technological elements to create beautiful, contemporary and innovative lighting pieces.

Our lights are carefully crafted at our Primrose Hill (London) studio. All fabrication and production is performed in-house to ensure the highest level in quality and creative control of every piece. We hold regular studio open days and viewings are available by appointment.

Cameron Design House is committed to understanding the cause and effect of our activities as an enterprise, and will maintain an ethical stance on managing our environmental and social impact. From product materials to packaging, we maximise and reuse (where possible) our materials and resources, monitoring waste carefully. Timber is exclusively sourced from Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) approved companies, ensuring our support of sustainable forestry management. The lighting source systems themselves are in the most efficient rating bracket (Energy Class: A), ensuring a responsible product for contentious consumers.

Expect a lead time of 14-28 days from ordering (depending on order size and product variance), this is the necessary time for us to deliver on the highest quality in materials and workmanship. We ship our products worldwide in personalised packaging, ensuring the best in security and protection.

We also offer a light consulting service, in which we can arrange residential or commercial visits offering visual (3D Scanned) bespoke solutions to your interior lighting needs.

Terenzi srl manufactures the full range of Caoscreo products and has been dealing for over 40 years with the industrialization of technical and design products for renowned companies, supporting its clients in several phases: planning and co-design, engineering, prototyping, construction and industrial production; hence the desire to design and implement the brand Caoscreo, a line of its own, modern, innovative and interesting design. Caoscreo proposes home accessories, lighting with a young, dynamic, 100% Italian design, which is sensitive to aesthetics and to the environment, without sacrificing functionality and accessibility. Each Caoscreo product is available in different colors and textures and in different special natural metals; moreover, it is possible to customize some objects.

Working in one discipline informs another. Artist, furniture designer, and trained architect Carlos Silva has worked across a few and the influences are clear throughout his work: his prints have an architectural quality, with clean lines and unusual, built-up structures. Colombian but based in Berlin since 2000, the talented creative is a founder of Superstudio Architecture in Bogota and Berlin collective super bien!, who exhibit art in unconventional spaces. Proof that straying outside the boundaries makes for the most interesting work.

Giancarlo Di Bassi is a premium Home and Living Brand that was established in Venice by Giancarlo Bassi. The Bassi Family is known as one of the founding families in Venice that helped build the trade industry and offered the finest of silks and satins imported by neighboring countries of the Adriatic. The Bassi Towels, and bed linens are known for their soft materials, unique designs and high quality thread count.
Cheero specializes in creating innovative power backup solutions to support technology.

We strive to create products that are the best they can be in every way. Products that are beautiful, easy to use and powerful. So we started our path with the Kickstarter campaign, where we raised $300,000 from more than 5,000 backers from all over the globe. Since then we’ve helped users find over 350,000 misplaced things and made life easier to 200,000 people.

Our dream began riding along the wide countryside or down-town sitting on the crossbar of grandfather’s bicycle. Then the bicycle became our saddle-horse, our jet, our racing car. We were on the seat at any time, the ground floating beneath our feet. Scraped knees and some scars coming along.
Our passion never has faded, today the bike is our vehicle and we love to watch our children learning to ride it.
The fresh morning breeze in our faces, thoughts run free.
We believe in the bicycle as the ideal modern urban means of transport, economic and practical.
Cicli Velocista is all this: urban, perfect in form and beauty, Italian.
Our bicycles are completely manufactured in Italy, of high quality and distinguished Italian retro design. They are our dream come true, capable to accompany us all day, year in and year out, in the city as well as on our excursions to country.

Everyone should get the chance to supply oneself with solar energy on the go, and have fun at the same time. That’s why we develop solar products suitable for everyday use, which produce a maximum output of energy on a minimal surface. Equipped with contemporary’s best components, all solar chargers of the Sonnenrepublik are small, handy and highly efficient.

Click & Grow was made to take complete care of your herbs and flowers without the hassle of growing plants the regular way. Our smart products will water your plants, provide the extra lighting and love them while you are away. All you need to do is enjoy your life to the fullest. Simply put, Click & Grow makes it possible to experience the childlike excitement of growing plants with zero effort.
As the Chinese proverb says, if you want to be happy for a month, get married, but if you want to be happy for the rest of your life, become a gardener.
When our founder, Mattias Lepp, created the first Click & Grow, the coolest thing was to see how children, parents, and busy entrepreneurs would lean over their Click & Grow every five minutes to check for sprouts: These people experienced pure, unmitigated joy and elation. This is what Click & Grow is all about – pure and simple happiness.

The Clint brand was founded in 2008.

Behind the brand is a group of well-established entrepreneurs in the field of digital audio and digital video with roots back to 1994.

The founders of Clint Digital were among the pioneers for digital radio products (DAB/DAB+/Internet radios etc.) in Northern Europe.

The base and key foundation of Clint Digital is to provide well-designed and well-engineered products.

Clint Digital takes pride in being an innovative and forward thinking company. The product range is mainly developed and designed in Denmark and is strongly focused on design and functionality.

Clint Digital thrives to create products including state-of-the-art technology, sophisticated design and user-friendliness for everyone.

Welcome to the world of Clint®

Coco&co édition is born in 2009 , we are two designers and a production manager, we have put together our knowledge to develop our own signature and objects with a strong visual impact.
We design and produce our own creations with a view to offering a range of light fittings and furnishings with a contemporary and refined design.
Our products are all designed and made in france just near Lyon.

Coloud headphones were created in 2012 with the philosophy that perfection is reached not when there’s nothing left to add, but when there’s nothing left to take away. Some call this idea minimalism, a particular form of design that has its roots in Scandinavia. It’s no surprise then that Coloud headphones was born and is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
From the very beginning the idea was to create robust headphones that provide no-nonsense sound. No huge logos, no funny gimmicks, no unnecessary details, just reliable and functional headphones designed to deliver your daily dose of music.
Our headphones are crafted with minimal parts and feature a mechanical construction, making them super durable and built to withstand the pressures of everyday listening. What we do add to our headphones, however, are useful features such as the Tangle-Free System.
From the logo to the packaging to the angles in the headphone design, triangularity is a theme that runs throughout all Coloud products. The inspiration behind this triangle is the Play symbol, denoting the brand’s mantra – always ready to play when you are.
Coloud cares about the environment. This means we comply with standards such as RoHS and REACH. All our products are phthalate and PVC free, and we use packaging that is 100 percent recyclable.
Coloud – always ready to play when you are.

Colé Italian design label is a new brand launched in Milan during Salone del Mobile 2011. Founded by Matteo De Ponti and Laura Macagno, it aims to create a new way of making design, based on a sophisticated expressive research and an unpublished collaboration among all subjects taking part in the productive chain. The first collections, designed in collaboration with Lorenz/Kaz and Aksu/Suardi, Emmanuel Gallina and Hagit Pincovici is the result of rethinking traditional furniture with a certain degree of contamination (of signs, materials, cultures) which leads to read back in light and ironic way many archetypal forms.

Copenhagen cyclists don't kid around. They're on the street year round, come rain, sleet, or snow, and when bike accessories don't match up to their expectations, they simply create ones that do. Founded in 2009 after taking part in a research project for New York City's Department of Parks & Recreation, Copenhagen Parts has worked hard at promoting biking culture and radically changing the way we think about urban mobility. With these innovative magnetic bike lights, co-founders Mads Kjøller Damkjær and Lars Thomsen are one step closer to achieving their lofty goal of a happier, healthier, and better-connected cycling world.

"We make things that cool. We make cool things."

Since we launched, we’ve heard quite a few stories on how we first got the idea for the Corkcicle. And while we wish we’d been inspired while sipping warmish wine in an icicle-rimmed Aspen chalet, that’s not the case. The truth is that Ben Hewitt, Corkcicle’s inventor and company founder, simply loves wine and hated that there wasn’t a better solution to bothersome wine buckets.

In November 2011, Ben started tinkering in his garage making prototype after prototype. 

Aided with the marketing expertise of his friend and business partner, Stephen Bruner, the idea quickly became a reality. More to the point, Stephen brought a high design approach to the product with the name and its icicle form to create our beloved Corkcicle.

As the manufacturing process got underway, it became clear that we needed a rainmaker to help deliver the product and get it effectively introduced to the retail world. A close friend, Eric Miller, VP of Sales at a Fortune 100 medical device company, came on board and has been making it rain Corkcicles ever since.

Together, the three have built a brand that represents true American ingenuity and captures the essence of the entrepreneurial spirit. Proving that great ideas still matter and that with hard work and great partners, anything’s possible.

Corroom is an upcoming design studio focusing on furniture an lighting. It is run by the Berlin based danish industrial designer Gry Elisabeth Peülicke Björge, who graduated from Universität der Künste Berlin in 2013. The manufacturing process of Corroom products is a mix between handcraft and industrial processes. With a preference for natural materials Corroom celebrates the fusion of form, color and functionality. Corroom is contemporary design harmoniously combined with the elegance of the danish design tradition. The name Corroom is a combination of the latin word ´cor´and the english word ´room´, it refers to the danish word ´hjerterum´(heartroom) which stands for openness and hospitality.

Spotting your bag on the luggage carousel is a freakin’ pain. All of a sudden it seems like everyone decided to put a red ribbon on their suitcase to help them distinguish it, you included. For an easier option, there’s Crash Baggage. Each piece comes pre-damaged like it’s already been tossed around a few times by airport personal. Not only does it eliminate the fear of seeing your precious new bag come out all battered, but it sure makes it easier to spot.
BEFORE YOU SAY IT’S SO STUPID, CHECK TO SEE IF YOU ARE WEARING JEANS
WITH PRE-MADE HOLES IN THEM.

Crash Baggage’s distribution network has significantly grown since the brand was born and its collections can currently be found in the most selected design and fashion stores around the world, such as: Merci in Paris, Luisa Via Roma in Florence, Ron Herman and Beams in Tokyo, Beaker in Seoul, Common People in Mexico City, Kapok in Hong Kong and Singapore.
Founded by Francesco Pavia, a young Venetian designer grown up more than familiar with travel and luggage concepts under his father’s know-how and expertise, CRASH BAGGAGE® now stands as one of the most dauntless contemporary brands, incessantly reinventing the way in which hardshell trolleys should be designed, manufactured and styled.

Creamore Mill is a design and woodturning workshop located in rural Shropshire, England. We create an innovative range of functional home and garden accessories which evoke traditional style. Our outlet is mainly through independent retailers across the UK and overseas.

Established by John Buckland in 1981, operations began in a ten foot square former wash house at the family’s previous home with a handful of tools and a wood lathe, and working locally sourced timber. Through this initial period a selection of designs came to the fore and developed the focus of the business.

Having soon run out of space the family moved to Creamore Mill which was formerly both a corn and wood mill dating back many generations. Taking on the Mill in a state of disrepair was a great opportunity, and the renovations carried out revived the Mills past association with woodworking and turning.

Steady improvement led to more mechanisation which is tempered by the high degree of hand work still practiced. Seeing progress from design through to despatch under one roof holds the artisan approach true.

John’s wife Cathryn and their five sons have provided much input over the years and son Sam now shares a leading role. Together with them, long time employee Justin Powell is a key figure in production method and design application.

With three decades of experience and many design originals under our belt, Creamore Mill continues to enjoy the support of its many advocates as a family concern.

Designer Sheli Calacuda specializes in designing complex collections which bring together unexpected connections between different materials .
The design is characterized by its minimalist lines with the products being wearable and affordable.

DAM is about design, craft and furniture. It's about products that tell stories about culture and memories.
Between tradition and modern times, the brand combines materials and traditional techniques with creative and innovative drawing. It appeals to emotions, simplicity and quality of life, in harmony with nature and society. The portuguese culture and the common everyday things are our inspiration to the development

of pieces that adapt themselves to children, youngsters and adults.

Each piece results from synergies between designers, artisans and the industry. This way, we build the bridge between Economy and Culture as we renew a collective heritage that continues genuine and therefore, contrasting. Our goal is to valorize and promote the Portuguese identity throughout the world.

Noé, industrial designer and Maria José, graphic and interior designer, couple, unconscious and hipsters.Two design lovers, that every day shape DENOE.
Denoe design was born from the idea of starting our own project, which would allow us to unleash our creativity. Both were hungry to create our own project, a project where we would liberate our imagination and to create our ideas
To design an object requires a trial and error process. Start with drawings, continue with modeling and finishing with prototypes.
It is a long, dynamic and creative process that requires a multidisciplinary work behind.
In DENOE, we like to communicate this in our designs and products.
Maybe we are talking about almost handicrafts objects, that makes each unique.
Designs with special sensitivity, that give this difference from the rest, perhaps poetic or nostalgic, classic lovers, and with great admiration to our past that opens this door to the future.

Photo accessory has been around for many years and we are not the first online store that sells photo accessories online. But, whilst many other shops have chosen to rely on technology, we strive for the combination of functionality and design.We're passionate about helping people feel individual. We want to put a smile on our customer’s face, each time they look at their camera strap. Because we believe that even small and simple things can make our life a little more "special".So we are trying to bring the most unique and highest quality products to our customers, so that they feel happy each time when they grab their camera gear.  This is how DESIGNSTRAPS started as our first project. It was more of a coincidence but we loved the idea of defining standard camera straps in a new way, bringing people more joy for pursuing their hobby.

Dan Hoolahan is a designer based in Liverpool, UK. He studied 3D Design at University College Falmouth, graduating in 2011. Since then, has worked with various designers and design companies as well as self directed projects and commissions. Dan is influenced by functionality, usability and the way people interact with the things around them. He works in the fields of product, furniture, and exhibition, often experimenting with materials, techniques and form, combining craftsmanship with new technologies.

Since 2010 we design and produce furniture and home objects, preferably made of wood. Clean, modern shapes, premium quality materials and unique detail solutions are the essence of our designs. Our pieces are all manufactured in our workshop. The highest quality possible made in Hamburg.

David Rasmussen is one of only a handful of designers who also handcrafts his elegant and detailed work.  Concentrating mostly on furniture and architectural built-ins, David practices his craft in Carbondale, Colorado.

I have always loved the Eames mantra of “Create the best for the most for the least.” Good, beautiful things should be available to everyone. During my time in art school, I began to use the plotters in the architecture department to make quick, large, and affordable prints for class. I loved the rough and textural aesthetic of the black-and-white, half-tone images. Reappropriating for fine art a printing method usually reserved for architectural drawings allowed me to produce striking pieces that were casual, but also bold.

Debbie Carlos was born in Los Angeles and grew up in Manila, Philippines. She has since studied psychology at Clark University in Massachusetts and photography at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago.

Her photos attempt to capture objects at their moments of greatest clarity: In certain light, at a certain time of day, in a certain place. The method is to wander and notice. Moments of quiet strangeness, patterns of light and shadow, minute-by-minute surprises, changes that don’t happen, something askew, something exactly in place, natural and artificial phenomena, are all sources of inspiration, and the subjects for her work.

In addition to her fine art work, she also shoots food, travel, lifestyle and interior spaces. Her clients include MOOD, Unison Home, Seamless, Groupon, Bold Furniture, Hoosier Mama Pie, Time Out Chicago, Elle Girl Korea. She has also had the opportunity to collaborate with CB2, J.Crew, and Urban Outfitters and her work featured in numerous print and online publications.

When a designer approaches a material, there's a choice to make: embrace its inherent qualities, or to transform them into something completely different. Dutch designer Dennis Parren achieved the remarkable with his CMYK lightbulb, a feat noted by the inclusion of his work in the Vitra Design Museum's recent Lightopia exhibition. Not willing to stop there, Parren has taken his luminescent experimentation in a whole other direction: wanting to create lighting at once technically innovative and universally accessible, the designer's Bird Collection models three feathered forms in matte polypropylene, for puzzle-like LED lights with movable pieces that can be combined and adjusted. Formal experimentation—with a dose of fun.

Big visions return the greatest rewards. Setting out to extend a helping hand to young, up-and-coming designers, German design platform Deparso takes on the task of guiding them through the long, tricky process of bringing their designs into the world—from developing the right idea to hunting down the ideal manufacturer and getting the products on the shelf. It’s a supportive process, one that has bolstered a number of new design names like Martha Freieler and Matthias Lauche of form|knast. With emerging ideas that become refreshing realities, each of Deparso’s collaborations are made in good company.

Our mission here at Design Different is to create unique work that speaks directly to you. Not just simple elegant pieces of art, but art that creates a connection through emotion and feeling. It’s that connection that excites us and drives us to create more work. We believe that each of us are truly different and the designs we choose should reflect that.

We have distinguished ourselves as a publisher of design rather than a conventional producer, working in the same way with designers that publishing houses work with authors.
Rather than selecting a designer to make a specific product, all designers are invited to bring their personal ideas. Some of these ideas are selected for development and production.
We look for products that add something new to their genre. Products with personality and character.

Seven years have past since we started a radical change of the product and of the image of our company. Thanks to other cooperations with designers, architects, photographers and artist, we have been able to suggest a great range of different items, all of them having in common a light, current and always ironic design. For over 40 years Diamantini&Domeniconi has been assuring the quality of objects completely made in Italy, combining the use of industrial technology and the typical “know how” of the hand-crafted production.

The product designer Ämilios Grohmann & Andre Kieker from Hamburg successfully develop design and product solutions for big brands for many years.
