The wish to develop an own product, from the idea to the design and production, without being bound to external opinions from customers, was on their minds for quite a while. Especially the products which are unimposing on the first sight were in their focus as they were providing a special attraction to design them different and beautifully – like a multiple socket. 
Grohmann explains: “While shopping I realized the loveless design of multiple sockets, which I didn’t want to use. I wanted something different. That’s how we came to the idea of designing our own object”. For the actual development and production they needed an experienced partner with the technical know-how. Frank Trentmann was the right one - a producer of plastic injection moldings. 
In the upcoming development phase the product designer Ämilios Grohmann and the architect Andre Kieker attached great importance to aesthetics – the object was meant to get from under the table on the table. 
The ‘diamondplug’ offers 2 USB connections with 2 Ampere power each and 4 flat-pin plugs 230V with a multiple socket in an innovative design which is produced of high-value. It can be used many-sided like charging all electronically devices with USB, iPhones, tablets etc.

Dominik Hehl studied Product Design at the University of Applied Science in Potsdam and the écal in Lausanne.

After graduation in 2007 he designed a serie of furnitures for familiy spaces and child care. In 2008 Dominik Hehl assisted An Te Liu in the creation of "The Cloud" insatallation for the Architecture Bienale in Venice. 

Before setting up his own studio in 2010 Dominik Hehl joined the Jerszy Seymour Design Workshop  working on product development for Magis (Flux Chair), Vitra, Moulinex and the realisation of installations like: "Beeing There" Villa Noailles Design Parade, "The Coalition of Amateurs" MUDAM Luxembourg, "Salon des Amateurs" Marta Herford 2009 and the "Open Source Amateur Diagram" at experimenta lisboa 2009.

Since his Diplom he is changing ideas and collaborating with Ulrike Kegler, schoolmaster of the Montessori Oberschule Potsdam, exploring the "prepared environment" in todays education.

Dominik Hehl is also part of the transalpino project group realizing projects and exhibitions in Berlin and Milano since 2007. 

Besides his professional work as a Product Designer he realized the filmlet Tacken (shown at achtung berlin Filmfestival 2010) as co-director and actor and the Video Installation "Zeitraub" for the noisy chronic exhibition at HBC Berlin 2010.

Of all your childhood memories, the first time you rode a bike without training wheels–and without a knee-skinning tumble–tends to stick out. Italian label DUDEBIKE's new and improved collection of folding bikes channels that very world-conquering, carefree summer afternoon feeling. The label's light, retro-inspired steel frames are perfect for anyone who wants the freedom to take off on spontaneous trips or to fly through the city streets with breezy, nostalgic abandon. The moments you'll never forget don't end when you grow up, so make the next ones stand out with Italian elegance.

Dylan Sherwood McConnell

Philadelphian artist and RISD Graduate Dylan Sherwood McConnell has stitched a story arc between east/west coasts as a working artist, creative director, and composer. His recent relocation to the Sierra Foothills in September 2010 has precipitated a bold shift in content and materials culled from the area and produced a prolific body of new works inspired by its unique geographic and historical space. Always process driven, these new pieces seek to address the bond of temporality and to establish an analog between interior/exterior spaces.

Dominant forms, bright tones, and excessive add-ons—while for many this may be considered luxury, for many others luxury rings clearer in the art of simplicity. Smoothing over his hard work with pared back, refined aesthetics, Simon Pithe designs home accessories for his Berlin-based label Edgar that blend resolutely into their environments. The Australian designer draws upon the extensive experience and success he’s gained from various design fields, combining it with inspiration from his homeland down under and the artists that have come before him. Modern with an expressive restraint, his label’s collections are nothing less than simply luxurious.

Lithuania has only been an independent nation through the past quarter century, but its artistic and cultural traditions have stood strong, centred around the Vilnius Academy of Arts. A new generation of artists and designers from the storied academy are making their mark on the world with inspired creations that redefine classic forms for modern living—designers like Marius Valaitis, Tore Bleuzé, and not to mention Inesa Malafej and Arunas Sukarevicius, the young couple behind Red Dot Design Award-winning label etc.etc. Working alongside Lithuanian label EMKO, the talented designers have produced furnishings that are primed, polished, and poised for well-rounded contemporary living.

ENOstudio is a French editor of objects signed by the most gifted current designers.

Our philosophy is to create simple, beautiful, useful and curious objects to enchant our daily lives. ENOstudio observes the evolution of our everydaylive’s behaviors and asks the designers to imagine the objects that match with.

Without any fashionable attitude, ENOstudio emphasizes more the uniqueness and timelessness of the “Hand Made Design”- the collection is born from the acquaintances between worldwide traditional know-hows and one designer.

ESPERANDO puts a modernistic spin on classic headwear attire. We engineer our styles 
to contain quality and comfort, with superior attention to detail and everlasting style. Sourcing finest fabrics in italy 
and producing our beauties in europe gives us the capability to bring great craftmanship from start to finish.

Jan and Philip, founders of EVRGREEN, always had trouble with their plants. The right handling and the green thumb seemed to be like a myth form them. One day in October 2012 Jan and Philip had the idea of EVRGREEN as the first plant brand in Germany delivering easy-care plant-sets and innovative decoration with airplants. EVRGREEN works with national based gardeners fulfilling the different EVRGREEN-standards like quality and responsibility. The company is based in Cologne and Berlin.
N/A

Edge of Belgravia is one of the world’s most innovative chef knife brands. With contemporary design from London, high tech materials and supremely sharp stainless steel our knives are just as effective tools as pieces of art for the kitchen.

Established in Belgravia, London, in 2010 and officially launched to the UK market in 2012, Edge of Belgravia has quickly won acclaim. The firm has combined daringly avant-gard design, high quality materials, audacious PR and effective marketing to expand across the globe. It has become a global brand with great recognition.

Edge of Belgravia has been featured by a number of leading blogs and magazines, including Design Milk, the Cool Hunter, Notcot, Gwyneth Paltrow’s Goop, Selectism, Bright Bazaar, Fortune Magazine, Monocle etc.

Our futuristic design by London designer Christian Bird won a slice of the D&AD 2012 product design award in fierce competition with Apple’s iPad2.

In 2013 Edge of Belgravia launched in the USA. In 2014 we released one of the boldest designed chef knife ranges available in the affordable segment, Precision. This was combined with a pioneering new knife block named Black Diamond. Edge of Belgravia is eagerly awaiting the launch of new revolutionary products in 2015. The future is arriving.

Elvis & Kresse is a UK-based brand known most for their beautiful and certainly durable range of bags, accessories and belts. Kresse Wesling and her partner James Henrit are the team behind Elvis & Kresse. They began working with decommissioned fire hoses from the London Fire Department, as a raw material for their bags. After a distinguished career fighting fires and saving lives the hoses were destined for landfill. Elvis & Kresse started to rescue this material in 2005 and never looked back. Many have called them an 'ethical luxury brand' and even names such as Donna Karan New York have begun carrying pieces in their shops and Cameron Diaz was spotted wearing one of Elvis & Kresse's belts in Vogue.

After scrubbing away the soot and grease that builds up on the hose after 25 years of active duty and discovered a truly remarkable, truly green textile. The designers wanted to honour this tough, life saving material, hence their focus on quality craftsmanship and classic, timeless design. They build as much value as they can into each piece and style them for use beyond single seasons. All Elvis & Kresse products are hand-made and unique.

Straightforward lines, classic colours and uncompromising functionality distinguish Emile van Hoogdalem’s work.
Originally, Emile van Hoogdalem was trained as a gold- and silversmith in Schoonhoven  working  as a  goldsmith in the Netherlands as well as  an artisan of ornamental metal work in Spain. Next, he  studied jewellery and product design at the University of Applied Sciences in Düsseldorf, where he discovered his interest in furniture design. After travelling Europe and Northern Africa on his motorbike he has settled in Southern Germany near Lake Constance,   where he now  designs jewellery and furniture in his workshop.
Emile van Hoogdalem has a unique way of looking at things enjoying the use of various materials, which stimulate his creativity as a designer and his feeling for pure forms  as an artist. Thinking outside the box he is capable of creating pure, effective designs that impress through their simplicity.

Engelbrechts works in a close collaboration with Erik Magnussen, Jørgen Rasmussen and Kasper Salto. Erik Magnussen has developed and designed the stackable chair collection called Chairik and Chairik XL, the Zdown chair and Xsit stool, as well as the Foldit and Click tables, and the lounge chair - Plateau. Jørgen Rasmussen has designed the Kevi chair. Kasper Salto has designed the Kato sofa and lounge chair.
Working with such skilled and talented designers has resulted in a furniture line that lives up to Engelbrechts basic idea, which is to cultivate a pure line in concept and design. To choose some of the best materials combine the best of both craft and industry and hold firmly onto finish and functional requirements have resulted in quite a success for Engelbrechts.
It is our belief that our products are being best represented by exclusivity i.e. few but good dealers. Therefore Engelbrechts' products are being sold from carefully selected dealers who have the same concept about design and quality as we do.

Enrico Zanolla studied architecture in one of the most important University in Europe (IUAV) in Venice and graduated in 2004. His works concerning architecture, contract, interior design, industrial design are strictly linked to the sensorial glorification and style. He shows his projects in the most important design exhibitions, cultivating originality in each project he adopts. He developed a particulary attention to shapes, colours, textiles and trends of furniture, design and fashion. His objective is to tackle projects not only in terms of the aesthetic aspects traditionally associated with design, but by developing the entire creative process, including project conception, technical development, engineering and design. He engages in design and consultation for clients around the world, from large-scale projects and global brands to smaller start-ups to private residentials and commercial projects. His works have been featured on BoBedre, Interior+Design, Audi Magazine, Touch Decor, RUM, Fesco Life, Elle Decor, Icon, Interni, Azure, Made, Dwell, Complot, Repubblica, Diseno Interior, Gioia Casa and many more.

Entryways, an Imports Unlimited company, is a designer, manufacturer and importer of quality, uniquely designed, all natural coir, non-slip and recycled rubber doormats.

We sell these doormats to retailers, catalog merchandisers and other wholesalers. We do not sell out products directly to the public at this time.

Being in existence for over 35 years, Entryways is recognized for the wide variety of different designs, mat sizes and the innovation that it brings to outdoor doormat decor. Known for the successful combination of bright colors, classic designs and interesting graphics, Entryways offers an excellent quality product paired with outstanding customer service.

Our current collection is a mix of work from prominent artists and popular designs in the home fashion industry. Consisting of more than 180 patterns, these trendsetting designer doormats are a strong, stylish, and affordable solution for any doorway.

It is also a fully certified Woman Owned Business.

WE'RE PASSIONATE ABOUT 
FORAGING TREASURES, ART AND DESIGN FROM THE PAST.

On one of our countless trips through vintage shops and antique stores we discovered our love of old wall charts. Realizing a decline in the availability of well preserved, high quality wall charts for a reasonable price, we set out on the quest of filling this void by republishing our favorite unique pieces. We constantly rummage through libraries, archives and antique stores across the globe to track down those lost forgotten gems. Our true passion is about preserving the beauty of imperfection and decay that comes with time and use. Sometimes in the state we find them, or by restoring artwork to its' original condition, we aim to bring uniqueness into a world of mass production and smooth surfaces.

Essey is the story not of the evolution of design but rather of an evolution in design.

In the world of nature shapes are defined by their function, it forms the very essence of our natural world.

In the world of design, shapes often only bear slight resemblance to their function, if at all. How many times have we looked at something and wondered what it is, or what it is used for? The world of design is not always in harmony with the world of nature and it is this imbalance that needs to be corrected.

The belief of Essey founder John Brauer, that function should be representative of natural form, is at the very core of the company and is at the heart of its design philosophy - Symbolic Functionalism.

ExtraVerso is a social design manufacturer that shapes artistic creations into revolutionary accessories for smartphones and tablets.Based in Paris but multinational since its very beginning, ExtraVerso is the world's first producer of accessories that match innovative materials with infinite customisation.ExtraVerso offers an infinite choice of Made in Italy covers: these are are extremely thin and light to preserve the original design of the smartphone, and, thanks to their suction effect they feature incredible grip properties, meaning they can even stick to flat and non-porous surfaces such as windows or mirrors, allowing a whole new world of functionalities for the device.The designs are made by a community of international designers based in several countries around Europe, to follow (and to set) a great number of trends.Purchasing the ExtraVerso covers, you enrich your device with a distinctive personality and with extra-functionalities.

FACT NON FACT is a project brand by independent designers exploring in industrial design and crafts field. The inspirations from fact + conceptualization by designer’s insights become reinterpreted processes covering fantasy and reality.

The focus is on conceptual objects, limited collections and prototypes produced under the brand. Our approach to design is immediately connected to the objective of narrating through objects. We aim to create value over being as simply functional object based on experiments to essence and our original ideas.

Our desire for beautiful products at a good price is why FEST Amsterdam was founded. It started in 2009 with importing sofas, chairs and lights sold through shop-in-shop. After traveling through Asia, visiting many factories and fairs, in 2012 the idea originated to set up our own line of home accessories. The FEST Amsterdam home accessories have been popular ever since! The new collection consists of vases, pillows, lights, candleholders, stools and side tables. All items are carefully chosen from natural materials such as bamboo, wood and jute – combined with colored glass, porcelain and ceramics. The collection is colorful and playful with Scandinavian influences. This results in both timeless and modern, warm and fresh pieces. The foundation of the collection remains affordability and quality.

FLOS is an Italian company and one of the international leaders for interior lighting and outdoor lighting. The company was founded in 1962 in Merano and is headquartered in Bovezzo. Already during the early years FLOS distinguished itself as a field for experimentation and researched innovative and sustainable materials like the resin Cocoon. Research was and is an important factor for the company's success, just as the employment of technical innovations. Excellent collaborations with internationally renowed designers like Pier Giacomo Castiglioni, Achille Castiglioni and Tobia Scarpa led FLOS to exhibit its products at some of the most important museums for design, for instance at the MoMa in New York. Thanks to a number of exclusive showrooms and by the means of well calculated buyouts of third companies, like the Italian "Arteluce italiana" and the Spanish "Antares", FLOS managed to establish itself on the international market. Several of its products received prestigious prizes: the lamp Parentesi, by Achille Castiglioni e Pio Manzù, Drop and May Day, for instance, were awarded with the highly respected Compasso D’oro.

36 exquisite manufacture-scents - made in Berlin

Wall Street Journal recommends “Berlin in a bottle”, Vogue Germany raves " ...the Mecca for perfume aficionados."

Frau Tonis Parfum offers exclusively manufactured fragrances for men and women – among which the energetically fresh „Berlin Summer“ and deliciously vernal „Linde Berlin“, conjuring memories of Berlin’s cheerfully fragrant linen trees, or „Pure Violet“, a scent once composed for Berlin’s own Marlene Dietrich in the 1920s. We create scents for olfactory individualists.

Perfume as an inspiration - that is our philosophy.

Origin: Germany

Inspired by stories of his father’s inter-war life spent in the coffee houses of Central Europe, where coffee, beer, culture and conversation flowed hand in hand, David Freud founded FREUD design and café-bars in 1986. With the aim of bringing the bustle and chatter of his father’s treasured Viennese hang-outs to London, his first venture was to create the first café-bar in England – Freud on Shaftesbury Avenue – a retreat where one can chose from a single menu, ordering food, coffee and alcohol in a striking but relaxed environment. More than that, it was an experiment. Not only did it sell drink and, through the inter-locking café and shop spaces, design. It also offered a change in the way we interact with each other and the world around us.

Graduating from the Courtauld Institute of Art in 1973, David’s passion for the ideas behind the way things look carries through into every aspect of FREUD, his preoccupation with the virtues of lasting design being seen not only in the beautiful table and glassware products created by the design house, but also in the FREUD buildings, which house the enterprise. At 198 Shaftesbury Avenue, home of the original café-bar, gallery and shop spaces, black, green and grey slate are juxtaposed against cement, York stone and steel – a concept which looks back to the past, from Medieval cloisters to Baroque architecture, for inspiration – but not imitation. This is a reflection of David’s belief that we should use the past as a ‘library of ideas’ to inform and enrich our imaginations, an idea which remains at the heart of our thinking and creations.

Twenty-six years after opening its doors and being discovered by a London crowd who made it their own, FREUD has continued naturally to evolve. So too has the Freud family, bringing fresh ideas to the project. In Oxford, at the Freud café David’s eldest son is working with a new team to renew the spirit of café society. In London, his daughter has
joined the design team to refresh its creativity.

FUNDAMENTAL BERLIN makes objects that return a child's wonder to adult eyes. With geometrically inspired concepts and mathematical designs, we offer a subtle and rich world that quitely invites the daydreaming mind.

We make objects for the cosy yet cerebral home,
solid hardwood handmade tables,
unique display and ornamentation elements
playful, practical accessories
imaginative and personal gifts

Pattern Stories & Colour InteractionAt FUSS it’s all about the unexpected twist and making a “fuss”. By working with texture of material, graphic patterns and colour interaction, Karen Mimi creates the unique signature design that is FUSS.The design is characterized by a graphic minimalism and balanced calmness inspired by a strong Nordic design heritage and a love for industrial knitting.FUSS offers a range of knitted pillows and throws made of soft yarn and produced with particular focus on quality in Europe.  All pillows receive with inner cushions made of cotton and filled with feather and down.

Fabulous Goose is a Scandinavian company founded on a desire to deliver outstanding quality and the belief that it should always be easy for customers to make a safe and rewarding choice.

We go beyond design, beyond trends and focus on conveying emotions and personality into practical pieces that can be used and lived in.

In doing so, we offer a unique fusion of sophisticated design, ethical production and safe, natural materials.

The Fabgoose product range is perfect for anyone who values exceptional quality and outstanding design.

As inspiring as the sights, sounds, and smells of the world around us can be, sometimes it's just as fruitful to get away from them all. Shutting herself away when she creates, Danish designer Helle Just Weiling concentrates on handcrafting her label Fall & Folk's objects simply for the love of it. The designer's extensive experience with her label Grundled has been channelled since February 2015 into Fall & Folk, which she runs with her husband. Geometric, minimal, and versatile, the label's jewellery rounds off any ensemble perfectly.
v

A lovestory. What started as a businessman meeting an artist, coupled with some love and ideas, is now a beautiful family-run company that creates unique rugs from sustainable materials. We aim not to increase the burden of the Earth, while we do aim creating beautiful, colorful pieces that will hopefully enhance people’s life a bit too! For that we have collaborated with the most talented designers in Finland and the best suppliers in India. We work for the efficient use of raw materials by utilizing left-over fabrics from the textile industry, turning them into upcycled design-dreams for everyone's floor.

Fleabags was founded in New York in 2009, when Shira Entis and Alexandra Bell wanted an American-made, sturdy canvas bag to use during their frequent trips to the flea market. They envisioned a bag similar to a vintage toolbag, but elevated by Italian and vegetable-tanned leather details and in colors that popped -- the Original Flea. The line has expanded to include a full assortment of canvas and leather bags and accessories, all of which incorporate this same combination of a timeless, tomboy aesthetic, purposeful construction and refined details. 

Process:
Guided by Shira and Alex’s backgrounds in fashion design and by their appreciation for craftsmanship, each bag is designed in our Brooklyn studio and is hand-made in the USA. Many of our products are made in Limited Edition, in small runs of 20 to 200. We think of each bag as an artist edition, thus many products are hand-numbered and silkscreened with the production number. 

Materials: 
We use natural, high quality materials that are aligned with sustainable production. Most of our products are made with 100% cotton canvases, waxed cotton canvases and vegetable-tanned leathers. All silk-screening is done in Brooklyn using water-based ink.  

Natural Dyeing: 
Natural dyes are derived mainly from plants, but from minerals and animals as well, and can range in color from muted brown to bright magenta. Natural dyeing requires a lot of time, practice and patience, and is both a scientific and artistic endeavor. We have been exploring natural dyes in order to color our vegetable-tanned leathers in an environmentally-friendly way. Please stay tuned as we look to offer naturally-dyed products in the future.

If art has a secret, it's the way it wiggles into the hearts of those who see it. As fascinating and moving as they are delightful, the poster prints by French graphic designer and illustrator Florent Bodart are fragile drawings that inhabit a world populated by vintage cars and surrealistically constructed bicycles powered by fruit wheels. Showcasing their creator's love of life and intellectual novelty, all of Bodart's works exude a rich, retro charm that intensifies their endearingly unusual approach to the world. True poster art, these prints are ready to bring the wonders of life to your walls.

After graduating in both Design and Fine Arts, Foekje Fleur found her way by making objects that are functional and yet, give space for thought.  Her attractive and colourful designs seem playful at first sight, but are in fact inspired by serious topics like environmental pollution and animal rights.

Based in the creative heart of London, we are a team of passionate cyclists with over fifty years combined experience in the cycling and design industries. We are dedicated to ensuring our bikes deliver timeless elegance, style and comfort.
Our company and range of bikes continues to grow to meet the demand from the market, retailers and of course our family of fans.

FOFFA bikes are proud to be leading the revolution in style conscious non-competitive cycling.

Italy certainly isn't lacking in talented designers and craftsmen, and Formabilio, one of the newest arrivals on the country's creative scene, is a name you'll want to remember. A young label based in Treviso, Formabilio gives rising talents a chance to build on Italy's formidable design tradition by entering their ideas into a competition seeking the most innovative, environmentally-friendly designs—and then brings those ideas to life. Tradition meets innovation: it's the Italian way.

Fort Standard is a contemporary Industrial Design studio founded by Gregory Buntain and Ian Collings. Their collaborative work is an ever-evolving dialog between their unique perspectives and their shared approach to progressive design thinking. Working primarily in long lasting natural materials, their approach to design is often geared towards using traditional production methods in innovative ways. Having developed a distinct form language rooted in simplicity and functionality, their attention to detail, connections and materiality generate value through design in what Buntain and Collings describe as a “warm-contemporary” aesthetic.

Fritz Hansen was established in 1872 by the visionary cabinetmaker of the same name. Since then, Fritz Hansen has become a natural part of both Danish and international design history. Today, it is an exclusive and international design brand. The history of Fritz Hansen is characterized by stupendous craftsmanship, unique design and an inherent sense of premium quality. Leading architects and furniture designers from all over the world have regularly contributed to the collection with beautifully shaped and functional furniture that seamlessly meet through the use of innovative techniques and new materials. Arne Jacobsen, Poul Kjærholm, Piet Hein, Vico Magistretti, Burkhard Vogtherr, Piero Lissoni, Kasper Salto, Cecilie Manz and Jaime Hayon – the stellar string of designers is long and the list of furniture of classic and iconic fame is even longer.

G3Ferrari represents the story of Made in Italy electrical home appliances. Since 1970, the company has produced ingenious items which are the result of careful research in design, functionality and high quality materials. So products such as Delizia were created, the one and only electric Pizza oven that can reach the temperatures of a real wood-burning oven, or the Tigella Mia tigelliera, equipped with double baking stones and able to cook up to 15 tigelle simultaneously. G3Ferrari is also one of the first manufacturers of electric irons, both professional steam stations and built- in boiler irons.
G3Ferrari home appliances arrived early in every Italian family houses. Reliability, fast and effective assistance and easiness of repairing all the appliances have made G3Ferrari one of the most respected Company in Italy. 

In September 2011 Trevidea, an importing company of electrical home appliances and personal care products, acquired the Italian brand G3Ferrari and renewed the production, improving historical appliances by modernizing the design and introducing a series of innovative product lines which are marked, as always, by the highest quality construction. 

Now G3Ferrari offers small appliances for Cooking, Food Preparation, Personal Care, Electric Irons and Air treatment, always stand out for their utmost professionalism, know-how, reliability and excellent service which contributed, since 1970 to spreading the historic brand in Italy and all across Europe. 

The new product lines are always characterized by the high quality assembly and the unique design, as well as the constant pursuit of innovation and originality in every appliance, like the new ice machine Artiko, the induction cooking hob Bollente or Lella, the electric pan with a keeping-warm function which can be easily brought to the table. 

Every single unit complies with the essential safety requirements defined by the specific European directives, since a reliable product is first of all a safe product. G3Ferrari: quality, innovation and tradition since 1970.

Hems Achterhuis is the designer and creator of the GACOLI. One day, he had the feeling that his garden lacked something. What do you have inside that you don’t have outside? Attractive outdoor furniture and accessories have been around for years, but charming outdoor lighting was scarce. Following a series of sketches, the design gradually took shape, resulting in an elegant yet robust garden lamp with a stylish cover for outdoor use.
Innovative, new, different, retro and comfort were the key words to describe this new lamp, and following a two-year development phase, the GACOLI was ready to enter the market as the most innovative and smart outdoor lighting on the market.
GACOLI stands for Garden Comfort Living: Beautiful garden lights for everyone. However, is comfort merely about the light output? Hems didn’t believe so.
Laying of cables is always an expensive task and makes it impossible to easily move the conventional garden lamps around. His answer to this question was the EMU (Energy Management Unit), a high-tech, compact panel integrated onto the top of every GACOLI cover, which both gathers energy via solar panels and lights the lamp cover and surrounding area with powerfull warm white LEDs. Wiring is no longer necessary and the lamps can be moved around at will. GACOLI outdoor lamps are wireless and therefore are not bound to a fixed spot. Now that’s user-friendliness! GACOLI lamps are powered by daylight, so using GACOLI outdoor lights in your garden is a sustainable, responsible choice.

While one might not necessarily think of architecture and lighting as a compatible pair, Bavarian designer Stefan Gant masterfully merges the two. Since moving to Berlin and establishing his label GANTlights in 2012, Gant has continuously handcrafted luminaries which playfully mix experimental forms and materials such as concrete and gold, resulting in a stunning aesthetic contrast. A collection of lights which are as timeless as they are elegant.

This can be functioning for users and also apply to eye catching design point

Good&Co aims to intelligently amalgamate fashion and art. Each piece turns its wearer into a walking artwork - though only those in the know will be aware of the detail.

Feminine and functional but never fussy, the GOOD&CO aesthetic appeals to those who like their luxury to come with a playful twist. Each item functions simultaneously as a timeless, classic investment piece and also as an inherently modern accessory. Destined to be enjoyed and loved by generations of women, each GOOD&CO piece is unique.

New Zealand designer Lillie Toogood is the brains behind the brand - her love of photography, travel, textiles and design collide serendipitously in GOOD&CO. Having worked for labels including Karen Walker, Trelise Cooper and Camilla + Marc, Sydney-based Lillie started GOOD&CO in 2011.

Lillie's background in graphic design is evident in her eye for colour and form - each GOOD&CO piece is based on a photograph she's taken in her travels, from the gangs of bikes lining the streets of European cities, to a moment of market life in a seaside town of Vietnam. Shapes, patterns and colours that are captured to create beautiful textiles, and take the wearer across boarders to be apart of the moment.

GUBI is a global design house on a continual quest. A journey. Fuelled by a passion to discover overlooked icons from the past and future icons in the making, GUBI has made a distinctive name for itself in the international design arena as a dynamic design force to be reckoned with.
Curiosity, courage and intuition are key components for the success of a company that sees itself as a treasure hunter. For Jacob Gubi Olsen, who is Chief Creative Officer heading up GUBI with his brother Sebastian, "Design is all about discovering gems and following your instincts. It involves travelling, searching and finding long-lost remnants from the past as well as contemporary, cutting-edge designs from new artists on the horizon."
The result is an eclectic, intercontinental collection that blurs the lines between the past and the future. An extensive assortment of extremely aesthetic, thought-provoking designs characterised by simple, arresting shapes, original materials and innovative techniques which defy time and space. Imbued with a beauty that resonates with design aficionados, architects and designers all around the world

For Vincent Gallix, architecture is more than just his calling: it's in his blood. Based in the south of France, the renowned designer spent his childhood in the architecture workshop run by his father and grandfather, learning the tricks of the trade and exploring the creative process. Gallix first exhibited work at Belgium's famed Interieur design biennial in 1976, and by the time he became a certified architect in 1979, he had nearly a decade of experience in industrial design. Launching his label in 2008, the architect's return to design has been a success: with a view towards the 'less is more' design philosophy, he was awarded the Red Dot Design Award in 2009, and the clean, rounded forms of his creations find purity in simplicity.

Glove.ly designs warm, stylish gloves that invisibly work with your touch screen.

At Glove.ly, we love balancing function, design, and technology. Your beautiful tech devices do that, and so should your accessories. 

Born in New York, our gloves are designed around an active lifestyle: warm, yet portably lightweight; beautiful, yet functional; simple, yet great. We love our gloves, and are very proud of them. No other products offer the balance of softness, design, comfort, and function (Trust us, we've tried them all. That's why we're here). 

What we hate:

We hate ugly designs. 
We hate stupid gloves that don't work with smart phones
We hate metallic "tech" gloves that make you look like a robot
We hate losing gloves
We hate being cold
So we think we've nailed it. 
Simple. Get a pair. or 6. Spread the Glove.

While writing her PhD in law, Gluckigluck founder Sophie discovered this beautiful and communicative jug at a friends home. Realising that the jugs were a British cult  object designed in 1870 not yet sold in Europe outside of Great Britain, she secured the distribution rights and founded GLUCKIGLUCK. Since then, Gluckigluck have conquered German-speaking Europe and are ready for the rest. Everybody loves the funny jugs - which can also be used as a vase. Even the Queen has a pair and her son Prince Charles, who grew up with them, still uses them when drinking a glass of Whisky. Are you ready to feel royal too?
Home décor design studio

GREYGE [greij] is the new design brand from Rome. For Greyge design lives in the details: every material, line and angle has a tangible relevance. Every single piece follows its own vision. All original designs are manufactured by hand in Italy and inspired by a passion for visual lightness. In 2011, the design team Kathrin Charlotte Bohr and Mauro Falomi began producing their own interior line while restoring a 1950's apartment in Monteverde, Roma. The idea of Greyge is rooted in a strong commitment to lightness of form and seeks to marry the suggestive force of fluctuating lines and the emotion of color. 
The designs take their inspiration both from architectural components found in nature and the emotional response they can generate. Sensations such as appear in an old growth forest, like rustling tree crowns or playful reflections of natural light are materialized in the designs. Thin metal bars and smoothly shaped wood are employed to convey a sense of material weightlessness. Kathrin's fascination with the lily plant inspired Calla, a pendant light molded from thin steel plates. Two outstretched arms ending in lily-shaped forms embrace the space with unexpected luminosity: on one side an opened calla blossom functions as an indirect light source reflecting from the ceiling while the other shape focuses the light to the side. Transforming the classical ceiling lamp into a charming lighting mobile, CALLA is employable as turn-able reading spot and living room light, as unconventional dining table illumination or on free inspiration for new senses of individual interior design. 
TED is a table that maintains a strong devotion to the core lines and form of the Italian walnut tree, integrating the natural beauty of its wood grain into a rounded table top with a triangular form. Three legs lift the unique shape to harmonize the strength of the raw material with the pleasure of lightness. The chair IBSEN plays with the irony of its namesake, the idea of continuous questioning of the rules of construction and material expectations. A surreal play with the plurality of ideas mingles the notion of grace and comfort. An extravagant harmony between different characters: an elastic ballerina and a charming poet. The designers' working experience in set design, as both director and director of photography, supports the idea of conveying a space emotionally and individually. The pieces are not conceived on paper, but molded, destroyed and rebuilt by hand until their true soul takes life and their story shines through. When the objects are placed together, their characters play off each other in suggestive compositions with a personal perspective. 
GREYGE. TO FURNISH PLEASURE.

Gris Clair is the result of creative collaboration between Alexandra Romanesco and Laurence Ulrich in a design studio. 

Gris Clair aims to dress up your home with contemporary products made in the finest materials. 

All our models are exclusive and designed in our design studio.

Against mass production, we privilege a traditional and artisanal production in Europe.

Our products reflect our personalities, our cultures and our passion for detail and high quality materials. 

Our approach is simple and spontaneous. 

We are Gris Clair!

Grundéns designs, develops and produces truly waterproof clothing for professional users. To ensure the highest possible quality, we develop our products in close collaboration with the people who actually use them. As a result, fishermen, craftsmen, miners and farmers have become some of our closest friends. Headquartered in Borås, Sweden, a city famous for its textile heritage, the Grundéns Group includes Grundéns Sweden, Grundéns USA and Grundéns Chile. The group also includes its very own production facility in Portugal, boasting eighty skilled employees. Our product range is divided into four categories: Commercial fishing, Industry, Building & Construction, and Sports & Leisure. The products are marketed and distributed through authorized dealers in Europe, North America and South America. Originating from a country in which the rain is as common as the sun, we aim to be the world leader in professional waterproof clothing for hard-working men and women. Today, about one hundred proficient and ambitious employees are determined to help Grundéns succeed.

We had an idea. How about if we don’t let anything to a chance and involve ourselves in development of our products from the drawing board to the moment we ship it to our clients?

The result is products that we fully stand behind. Products that go trough our hands every step of the way. Today we are proud to be part of peoples living and working spaces - homes, offices, hotels, bars…

We’d love to share this idea with you.

H is a new furniture company that conceives and creates meaningful pieces for discerning clients. London based, but with Mexican origins and a global outlook, we embrace contrasts and celebrate differences, bringing together beautifully crafted collections that get better with time and make people’s lives richer.

H believes in progress with purpose. We explore new possibilities and methods; consider history to forge a better future; and create compelling juxtapositions. Everything we do, we do with love and care. The details drive us — from design and materials sourcing, to manufacturing and finishing. For us, quality is paramount and we strive for it without compromise. We want to do things the right way, sustainably and without shirking our responsibilities — that’s why we use solid wood from renewable sources as a primary component. We will always charge a fair price for our products, given the cost of materials and manufacturing.

H doesn’t just intend to build a business, but to establish a culture. An open culture that fosters inventiveness and collaboration and is built on mutual respect and trust. We’re curators and editors, relying on a network of specialists to help us realize our ideas, so faith in our partners is critical. We invest in relationships as well as craftsmanship, making sure that everyone we work with feels valued and a real part of what we’re doing.

But more than anything, H wants to elevate the everyday, to bring interest and imagination into people’s lives, to create original furniture that makes a room better than it was before.

HAROLD'S was founded in 1936.  Since then three generations have been engaged, each of them representing the characters of their time and introducing their personal values with caution, but also with certainty. HAROLD'S is following a constructivist design approach, combining artisanal sophistication with high functionality. Particular attention is paid to research and development of local leather craftsmanship.

HAY was founded in 2002 with the ambition to create contemporary furniture with an eye for modern living and sophisticated industrial manufacturing. That remains our ambition today. Through our commitment to the design and production of furniture and accessories with an international appeal we strive to make good design accessible to the largest possible audience. We are inspired by the stable structures of architecture and the dynamics of fashion, which we seek to combine in durable quality products that provide added value for the user. HAY’s continued vision is to create straightforward, functional and aesthetic design in cooperation with some of the world’s most talented, curious and courageous designers.

Istanbul based product designer , all of which are designed and crafted by Gokhan Eryaman. At the first glimpse, the leading feature of our product range is that it is not only hand finished but also handmade.
They are all individually made from one solid piece of wood. Tagging all with product number (mostly limited edition), delivering with a certificate of authenticity and naturally given having all unique texture; every product is a ''one of a kind'' result.
This process and material choice causes every Haydanhuya user to have a unique handmade product. Which is becoming really hard to come across these days.
Our product range is limited with variety of Bag and Wallets at the moment, but our goal is to expand without loosing the relationship with the brand identity and raw material. The important part will always be ''Craft You Carry''.
Our main goal is; to create product that our customers can be proud and content to use through their lifetime and maybe even pass it over to their kids, to keep the products natural rawness and timeless design.

HDigit was established in 2007 by HipShing Electronics, which has been doing business since 1979 and is renowned as a manufacturer and exporter of radios. In early 2009, five years after the Swiss company Goonet GmbH was established, both companies made the decision to redefine the brand “HDigit” in a joint market introduction.

The symbiosis of Swiss quality engineering paired with a design that places the focus on the customer, an innovative drive, expertise and highly developed technology represents the underlying foundation that each new product development is supported by.

"hagedornhagen has been founded by the two photographers Mads Hagedorn-Olsen and Anders Morell. We have 10 years’ work-experience in the field of advertising, with our partnership morganmorell, and throughout the years we have received a number of prestigious prizes and diplomas.

At hagedornhagen we have a passion for creeps and tiny winged creatures. For this reason, we have collected, prepared and photographed selected types of beetles and butterflies, and created a series of artprints of very high quality, as regards to both craftsmanship and artistry. Each artprint has been produced in a limited edition of 2000 copies. We have photographed the insects with a High End camera, which reproduces the colours and details of the motive most convincingly, and we have spent a lot of care on printing techniques and choice of paper. A hagedornhagen artprint is, in short, a product that has been carefully prepared and carried through down to the minutest details.

The artprints have a look that conjures up visions of old silk screen prints with nature motives. They simply buzz with nostalgia and poetry. At the same time, the photographs express innovation and modernity due to their graphic simplicity and illustrative sharpness. The artprints will look good in modern homes, where furniture classics are mixed with vibrant vintage artefacts. They will also look fine with a drawing pin in each corner, fixed on the wall in the children’s bedroom.

We look forward to posting your first hagedornhagen"

London based Hand&Eye Studio designs and produces the work of Tom Housden and his collaborators. Tom, a practising architect, set up Hand&Eye Studio in 2011 and has since developed a small but carefully crafted range of work. Each item is designed by the studio and then produced in collaboration with small British manufacturers, all of whom are masters of their craft. Hand&Eye’s close involvement in the production process underpins all of its designs. This allows great scope for experimentation in the design process and for a hugely intimate understanding of the objects’ material.

We have a vision to create furniture that are simple, honest and quality conscious and following them all the way from the drawing board to the finished product. 

Who we are? Behind the Herman Cph design, we are the duo and couple Helle Herman Mortensen and Jonas Herman Pedersen.

Our design Philosophy reflects in our idiom, which balances between the contrasts: the simple and the powerful, the elegance and fine craftsmanship.

We are convinced that people feel most comfortable if they are among good and honest intentions, and this philosophy forms the basis for Herman Cph. Great materials are molded over time, which means that they only grow more beautiful and unique as the years progress. A product by Herman Cph is created in order to be used and to reflect the life lived.

Herman Miller was a West Michigan businessman who helped his son-in-law, D.J. De Pree, buy the Michigan Star Furniture Company in 1923. De Pree had been working at the company, which opened in 1905, since he was hired in 1909 as a clerk. De Pree knew his father-in-law was a man of integrity, so he decided to rename the company after him.

By the middle of the 20th century, the name Herman Miller had become synonymous with “modern” furniture. Working with legendary designers George Nelson and Charles and Ray Eames, the company produced pieces that would become classics of industrial design.

Since then, we’ve collaborated with some of the most outstanding designers in the world, including Alexander Girard, Isamu Noguchi, Robert Propst, Bill Stumpf, Don Chadwick, Ayse Birsel, Studio 7.5, Yves Béhar, Doug Ball, and many talented others.

Today, in addition to our classic pieces and new designs for the home, Herman Miller is a recognized innovator in contemporary interior furnishings, solutions for healthcare environments, and related technologies and services. A publicly held company headquartered in Zeeland, Michigan, we have manufacturing facilities in the United States, China, Italy, and the United Kingdom and sales offices, dealers, licensees, and customers in over 100 countries.

We operate through several focused businesses, brands, and distribution channels, including Herman Miller, Herman Miller Healthcare, Nemschoff, Geiger International, and independently owned dealerships. All of them work to design and build a better world around you.

Hey is a graphic design studio based in Barcelona, Spain. We specialise in brand identity, editorial design and illustration. We love geometry, colour and direct typography. This is the essence of who we are.

HIMMEE Lighting Brand was founded by Timo Niskanen in 2014. The products of Himmee are the founder’s ideas of good design without middlemen and compromises directly to the customer. The main goal of Himmee is to manufacture high quality and personal lighting fixtures for design lovers. The company does not compete in quantity. More important for us are quality and personality. The products of the company are designed by the founder of the company. Himmee offers new and fresh Scandinavian design. Every product of the company has its place in the collection and a story to tell. The design language of the collection is discreet and suits the Scandinavian style homes perfectly.

Holzkohlenkoks is a manufactory for high-quality contemporary product design. Holzkohlenkoks was established 2013 by the interior and product designer Ivan Kiss in a former coal merchant store aiming to create new values with the selective use of materials and a network of skilled craftsmen.

Huzi Design is a new boutique brand of heirloom products, classic but with a modern re-interpretation. Our vision is to spark curiosity through analog play in everyday experiences with simple, playful and sustainable designs.

The identity of HÄNSKA comes from our hearts. Growing organically since the launch of the original CATAMARAN Rucksack in 2013, we have gradually expanded our range of products along with our team.
The creative marriage of industrial-, product- and fashion design within our team gives us the means to explore and to create products using our wide range of expertise. Every design is realized with unconventional rules of construction. We give ourselves space for experimentation, allowing for chance encounters that bring forth a new aesthetic language. We find inspiration in traditional packaging elements and combine them with a love for geometric shapes. We are always in search of new materials, which change the direction of subtle details in the final product. We design our items with a new generation of active, creative users in mind; users whose daily journeys seamlessly move from urban to outdoor environments, where work and adventure melt into one.
All our products are handmade in our Berlin-based Studio by talented craftsmen/women. Producing right inside our design studio is an invaluable aspect of our approach, as we can be in constant communication with one another, allowing the production process to flourish.
We believe in using only high-quality materials that are certified, made to last and as locally sourced as possible. The linen we use is grown and woven in Germany, a real rarity nowadays. The acrylic fabric, which is completely water-repellent, colourfast and extremely durable, is made in France and has been approved by the Oeko Tex Standard. The high-tech mesh, normally used for Catamaran trampolines and outdoor furniture, is made in Switzerland and is 100% recyclable and also meets the Oeko Tex Standard. All leather parts are naturally tanned and come from Portugal.

Origin: Germany
IDE - House of Brands

ISHUJA Inc. is specialized in creating a better product from design to production. Our mission is lending customers the best-of-breed experiences in our products or services.

Our team ISHUJA was established by three co-funders – Issey, Hung, & Jack, and they all come from different professional fields. Issey manages sales and marketing in IT & 3C industry, Hung is skilled in art & architectural design, and Jack executes the manufacturing of customized components on behalf of US clients. We believe the outstanding design is not only a pleasing or fascinating work, but also presenting the user-friendly interface, and improving customers’ perception of the life ! 

Based in Taiwan, we have an advantage in working with high-quality & very-experienced manufacturers. Taiwan's manufacturing, strive for continual innovation in the production of consumer goods, with utmost efficiency and stringent quality gates along each step of the way. Therefore we can ensure offering the finest product and best-quality solutions to our customers.

IUMI is a small Design Studio founded by young Berlin based architect Paul Girardet. 

With our birch plywood assembly lamp series we have tried to make products that bring a story to the owner. Assembly is so intuitively easy and it makes you rpoud! The result is delicate piece of green design. The Lamps come in a handprinted paperboard box. 

We produce with love in a small workshop in Berlin.

Ichendorf, the company history began back in the early years of the twentieth century in a small town near Cologne, named Quadrath-Ichendorf. There, many master-glaziers used a mix of substance, among which was silica, to give shape to objects which met the refined taste of that period.
Precious ornaments had the leading role in various tasteful collection up until 1950.
In those year, a very important change in taste was established: to favor clean shape and purity of material in order to gain a kind of transparency which has no imperfection. Old form and adornment were abolished, in an endless search for new, popular and no longer exclusive appearances: the creation of modern designed objects began.
In 1990 Ichendorf Style Center moved and settled in Milan, creative point of convergence where artists and designer can guide the gesture of master-glaziers to the creation of light, swift forms, brought to life from a mark on a piece of paper, a creative idea, down to the manipulation of substances by the masters’ blow.
The great idea at the root of the productive philosophy of Ichendorf is the encounter of tradition and innovation, of ancient techniques and modern lines.

Since it’s inception in 2004 Italian leather brand, Il Bussetto, has cemented itself in the worlds luxury leather market. Famed for it’s traditional technique of producing small leather goods with the word “bussetto” coming from the name of an instrument used by craftsman to polish cuoio leather. Looking to traditional Artisan craftsmanship the brand has re-introduced an ancient technique used to produce cuoio leather goods completely devoid of any seams but where the leather is molded into shape. Staying true to this tradition, classic styles are updated for the modern day from I-phone cases, through to wallets, glasses, pen, coin and cigar cases which are all given a modern twist. All available in a myriad of colourways from bottle green, vibrant orange, mustard, deep purples, red, bright cobalt blue to minimal brown and black. Not only does the ancient Italian technique allow for the creation of complex objects without permitting any seams, the products are completely handmade to ensure the highest quality from the leather, design, manufacturing through to production. All materials from leather, colourings, glues and waxes are completely natural. The cuoio calf leather is tanned using vegetable products derived from trees such as chestnut or quebracho; the colours are diluted in water and alcohol in order to be easily absorbed without leaving any trace on the final product. The glue used is derived from rice, also ensuring all materials are from a natural source. The leather is first cut into sections, drenched with water and stretched on wooden shapes to dry for several days. After this initial process has been completed the leather is hand-painted, brushed with a heated “bussetto” then finally liberally waxed and buffed to a glowing luster. The premium collection stays true to artisan craftsmanship but includes a covering of luxury leathers such as stringray and ostrich. Classic pieces are featured combining precious and cuoio leather for a truly luxurious product. Il Bussetto produce luxury perennial classics perfect for the modern traveller to everyday use. The collection has also recently expanded to include high quality belts in cuoio leather and stingray.

In-es.artdesign started as a new creative project in the Italian industrial scene. Art and design for interiors (in) and exteriors (es), light and shadow become one, to give shape to lamps and elements for the decoration of interiors and exteriors.  Today the company is recognized on an international level in the field of decorative illumination. Part of the production is composed of a limited edition of unique pieces, where the designer/ artist transforms selected pieces from the collection with specific artistic interventions. A revolutionary concept, distant from the traditional rules of Industrial Design and from handcraft, realized through the innovative figure of the artist/designer.A distinctive trait of the firm is the careful attention to the details, and to the selection of the materials. Each product goes through a strict quality control to guarantee its excellence. All the products are conceived by the artist/ designer Oçilunam, a dynamic and global mind. His research on esthetics is based on the importance of  the element of light as matter, shape and symbol.In-es.artdesign has just won the Innovation Design Award 2014 (with the lamp Cyrcus lavagna), a prestigious international recognition, assigned by the German Design Council.

It all started 10 years ago with MM CREATION, managed by Matthieu Meert.
In their privately owned atelier they design, produce and execute creations for the complete design of houses and other spaces. In order to further extend their business they feel the time is right to bring their own collection of wood creations to market with the item IN2WOOD.

A thorough experience in interior products, precision and materials come to life in a passion and heart for wood, resulting in a contemporary visual language that creates an array of opportunities right away.
DESIGNER
Matthieu Meert designed the woodylicious modular furniture.



Matthieu Meert (1981) is a passionate initiator, creator and entrepreneur. One moment he is checking and making new prototypes of a product in the factory, the next moment he's designing new prototypes. "This variation is what makes my job fun". He's participating in the complete design process and influences the progress. His job is a combination between entrepreneurship and designing.

Origin: Belgium

Industrial Jewellery specializes in crafting unique pieces of high-end jewellery that incorporate a wide variety of industrial materials. Hila’s work transforms springs, ropes, rubber and other unusual materials, to the point where pieces require a second or third glance to truly recognize the pieces’ origins.
 
Excited to introduce the SS'15 collection, we've added a fresh new perspective to our two best-selling lines, the 'Square' and the 'Rope'. We achieved a beautifully rich texture in the 'Rope' through innovative weaving techniques and introduced a crisp colour palate inspired by denim and linen. The colour-block designs within the 'Square' are livened up with strategically placed gold accents.
 
SS'15 is a very clean and refined collection, with a bit of an edge. Throughout the collection, you'll find details using geometric lava rocks and a  limited edition 'industrial fringe'.
 
Arguably our most exciting news of the season is the worldwide launch of the first ever, Industrial Jewellery Men's Collection. As a response to many client requests, we have released a capsule collection for the modern man. Building from our signature aesthetics, the Men's line features necklaces, bracelets, cufflinks and a key chain.
 
We see SS'15 as our most innovative work to-date, pushing our creativity to the limit as we enter our 11th season, showcasing in London, New York, Paris and Copenhagen. Throughout our continued reinvention, we've maintained a fast hold on the brand's signature style and premium handcrafted quality. We look forward to bringing you the most intriguing fashion jewellery made from unconventional materials for many more seasons to come.

Robin Grasby and Marc Bell collaborated on their first joint project in 2010 after both graduating with BA{Hons} Three Dimensional Design from Northumbria University, UK.  Their first concept project Maintenance - a modular cleaning system - was exhibited in London in July 2010, and went on to receive a Wallpaper* Design Award in January 2011. Based on the success of this project, the pair set up studio together under the name International.

The studio was selected to take part in D3 Contest 2012 at IMM Köln. Here Grasby and Bell were presented with an Interior Innovation Award by the German Design Council for their new project Apollo. The lighting system was in production the following year and the brand International has since begun to grow as the commercial producer of the studio's own projects.

Adaptability and a focus on standardised fittings are strong directives throughout International's practice. The studio's ethos serves to impart added value and longevity to functional products by presenting frequent opportunity for user customisation. They simultaneously work to simplify fabrication through innovation in universal manufacturing processes, whilst upholding a restrained and economic use of materials.

Intuerilight - Insightful Lighting Made by Hand

Intuition is the ability to know when something is right or not, and to sense when there's something extra there-an ingrained feeling that's central to the creative and production processes of young Hungarian label Intueri Light. The studio's founders Krisztián Mécs and József Hegedűs tend to focus on the more personal aspects of lighting, producing lamps with particular emotional resonance. Through the use of gleaming hand-spun metals and hand-blown glass globes, each is individually formed into a timeless shape by local artisans, working hand in hand with the label to bring form to its intimate insight into illumination.

Jozsef and Krisztian

Jansen+co is a contemporary, vivid and original Dutch table top design company based in Amsterdam. Founded by Anouk Jansen and Harm Magis in 2006.
It was in August 2010 that we launched our first ceramic range in the colourful My Mugs. Since then Jansen+co products have taken off around the world. Our design is being stocked in design stores, museum stores, kitchen retailers, and high end department stores.
Every Jansen+co product combines the very best of industrial production with hand finish; classic shapes with modern sensibilities bright colours tastefully blended with subtler complementary tones. Our aesthetic is unique, with innovative use of materials, technology and Dutch vision.
Jansen+co is seeking for high quality and ethical manufacturing, we choose to work with socially responsible factories and passionate craftsmen.

For more than 70 years, we are dedicated to interior lighting, uniting effort and sensibility to offer elegant and quality lamps. We offer a timeless, aesthetic and functional high-end product, oriented to cover our customer’s highest expectations.
All our lights are entirely manufactured in our workshop in Barcelona, ensuring their excellent final quality.
 	
Each one of our lamps is the result of a careful production process that begins with an accurate design. It is then followed with a careful manufacturing process done by hand and the use of the most contemporary technology.
Our lamps are created with noble metals and fine fabrics. They are handled with maximum care and applying the best treatments for an exquisite finish.
 	
We make customized projects for hotels, restaurants, cultural centers, retail and others, designed in close collaboration with interior designers, architects and lighting designers.
Our own production line allows us to create specific designs to suit the requirements of each project.
With this aim we have an excellent design and manufacturing team focused on meeting the demands of our customers.

James Stickley began his design career in art direction and set design for television. A belief in the importance of the longevity of both the design and object led him to a career in furniture design.

James believes that the longevity of an object, is routed in a combination of both its uniqueness, and its familiarity. Taking influence from the man made forms he sees around him, present in everyday life, he creates simple, functional, yet bold pieces; in a style that has been deemed as 'graphic minimal’.

A friend of mine started a project that revolved around what adults wanted to be when they were kids. From ninja astronauts to water park owner, there were some pretty fantastic answers. To be honest, I can't remember anything before artist. Which brings me to today.

Along with my wife and two cats, I’m a resident of Indianapolis, Indiana where I work (Art Director) and live (Artist). Designing by day. Makin’ art by night.

My background is crowded with fine art and design, so my artwork is a happy marriage between the two. From piece to piece, the work might stray further to one side or the other, but never too far.

I hope you like what you see while you’re visiting. Maybe share something with a friend to help spread my work around. Maybe hang something of mine on your wall. There is honestly nothing more flattering.

Scandinavian design – handmade in Denmark.
Each jewelry is made by hand, unique and one of a kind, made with a passion for great design. Grundled experiments with different handcraft technics and materials, such as handpainted wood, leather and metal.

The idea of Grundled is to create unique jewelry at purse friendly prices and never compromising on quality.

Jewelry by Grundled since 2014

Joey Roth picked himself. He picked himself to bring his wooden compass to the world. And his stunning Ceramic Speakers. And his handmade, self-watering planters.

By picking himself and (most of all) by making work that resonates, he brings his art to people who care about it, daily.

- Seth Godin

Joey was born in San Francisco and grew up in New Jersey. He graduated from Swarthmore with a BA in Industrial Design Theory. When taking a break from design, he likes long-distance skateboarding, reading and perfecting his BBQ.

Jana grew up in Manhattan, but her inspiration comes as much from the desert as the urban landscape. She studied at Brown and CCA, and began collaborating with Joey as soon as they met. She is a designer, muse, and head of operations for the studio.

John Green is nothing if not hardworking. The young British designer started entering competitions early into his career, garnering a dedicated following while still a student. Looking at his beautiful and highly functional wooden furniture, it comes as no surprise that he cites 'Bent Ply: The Art of Plywood Furniture' as his favourite book and reference material—his innovatively multifunctional furnishings strip wood of its weightiness, bending strong veneers into sturdy, irresistibly rounded forms. Green believes that hard work pays off, and the accolades that have come his way, including a nomination for Dwell's Young Designer Award, are proof that he's onto something.

Furniture and accessories brand created by Spanish designer Jorge de la Cruz. Born in Cáceres (Spain) in 1989, Jorge de la Cruz comes from a long tradition of wood artisan family. His work has been featured in various international magazines such as Yatzer, Neo2, Dezeen, Designboom, Casa Vogue and Wanted magazine. Jsign was a creative store in Napoli.
