Julica is full of clever ideas bringing fun and joy into the family`s daily routine. We oppose
dull mass products with our originally designed children`s furniture, home accessories,
and design gifts for kids. Colorful, creativity-stimulating, timelessly beautiful, that`s
what our products are, as well as functional, lovable, sustainable.
Children are full of imagination and always ready for action. Therefore, our products
function as furniture, toys, and accessories at the same time. All articles are rugged,
inviting kids to climb them or play with them. They are aesthetically attractive, uncompromisingly
child-oriented, and sustainably produced.
Our funny animal motifs provide a creative room for the kids to let their imagination
run wild. The charming characters impress with their imperfection, their crooked smile
and wild manners. These children`s rooms heroes serve perfectly as role models for bold
fraidy-cats and messy policemen. Each product has its own history, attracting attention
by smart details such as little secret compartments.

There are few greater luxuries than the calm of a Sunday. Backed up by the peace of mind that comes with socially-responsible and transparent manufacturing, Finnish label Junet creates interior furnishings that let that Sunday feeling last the whole week through. Crafted in Jurva by carpenters using traditional techniques, the label uses local materials and fabrics by some of Europe's leading textile manufacturers to imbue each piece with the tranquility of the Finnish countryside. The ideal balance of aesthetic sensibility, quality, and social responsibility, Junet creates a safe haven to come home to every day.

We make lifestyle accessories for urban nomads. Since we founded our company in 2013 in Berlin, we have been making design products from natural and locally sourced materials in Kyrgyzstan. And we ensure decent working conditions for our craftspeople as well as premium quality and design for our clients. Every product comes with a handmade label personally signed by one of the craftspeople in Kyrgyzstan to allow the client to learn more about the person and the story on our website.

Kann Design is the fruit of a union between different concepts of art and life. Our objective is to explore furniture design through a dialogue between our designers and a particular era or style. Kann furniture is a combination of more than 50 years experience added to a playful interpretation of the history of design. Our products are flexible and can be tailored to your personal requirements, as we are in direct contact with our lebanese producers. The result is reasonable prices, guaranteed quality and responsible production.

Space-saving futon furniture makes any room bigger. Sofa by day, bed by night - versatile and functional futon sofa-sleepers are ideal in that extra room for overnight guests, or as a primary sofa or bed anywhere in your home. Comfort, simplicity and space-saving efficiency are qualities that appeal to young and old alike.
The furniture from KARUP are designed for your first home, the teen-age room, guest room or vacation house.
The company KARUP was founded in 1972 by the entrepreneur Preben Christensen. Packed with ideas of how to change the way of producing furniture, he started out in an old farm house. As one of the first producers in Europe of knock-down furniture, the business grew rapidly, and soon he had to find new and more efficient locations for the factory. The production was relocated to the city of Karup, right in the centre of Denmark.
In beginning of the 80’s, Preben discovered the Hippie-type futon frame in America, and believed there was also a marked for this type of furniture in Europe, and that’s how the first series-production of futon frames came alive in Europe.
 
Today, second generation of the family has taken over the management of the company. Some values, how ever, remain sacred to our company. Our product development, which by the way is still lead by the founder, Preben, is still devoted to the space-saving concept. The main-production of the frames remain at factories in Denmark and Estonia, which makes it so much easier to meet the ethical code of conduct of our company ;-)
Our furniture are sold across the globe. Whether you live in Europe, Japan, Singapore, Middle East or the States, we will be able to find you a dealer in your area.

All our products are based on lab-equipment: We are inspired by the functionality, quality and aesthetic of the tools and equipment used in scientific labs.
 
Our products celebrate with their names the great thinkers in science:
Those we today probably would call ""nerds"", who dared to be different. They knew how to be creative, play with ideas, experiment and - not the least - they dared to error on the way to big discoveries.
 
KEMIKAZE's design gives you the possibility to create and experiment with form and expression: 
The components of the design can be placed, mounted and adjusted in many ways. 
The crude and industrial design provides contrast and edge to the home.

Inspired by the greatest thinkers.

Origin: Denmark

When Wallpaper* names you in a list of 40 designers who are changing the world, you know the bar is set high. No big deal: Vadim Kibardin is nothing if not confident. Russian by birth, Kibardin founded KIBARDINDESIGN in 2000, moving the studio to its current home in Prague in 2005. A tireless creator, the designer has added his personal touch to just about every kind of object. From furniture and home accessories, right down to electronics and science fiction movie props, his futuristic ingenuity knows no bounds. If it were possible to see the home of the future, there would almost certainly be a Kibardin or two in the mix.

Kordal is a women’s knitwear collection that fuses innovative forms and textures with functionality. We believe in creating garments that will inspire creativity and wearability. All of our knits are designed  and produced in an ethical manner in an effort to support American manufacturing and artisans abroad.
KUBISTIKA by Boris Draschoff

KaiGami’s Ethos and Mission Statement.

KaiGami's aim is to design, develop and manufacture functional, aesthetically

pleasing, innovative and affordable products, while also exploring premium

materials in order to create works for the design­conscious, luxury market.

We believe that success depends on three factors,: Innovation, Quality and

Delivery. This is why KaiGami produces 90% of

its designs at its manufacturing facility, using Laser Cutting technology. This

enables KaiGami to offer bespoke production in

one­offs or batch production, thereby maintaining quality.

We aim to become a globally recognised brand, known for producing

seriously top­quality, imaginative

works of art, in design.

Our motto is best described in these simple words ... "The world

around you creates you: fill it with beauty”.

KaiGami is dedicated to reducing its carbon footprint, so where possible it

manufactures its designs in the UK, in its production facility based in Lewes, East

Sussex.

A Concept For Creation

KaiGami (KG) draws inspiration from an ancient art form.

While KG's approach to creating design objects is similar, it produces its own

unique

style, as this short history explains.

Origami ­ Invented in the Far East ­ China AD 100

The name KaiGami was inspired by the ancient art form known as origami.

While the precise origins are obscure, it is believed that origami was created in AD

100,

shortly after the invention of papermaking by T'sai Lun, and later spread to Japan

in

around AD 600. KG follows the principle of origami in the idea that one can create

an

object from a flat piece of malleable material.

But that's where KG evolves away from origami, since KG creates objects that go

beyond ornamentation, with each design created for a specific function. And while

modern origami relies on a square, rectangular or triangular shape, KG does not.

The "Kai" in KaiGami can mean cut in Japanese. To create a piece of KG

sculptural design one must cut a profile, either symmetrical or asymmetrical, from

a piece of flat malleable material before the final process of creation begins. Once

cut the profile is usually bent into shape rather than folded and it is this process

that gives each design its curves and volume ­ quite unlike origami's angular

ornaments. The KG method produces exciting designs all with a distinctive stylistic

flavour!

British Made

It's important to KaiGami that its designs are manufactured in house in the UK.

We know that this helps the local economy through job creation, and the export of

goods: and we're confident that it also means that you get top­quality products.

Our carbon footprint reduced and our products can enter the market at

competitive rates.

Since laser technology is used to produce KaiGami products it is possible to offer a

bespoke service to clients. If producing a client's desired design isn't possible in

house,

then manufacturing will be outsourced, to local business wherever possible.

We wish to maintain Britain's reputation for producing classic designs and in so

doing to place KaiGami firmly on the map.

How you see time says a lot about who you are. Dutch label Karlsson makes sure that however you choose to look at it, there's a clock that matches your personal point of view. Founded in 1980, the label's original Station Clock set the tone for the sleek, simple lines that have defined Karlsson's aesthetic growth over the last three decades. With collections updated twice a year, the label continues to expand on its reputation, delivering surprising new designs that transform the humble wall clock into time-based art ready to grace the most discerning walls.

Every good story starts with a stupid idea. The story of Kerbholz begins in 2011: After Matthias & Moritz had been travelling along Central America for a while they rediscovered their love for wood. All along the way they had met the warm and haptic material: as a boat at the beach, as a terrace in the jungle or at the artisan markets of the indians.

The various ways of processing this warm and organic material filled them with enthusiasm and let no room for doubt: Wood needs a revi­val in each ones everyday street style!

From this idea, sleepless nights, blood, sweat and tears, Kerb­holz finally arose in 2012. Since then, Kerbholz stands for wooden glasses and wooden watches of finest quality, handmade from the most precious woods in the world. Since the very beginning Kerbholz works in a sustainable way without compromising on the clean design or quality. With every sold Kerbholz product we´re giving back to what we love and plant a tree in central america. Sustainably, measurable and transparent.

With woody regards,

Adrian, Matze, Moritz & Nils

L’ATELIER d’exercices, through its creators – industrial and graphic designers, authors, stylists, architects – proposes its research and ideas applied to materials, functions, everyday life, discovery, fun and the exceptional.

Lacambra bags are basic, functional and timeless, defined by the simple elegance that characterises a brand that goes straight to the essence of its products. Its mono-colour bags, briefcases, backpacks, wallets and iPad pouches come in a range of 24 different shades in the basic collection.

Behind every great invention is a person with something missing in their life, but in the case of LJ Lamps, it was two. When fitting out their apartment in Berlin, label founders Sascha Janowsky and Frank Lenhart fruitlessly searched department stores for the right lighting fixtures and shades. Finding nothing to fit their needs, the duo took light creation into their own hands—Sascha worked on design, while Frank regulated the sales end of the burgeoning business. From there, their inspired label LJ Lamps was born, producing fascinating pieces in wood and concrete—and the rest, as they say, is history.

LMBRJK is a design/fabrication studio based in Antwerp, Belgium  The studio marries contemporary digital methods of fabrication with analogue hand-based techniques to produce objects of intrigue and function.  

LMBRJK pushes at material and procedural tolerances in a continuous investigation to find new variations in form. It is through a desire to extract design from the visual splendor of the computer, that LMBRJK finds satisfaction in the hand-made.

In its current exploration of materials, LMBRJK is driven by a desire to distill radical new species from natural and synthetic ecologies, delivering objects born in the concept of digital wood.

Keeping cool in linen all summer long may be an old idea, but linen is proving to be the fabric of the future. Woven from the fibres of the flax plant, linen is the original performance textile, with the ability to keep us warm or cool depending on the season and grow stronger with each spin in the washing machine. Lithuanian label Lovely Home Idea is so enamoured with the fabric that its two designers work with it nearly exclusively: painstakingly handcrafted in Vilnius, each of Lovely Home Idea's linens are lovingly called perfect non-perfect design, allowing the integrity of the fabric to speak for itself—and provide bedtime comfort all year round.

Specialized in the design and manufacture of concrete furniture, Lyon Beton now open itself to the creation of objects by collaborating with artists and designers from Lyon.
"We aim to offer an alternative to all those who are looking for unusual objects. Combining creativity, aesthetics and practicality, our collections offer a discreet and strong presence."

Our concrete furniture factory-
Passionated by the technical and plastic possibilities of this material, we’ve been working during 5 years to develop a unique concrete, specially designed for the manufacture of furniture. It is armed with metal wire and fiber ; hence the acceptable weight. In all cases, it is resistant to attacks from everyday life and it is easy to maintain it indoors and outdoors.
The special care we take in our finishes respects the grain  so specific of the concrete, according to the intention of the designer, a soft and pleasant to touch or gross roughness around the edges. This technical expertise allows us to offer collections with neat corners and curves, emphasizing the unique character of the concrete and all that surrounds it.
Our collections are distributed worldwide through qualified distributors, encountered mostly during our participation in international fairs: Cologne (Germany), High Point (USA) and Shanghai (China).
Our showroom located in Villefranche sur Saône is open to the public all week. This is an opportunity for us to maintain contact with the users of our creations to better understand their expectations and continue to develop products that they will enjoy.

Even the oldest tradition needs to keep pace with the times. Fusing Italian heritage and craftsmanship, Due Ancore (est.1885) created LAMAMI , the innovative range of knives and accessories for food combing dedicated to rediscover the pleasure of cutting in different contexts where a blade is needed. The word LAMAMI is the combination of the two Italian words Lama (Blade) and Amami (Love me).
Design, Italian creativity are coupled with top quality environmentally friendly materials and strive for perfection down to the finishes and details.  Each  Lamami set is both beautiful and functional as well as neatly presented in an original book used as packaging made of recycled paperboard. The light colored, simply and elegant packaging which can be easily stored with cookbooks or on a shelf in the living room is designed to perfectly fit most interior house styles, whether your taste is traditional classic to more modern.

Designer Ilka Brand launched her artisanal accessory line Lapàporter in 2008. Ilkacreates functional accessories for laptops, smartphones, iPods and iPads, with asumptuous touch of fine luxury leather goods. All items are crafted by hand with anexquisite attention to detail in her Berlin based studio.Lapàporter’s design has a timeless and elegant feel. A luxurious soft leather selectioncoupled with a close fitted, structured silhouette defines the line. The bags arecompatible with Apple products but can be custom made and adjusted upon request.The laptop and iPad sleeves are meticulously padded and secure effortlessly with amagnetic closure. The bags function not only as protective covers, but also as stylishaccessories in their own right.Ilka Brand designs one collection a year, continuously updating her growing productline. The items are available throughout the entire year, and are supplemented bylimited editions that are released as special season items. Currently, there are fivedifferent styles consisting of three to five distinct looks in various colors, available inlambs leather, salmon skin, python leather or suede.

Beautiful tools for self-care and mind harmony.

There’s a sixteen year old girl named Jordana with low blood sugar walking through the halls at her high school, and it’s time that she uses her glucose monitor to check her blood levels. But she resists the obligation. Maybe she’s embarrassed to do it in front of her friends or stressed about an assignment or preoccupied by a crush she has on a boy. For whatever reason, she leaves the glucose monitor in her locker. Instead, she checks her Instagram.

In this scenario, Jordana needs two things: to check her glucose level and, on an immediate level, to be comforted. Instagram fulfills one of these needs, but what if there was a service that fulfilled both?

Lapka reimagines and redesigns the scientific devices used to do so as affordable, accessible and innovative accessories and services for self-care and mind harmony. It can be an uncomfortable and scary experience dealing with health that discourages people from engaging with the intimate moments of their daily lives. Instead of bringing medical aspects to your everyday life, we want to replace them altogether with a new kind of experience.

In 2010, Gaspard went to London to pursue his studies at the Royal College of Art. London’s winter being particularly tough and heating particularly expensive,his feet were frozen by the ice-cold stone floor. He had the idea to cut a spare piece of felt and sew it with his sneaker laces: the very first pair of Lasso slippers was born!

One hundred and sixty-four prototypes later the shape was perfected and the comfort optimized. Then Gaspard had the idea to keep them flat-packed so that anyone could assemble them with the laces of their choice. Back in Paris, he offered a pair to his friend Ruben to try out and see how he liked them. After sewing in the laces and experiencing Lasso for the first time, Ruben called Gaspard:

« Mec, chaud patate !! On va les faire à Paris !»
To be translated by:
« Mate, they are so warm, we’ve got to make them in Paris !»

So they started to look for a manufacturer and found the Sellerie Parisienne,at Villeneuve-Saint-Georges in the Parisian suburbs, a social enterprise that provides work opportunities for people with special needs. It offers all the skills needed to manufacture, package and ship Lasso to the customer. The die was cast! It took a lot more discussions, coffees, pints, sewing and sweat to establish Lasso: a young, social and conscientious brand. 

The Lasso slippers were launched on Kickstarter in February 2013 and they managed to pre-sell 1852 pairs, so 344% of their initial target. They are now being worn in 40 different countries...

It was 1946 in Omegna, a small lake village on the shores of Lake Orta, in northwest Italy; Legnoart was born here out of love and passion for wood and beauty. Today, after almost seventy years, Legnoart is among the major Italian companies in the household, kitchen and cellar furniture design business, and is distributed in over 52 countries. Our collections are the product of several meetings with designers sharing the will to fashion objects that match the sophisticated and elegant Italian style with innovation, function and durability. Products meant for those who love sophisticated wines and food and have a strong sense of beauty.

TAKATA Lemnos Inc. was founded in 1947 as a brass casting manufacturing industry in Takaoka-city, Toyama Prefecture, Japan and we launched out into the full-scale business trade with Seiko Clock Co., Ltd. since 1966.
We entered into the development for the original planning from late 1980 and "Lemnos Brand" recognized as the global design clock by a masterpiece "HOLA" designed by Kazuo KAWASAKI which released in 1989.
Afterwards, we made a lot of projects with well-known designers who took in active in Japan and overseas such as Riki WATANABE, Kazuo KAWASAKI, Shin AZUMI, Tomoko AZUMI, Kanae TSUKAMOTO etc. and we made announcement of their fine works abounding in artistry and prominent designs.
In addition, we realized to make a special project by the collaboration with Andrea Branzi, a well-known architect in the world.
Lemnos brand products are now highly praised from the design shops and the interior shops all over the world.
In recent years, we also have been given high priority to develop interior accessories making full use of our traditional techniques by the founding manufacturer and we always focus our minds on the development for the new Lemnos products in the new market.
Our Lemnos products are made carefully by our craftsmen finely honed skillful techniques in Japan. They surely bring out the attractiveness of the materials to the maximum and create fine products not being influenced on the fashion trend accordingly. TAKATA Lemnos Inc. definitely would like to be innovative and continuously propose the beauty lasts forever.

León León began in Mexico City in 2011 offering a new design concept mixing handcraft and artistic techniques. In our workshop everything is made by hand. We care about every single detail in every single piece. Inspired by the “Acapulco Chair” of the 50′s, León León developed 3 designs based on the original one: Mojito, Margarita and Cosmo.  The first line manage 5 different shape models and 3 types of weaving materials: plastic, vegetal fiber and gross leather. We also have 13 different colors and combinations selected and made specially for us. We care about the quality of our products. Each chair is woven on iron structure perfectly welded, and every rip is tight without loose ends.

Lina Patsiou is a furniture, object and installation designer based in London.
An engineer by training and an artist by temperament, Lina seeks inspiration in the facts to produce works of fantasy. Lina's products have been widely exhibited, awarded and published internationally.

Liquid Co. designs everyday essential products that deliver simplicity into your life through beautiful aesthetics and functionality. Every product by Liquid Co. is crafted with a considerable respect for fine detail. 

SIMPLE
The everyday carry (EDC) of an Essentialist has a composed blend of efficient functionality and simple design - any unnecessary elements that detract from this are eliminated.

PRACTICAL
The items carried daily by an Essentialist all serve a purpose in their everyday life. If it’s not vital it’s not carried.

ELEGANT
An Essentialist appreciates the design aesthetics of the items they carry – it expresses their style and can be an extension of who they are.

LOCKWOOD combines notions of modernist design with digital production and handcraft. Taking inspiration from traditional craftsmanship, science and contemporary art, the studio brings together materials, processes and manufacturing specialists to find new ways of production and form giving. The emphasis is on developing high quality products, from responsible material sources and production methods.

Examples of the studio’s work ranges from laser cut, fine wooden lamps that are hand assembled and finished, to CNC cut metal components and custom electronics for a sculptural lighting installation (of hand worked and polished steel and neon rings). Additive manufacturing for prototype production is another expertise, and has been used for mold development for hand casting of synthetic stone.

LOCKWOOD was established in 2012 by Canadian designer Simon Lockwood in Berlin, Germany with his wife Stefanie Lockwood joining in 2014. The couple now works together on their expanding product range that aims to continue to embrace the core values of lasting beauty, purity of purpose, and loyalty of time.

Lomography is a globally-active organization dedicated to creative and experimental photography. It all began in the early 1990s when a group of students from Vienna stumbled upon a small, enigmatic Russian camera called the Lomo Kompakt Automat (LC-A) in Prague. Mindlessly shooting from the hip, they were astounded with the mind-blowing photos that it produced. Upon returning home, friends wanted their own Lomo LC-A, igniting a brand new style of artistic experimental photography. Over more than 20 years since, through a constantly expanding collection of innovative cameras, instant products, films, lenses & photographic accessories, Lomography promote photography as a creative approach to communicate, absorb and capture the world in all its wondrous beauty.

Lucirmás is one of the first European brands specializing in up-cycling of glass bottles.
Lucirmás is both a designer brand, a studio, a workshop and a creative atelier.
In our workshop in Barcelona (Spain) we realize unique pieces in 100% recycled glass and offer a good quality of an handmade objects with an fair and lasting design.
We design and manufacture objects from sustainable glass which have and tell a story.
We aim to create contemporary objects that value the most charm, value and versatility of recycled glass ... and we do this taking care about the quality of all details.
Simple and elegant, functiona, l thise are our products.

The LuminAID light was designed by two design students, Andrea Sreshta and Anna Stork, shortly after the January 2010 earthquake in Haiti. When thinking about what they could design to make a difference, Andrea and Anna decided to focus on lighting because it had the potential to greatly improve the comfort, safety and survival of disaster victims. Inspired to design a simple, solar-powered lighting product that could be easily distributed in times of emergency, they developed the LuminAID light and founded LuminAID Lab to bring the technology to market. The product has been featured on the Today Show, Fox News, CNN, and in many print publications. The solar-led-inflatable technology is Patent Pending worldwide.

M.CRAFTSMAN based in London, are designers from different fields with the same passion in music. We play with materials, shapes and technology. We dedicate our work to high craftsmanship and pay attention to every detail.

Like the music we love, we communicate through our works with you, we add the fun and colors into functionality and practicality.

M. Craftsman brings the chic and sophistication ......With a touch of Modern Classics

Matt Pugh designs and produces contemporary furniture and home accessories. Working with a small team of artisans and craftsmen in a workshop nestled in the rolling hills near Bath in the west of England.

With longevity in mind, creating refined and beautifully crafted pieces from quality sustainable materials, combining simple detailing with a splash of colour.

Choosing natural materials for their timeless quality and minimal impact on the environment, each piece is designed and made to last more than a life time.
MDCplus sees itself as a young design orientated furniture label. Design with the plus in benefit. Multifunctionality combined with innovative design.

Based in the pleasant town of Rimini, MEME DESIGN is a new dynamic Italian company which manufactures trendy , useful and never banal objects and furnishing . Cinzia Olivieri , entrepreneur and NLP business coach is the owner of the company.

Menu is a Danish design company founded in 1976. We do design. All day actually. Occasionally at night as well. Collaborating with some of the most talented designers in the world we deliver high quality design with an aesthetical Scandinavian look.
 
We’re passionate, original, and responsible. And we believe in making design matter. Design matters when a product meets a real need and when it’s useful, timeless, and made from honest materials. When design is original in shape, function or material combination it matters and most of all; design matters when produced in a community where it makes a difference – when it improves quality of life

‘Menuha’ sincerely hopes to create the space to make you feel peaceful and relaxed.
We focus on refining original value of raw materials, because we believe a simple and classic one is the best. Therefore, ‘Menuha’ inspires from nature and timeless materials; metal craft, leather, stone and resin which could be used for a long time and have long-lasting value.
‘Menuha’ comes from the Hebrew word meaning ‘tranquility’.
A ‘skull’ and a ‘hand’ in the logo of ‘Menuha’ present a brand philosophy.
‘Skull’ symbolizes menuha’s ethos to make peaceful space where you could feel secure. Also, ‘Hand’ presents menuha’s pride to pursue hand-made works with local craftsmen.
MIKINORA is created, designed and nurtured by Miki Nora Christopherson.

Based in Paris and Hong Kong, MMT is a brand specialised in pocket watches blending quality watchmaking and poetic storytelling.

All the watches are housed in a solid wooden shell. The organic specificity of the material gives the watches their uniqueness, each piece is individual and different from any other.

A MMT watch is more than a timepiece, it is an object that will become a token of your own story.

MOA Eating Products seduces into culinary worlds.
Vera Wiedermann, born 1986 in Innsbruck, moved first to Milan and then relocated to Vienna to study Industrial Design at the University for Applied Arts and founding her own designstudio in 2010. 
MOA designs functional products from tableware to food and eating design concepts, develops space installations, restaurants and workshops.
MOB

MOKU is a Japan-based furniture design studio founded and run by Masayuki & Hideyuki, a son & pop team. We are determined to make modern working optimally comfortable through both function and aesthetics and help you work mutely and absorbedly ("moku moku" in Japanese).

The story of Molami is, like the brand itself, one that involves no compromises. The brainchild of industrial designer Maria von Euler, Molami was born from the cross pollination of fashion and product design. By incorporating the inspired process of tailoring – how materials and shapes flatter the female form – into a methodical and engineer driven industrial design approach, the Molami products were sculpted. The result is a line of headphones in that feel like no other, in exclusive materials and with an outstanding audio quality.

We are inspired by today’s urban sophisticates and trendsetters and we strive to develop products that would satisfy the various demands of their busy lifestyle needs.
We design and develop solution based products that they crave and need.

MONOFOLD offers today’s sophisticates and trendsetters a carrying solution with the belief that style should not be compromised for functionality.
With one fold, you can customize and transform the design and the function of the bag.

MONOFOLD is crafted from the highest quality of lightweight material, treated to be water resistant and weather-proof.
Each compartment was designed for easy access and secure storage, constructed to protect your valuables and smart devices from external impact.

It is CREATIVE, CLEVER and ultimately PRACTICAL.

Origin: South Korea
Best product selections of the year!

Established in 2006, Munkii has given us an opportunity to bring our own perspective and flavor to the modern living space. 
Our design summarizes the brand and we are fanatical in creating furniture that loathe getting ignored and a definite conversational piece. They are great additions that flaunt both beauty and innovation,  designs that are just - keen to ham up your space.

Characteristic of my work is a transparent and powerful language of forms.

In my process of design I relate parts that leads to an eventual form. This process of relating produces subtle designs because of their simplicity and transparency. On the one hand parts need each other, while at the other hand a different layer is being opened up by a humoristic questioning of the functionality of existing products. Sometimes this process leads to an engagement of cartoon nature.
Makers With Agendas is a new design capacity engaged in thinking, producing and distributing design.

This story started in a pretty classic way. Having graduated from high school, Simone leaves Toulouse to discover Paris. She then studies art at two top schools, the ESAG Met de Penninghen and the Charpentier Academy in Paris. There, she learns about shapes, colors and typography which will naturally take her to work for an advertising agency as artistic director, during 6 years. But she realizes that becoming an adult is no fun. So, she gets down to work and decides to devote her spare time fighting against adulthood and seriousness. To postpone this dreaded eventuality, she decides to create a world in which adults look quirky, odd, kind of old fashioned with their mustaches and glasses. Simone thumbs her nose and pokes fun at daily life. Next, frustrated to only see her friends in one dimension, flat on a piece of paper, she becomes the proud owner of a sewing machine and soon designs and makes a whole collection of characters. Thus were born Jean-Louis, Rosalie and several others. And with them appears the trademark. Today the brand is distributed in over 10 countries.

Magali selects with care precious metals and fine stones: spinel, moonstone or labradorite set against silver and vermeil. These materials gain a harmonious patina and present no risk of allergy. This level of quality insures these creations last through time.

Magali’s creations are handmade, piece by piece, according to traditional jewellery techniques. Each jewel is meticulously shaped: hand hammering and milling, for unique reliefs. Parisian artisanal savoir-faire.

The collections are produced in small series, in a workshop close to the historic neighbourhood of the Bastille. They are stamped with the mint master’s mark, certifying the precious metal titration and the French fabrication. The chains and clasps come from the most ancient foundries in Paris and Florence, Italy.

Magnus Pettersen Studio is a design led brand that creates products whilst ensuring the art of production stays top of mind.

Our award winning way of working stemmed from the early days. Instead of waiting to have designs picked up by other brands Magnus Pettersen has always pushed into tangible prototypes without procrastinating. It’s simply more exciting that way. 

Today the making of products is something we take even more seriously. Any time a product transitions from sketchbook to a small product run, every last detail is scrutinised.

Considered design with attention to detail is our core value.

This stems from a merger of Scandinavian heritage with learning and living day-to-day on UK soil. Materialistically these influences become apparent too. We work with mixed materials, whether it’s metalwork inspired by British industrialism or wood inspired by the sprawling forests of Norway and beyond.

Our style is contemporary, yet classic enough to be future proof. We create products to seamlessly co-exist within modern interiors. 

Everything we craft is well made. Quality is ensured through using traditional techniques and materials, from certified solid wood to mouth blown glass and carefully selected metals.

Every once in a while we will take more contemporary approaches using materials like concrete provided the inclusion heightens the overall design.

We strive to push design boundaries by challenging the way we utilise traditional manufacturing methods.

Magnus Pettersen Studio is based in Hackney, London, UK.

After his graduation from the Royal Academy of Antwerp in 1979, Martin Margiela founded Maison Martin Margiela in 1988. Often referred to as iconoclast, avant-garde and experimental, the Maison expresses its creativity through recycling, transformation and reinterpretation - like a unique proposal defying all laws and rules. The collections gather several lines of products: from ‘Artisanal’ pieces hand-made in the Paris atelier of the Maison to timeless classics, from radical accessories to casual clothes, from fashion to interior design, each of them complementing one another to compose a whole universe, way beyond a mere style. Besides the conception of its collections, the unique identity of the Maison has been clearly recognizable in its various spaces – from showrooms to shops – with signature elements such as the use of whites, cotton fabrics, “trompe-l’oeil”, mix of styles and époque, and hints of humor creating a distinctive atmosphere. Line 13 – objects & publications – was introduced in 1999 with a selection of home objects.
A workshop artisan, inventor and professor in Paris (since 1993), François Azambourg has always worked for simplicity and lightness, which are the signature qualities of his work at first glance. His first subject of study was the weight and instability of the saxophone. He spent ten years improving upon its design and performance. Since then, his projects have focused on materials for the future as well as non-synthetic materials for industry, publishing and galleries. His research has resulted in creative designs for leather tables, skeletal chairs, openwork folded garden chairs, light fixtures with hair-like fiber optics and streetlights with long stems. The Two Propeller Mobile, each arm quivering at the slightest breath, was specially designed for “Exercises in air and wind”.

MPDESIGNSHOP is a Philadelphia-based lighting and design company founded in New York City in 2011. We design and manufacture a curated selection of custom and industrial lighting fixtures, as well as provide design and interior project management services. Founder and designer, Dennis Murphy, received his B.Arch degree from the Cooper Union School of Architecture before working in public-sector design at the NYC Department of Design and Construction. Our first lighting fixtures were the result of necessity, illuminating a north Brooklyn apartment that didn't have a single light socket. We take pride in the craftsmanship and quality of of our products which are assembled by hand in our Fishtown studio. We follow Andy Warhol's maxim "making money is art, and working is art, and good business is the best art."

Marshall is a true rock legend. That uniquely clear and expressive sound combined with a mythical stage presence has enraptured music fans around the world for five decades. We’re celebrating the brand’s rich heritage with commemorative products that live and breathe Marshall.
The legacy begins in a small drum shop in west London in the 1960s, where Jim Marshall sought to give a bunch of then-local guitarists the sound they wanted – a sound that was harder, crunchier and richer. The result was the JTM45, an amp that reverberated with a sound that was much heavier than anything ever heard before. And in a twist of rock and roll fate, those guitarists, much like the Marshall name, would go on to revolutionize music forever. 
Fifty years on, generations of guitarists and fans still revere the name. Since that very first amp, Marshall continues to push the boundaries of loud into the unknown, bringing the stadium experience home to the individual listener.

The Hemmesphere lighting range, from Massow designs, takes beautifully crafted and sculpted wood, offset against the industrial feel of a bare lightbulb, to make this statement piece lighting range. The design goes further than the fitting its self by creating unique shadows which can give any room a one of a kind feel with a warm and fulfilling glow. Taking Japanese influences, the lamps are designed to be peaceful by using very clean lines and brilliant craftsmanship. As very tactile pieces, they bring a brilliant energy into any space.

Matrix Audio Ltd was formed in Toronto, Canada by a small group of friends who shared a deep passion for innovation and consumer electronics.  With backgrounds in R&D, quality control, and manufacturing the team quickly began producing some of the world’s best quality portable sound solutions.

Matrix Audio Ltd believes firmly that portable is something pocket-sized and not something you have to plan for in advance to take with you.  As a technology driven company we are constantly crossing into uncharted territories to stay one step ahead of the ever-changing landscape of today’s marketplace.

Mavis Möbler AB started producing furniture in 1917 in the deep forests in Småland, a southern county of Sweden. Quality and design have always been the key, using good raw materials and always with the mind on the environment. During the years the company have transformed from a pure pine bedroom supplier to designers of simplistic and stylish storage furniture.  The design is easily recognized through the Scandinavian style with the subtle quality details. 
In recent years the company has set the focus on collaborations with the top designer’s names in Sweden and is now one of the key suppliers to many of the top name furniture stores in the country.
Samples are done in house. All items are produced at hand picked producers in Latvia and Lithuania.

Atelier Max Lipsey is the workshop of Max Lipsey, a designer from the US currently working in Eindhoven, the Netherlands. 

Max's work follows his own fascinations with craft, production techniques, and objects. After an intellectually based education in the US, Max has been delving into a more intuitive, hands on way of working...letting his ideas come from interactions with material and observations in the moment rather than an intellectual structure. Through this way of working, he strives to find more authentic, surprising ideas.

Max's biggest design goal is to challenge what we make industrially to be more spontaneous and vital...to incorporate more of the human qualities he finds in certain craft worlds.

Rough hewn and sophisticated, McLovebuddy traverses the space between practical and fantastical.

The brand likes to split things/memories into two categories: classic and baroque - Classic sticks closer to the profile/function, its creativity working on the structural; whereas, baroque focuses on flourish and embellishment with less regard to form and structure. Both are beautiful as are science and alchemy, reason and myth ...

...with strong influences from art/painting, design, classic camping outdoors gear, and military bags - hence the well built bags and accessories that are crafted with affection.

London-based jewellery designer Mei-Li Rose produces handcrafted jewellery perfect for the fashion-conscious crowd.

Every piece is unique and never mass produced. Mei-Li crafts each piece by hand from her studio, using the ancient art form of lost wax casting; a technique that produces truly bespoke designs, and always with a Mei-Li Rose twist in the textures, shapes and finishes.

Mei-Li received her BA in Jewellery & Silversmithing from Birmingham’s School of Jewellery in 2010. She then worked as a designer for a high-street jewellery retailer, undertaking commissions to create bespoke pieces for clients before deciding to launch her own brand, Mei-Li Rose Jewellery, in 2013.

Metafaux Design represents a subtly implied signifier of experimental contemporary design spirit by Juyoung Kim who has started own creative works and professional freelance in London, since he graduated from Central Saint Martins MA Industrial Design, in 2009.
​​The meaning META + FAUX has its own paradoxical idea with including the conception of ancient greek theory 'mimesis' about Art. As it's pronounced as [métə-foʊ], which subsequently reminds the sound of 'metaphor' in homonymous, the all work and projects indicate some implicit signifiers in order to convey new perspective and distinctive experience to people.
It may be inferred as cultural crossover, or mixture of art and craft, and ﻿blowing the boundary between archetypal tradition and modern design philosophy. Moreover, it doesn't just demolish the formal and trends, but recreate​ and reinvent them through eclectic, experimental methods.
The pleasure of intellectual thought-provoking, and such newness in ordinary life will be given through creative reinterpretation by METAFAUX.

Mifuko Ltd was founded by Minna Impiö and Mari Martikainen in 2009. Both are designers in Helsinki. Minna used to live in Kenya for four years, while Mari visited her regularly. During that time the idea of Mifuko was born set off. For them working in Mifuko means rich cooperation between two culture – creative and fun work! With the process of consensus we can produce better, ethically made and more exciting products together with talented African artisans.

Miller Cast Products is the retail arm of J. Walter Miller Company.  Founded in 1887, by our namesake, we have gone through many evolutions during our 127-year history.  After serving an apprenticeship in Philadelphia, PA in the trade of electroplating, J. Walter Miller moved to Lancaster PA and started his own plating business.  Shortly after, the company evolved into both a foundry and a lock making business.  Although both the plating and the lock making subsided in the 1930's, the foundry remains strong today, as a leader in the production of brass and bronze industrial castings.  Firmly situated in the middle of the Pennsylvania Dutch country, we carry on the same ideals and core values of honesty, loyalty, teamwork, integrity, and commitment that were started in 1887.
The experience we have gained over our one-hundred plus years is priceless and the one we share with our customers every day.
Miller Cast Products marries yesteryear patterns and designs with the beauty of our sand-cast brass collectibles.  Our timeless appeal focuses on quality-handcrafted designs made by our artisans from the heartland of Central Pennsylvania.  We have chosen pieces to accentuate your personal or to give as a very special gift. 
Miller Cast Products is proud to continue the legacy of its founder by our long history of devotion to our customers.

We are Zoe Miller and David Goodman we are designers who live and work in Brighton, South coast of England we make kids books for the Tate Gallery. A is for artist 2004 Colour 2006 and Shape 2008 we also produce an exclusive Tate product range

In 2008 we launched our millergoodman brand, our first product ShapeMaker won best gift for kids at Top Drawer 2008

We also run a consultancy called silence which helps creatives explore their ideas through still and moving image reference.

Minus tio designs, produces and markets high quality furniture for contract use. All items are manufactured in Sweden.Minus tio was founded by Ingrid Svensson and Olle Wingård in the winter of 2007. The name comes from a perfect cold day with bright sunshine, a fine snow cover and minus ten degrees. The air of that day is reflected in the design of the furniture as well as in the structure of Minus tio. Sharp and complete, with closeness to nature and natural materials.

Misoui offers a selection of expertly crafted leather goods for men and women. It is not only fashion brand, it is a system of value and way of living.

Misoui uses only organic leathers for their products and they are selected by touch, smell and overall quality. The ingredients used to prepare and stain the leathers are also organic.

Everything that is made in our workshop is minimalistic, simple and made from best quality materials. Every product is made entirely by hand, for each customer. The brand is marked by exquisite details that reflect the beauty of traditional handmade goods.

After years of freelancing for manufacturers in Belgium and the Netherlands, industrial designer and architect Steven Wittouck launched MOCA in 2010. The acronym stands for Modern Objects Creating Atmospheres, and the goal is to produce furniture by both Wittouck and like-minded up-and-comers.
Moca philosophy is very simple. No big theory in this company.
We want to surprise you by new designs, which are produced with respect for human and his environment. These should have highest quality requirements. If we can delight you with our furniture, if we can enjoy you for longer time, if you don’t regret your purchase after years, then our mission has succeed.
So simple is our philosophy.

“When we think of modernism, we think about clear lines, rich materials and simple yet ingenious detailing, made with an unbridled optimism towards the future.” 
 
Launched in 2013, Modiste strives to expand the modernist tradition with new and original perspectives on design. Their furniture combines honest materials and the latest in manufacturing processes with traditional techniques to create beautiful products with a modern feel.
 
Based in Rotterdam in the Netherlands, Modiste Furniture believes that the manufacture of quality products begins with the selection of the right materials: they take great pride in selecting only the finest available. Modiste works closely with dedicated craftsmen to create beautiful, yet practical pieces of furniture. It is their belief that the final product is ultimately defined by its finish, be it wood, steel or stone -  so they make an effort to use organic materials, and of course some elbow grease, to complete each product. Modiste ensures that every piece, from start to finish, is aesthetically pleasing, practical and a testament to the quality and craftsmanship of modern furniture.
 
The products made at Modiste are simple yet evocative. These pieces offer comprehensive functionality while maintaining the warm soothing comfort that natural materials provide. The team at Modiste designs, manufactures, develops and distributes in close collaboration with an ever-growing network of dedicated local craftsmen.
Moduletto

Modultyp is a company of modular elements and decorative, designed and manufactured entirely in Barcelona.Comes from the need to decorate ordering, to adapt the furniture to small spaces, to provide flexibility, to create places that store, and also have a decorative function.Products designed to make life easier.His philosophy is: if you can imagine it, you can create ...Imagine being able to order the space to your liking? Imagine creating a shelf for your needs?In Modultyp find parts with different shapes and colors that fit your space, sort want find self-folding shelves to give them the shape you need, adjustable desks to your needs, coupled modules in different positions adapting to your environment, etc. ....In Modultyp can buy many household accessories that will add a special touch to your corner. All this at a very affordable price.The mayorial of these products are made with fine textured sheet to give much warmth.

"As a kinesiotherapist, Emilie Creuzieux was always in a hurry. Finding time to eat on busy schedule was practically impossible. Through her own experiences, as with busy individuals everywhere, she longed for a solution to her challenge: how to combine practicality, efficiency and healthy eating while respecting for the environment and saving money by eating in?

A lover of Japanese culture, during her search she discovered the bento box and, after observing that she was not alone with her newfound passion, decided to start her own bento company.

monbento mania is now on its way!"

All my drawings are done with nothing but simple ballpoint pens on grey recycled cardboard. Most of the originals measure 70x50 or more and it takes 5-10 pens pr. piece. The drawings is then photo- graphed and digitally printed as posters, on high quality silk matt coated 220 gsm paper. My imagery explores a world of animals, all with a touch of human personality and a twist of humour. I just love how my drawings make people smile. I graduated from The Danish School of Media & Journalism in Copenhagen in 2014 and have been working fulltime with my drawings since then.

Irish heritage brand Mourne Textiles have been weaving at the foot of the rugged Mourne mountains for over half a century. A family business begun by Norwegian design pioneer and grandmother Gerd Hay-Edie, the traditional weaving techniques created on custom-made looms have been handed down to daughter Karen Hay-Edie before passing the baton onto her grandson, Mario Sierra. 

From humble beginnings in a small workshop in the late 1940s, Gerd’s name was soon to become a staple in mid-century British design through long standing collaborations with Robin Day for Hille and Terence Conran, producing specially designed upholstery and rugs. Her Tweed Emphasize and Mended Tweed fabrics were also celebrated within the fashion industry when they were shown as part of Irish designer Sybil Connolly’s 1956 Spring and Winter collections. 

Bringing Mourne Textiles into the 21st century but staying true to the history and tradition of the workshop, Mourne continues to source much of their yarns from Donegal and custom dyes them to match the heritage pieces originally created by Gerd. These yarns are intrinsic to Mourne’s Irish-Scandinavian roots and with a rich and textured quality and warmth, their throws and cushions are a testament to Gerd’s classic style, standing the tests of time.

We believe to create great products; we have to start with a simple idea and then craft around that intention. We obsessively try to keep it as simple as possible, while trying to make each part as good as possible, every stitch, every button, they have all been intensively thought out. While it’s not easy to keep things simple, it does pay off to create a product that is perfect in a sense of simplicity to that extent that you cannot leave anything away without compromising it’s intention.It’s part of our personalities to keep challenging ourselves, raising the bar on a daily bases. This certainly doesn’t make things easy for ourselves, but we simply don’t know how to do it any other way. We get satisfaction out of trying to create an even better product or experience, it makes us feel good to try to improve it over and over again, it’s in our DNA.

NALLIK is a word borrowed from the Inuit language. It cannot be translated directly but means protection and nurturing in a loving way. Inuit people appreciate that we are all connected to each other and our surroundings. They respect the environment and know it contains everything we need to live. NALLIK represents that sense of sustainability.
NALLIK’s logo is the chemical structure of silicates, which is what minerals are made of.
Therefore NALLIK uses mainly raw semi precious and precious stones. Those are Amethyst, Amazonite, Aventurine, Green Opal, Ruby, Citrine, Chrysocolla, Quartz, Turquoise, Smokey quartz and emerald in mother rock, to mention a few.
It is scientifically proven that minerals have a healing and balancing physical effect.

AUTHENTIC FURNITURE for work and living.
NOODLES NOODLES & NOODLES CORP. has been producing handmade furniture for private and commercial spaces for over two decades.
Our Authentic Furniture product line includes clothing racks, side boards, cabinets, shelves, tables, benches, stools, sofas, beds and kitchen furniture. The style of this line takes its inspiration from the classic industrial design of the early 20th century.
Our furniture pieces are made out of dark steel and are available with a transparent matt seal or white baked enamel. The wood comes from sustainably managed forests and is processed in one of Europe's most traditional sawmills. The surface of the wood is brushed and finished with a high-quality, all natural oil which is certified organic.
The distinct style can be easily used as an atmospheric accent in combination with a wide range of furniture styles or used as an overall design.

Nordic Tales is a tale of small and great ideas that are given a chance to be part of the Scandinavian design tradition. The vision is that of creating a modern design company where designer and product go hand in hand from sketch to final object and further on to the retail stores. It is a story of young talents with a passion for design and a wish to make small changes.

Nordic Tales trade products in which both form and wrapping tell a tale. A tale, you as consumer contribute to by choosing for instance colour of a cord or size of a light bulb. It is a story that changes as you decide how to use your new product and its packaging. In this way you become part of the story of Nordic Tales and at the same time you create a unique and personal design for yourself.

Nordic Tales believe that quality design can easily grow from small ideas into great products through a process where both designer and consumer play a considerable role.

Nostalgia Lights is a brand brought to you by Nook London; an East London business that has gained recognition throughout Europe.Nook London was formed in 2011 by St Martins graduate Hattie Hollins and specialises in industrial, vintage styled lighting.The Nostalgia Lights brand can be found in stockists and design houses across Europe and have featured in countless re-fittings of hotels, restaurants, bars, venues and homes.

Nostalgia Lights Reserve is the sub-brand from Nostalgia and launched in SS2015 with our four maiden styles of lamp shade in a either a dusky matte black, or grey finish. A subtle Reserve emblem on each shade marks the quality, while the bespoke packaging, with embossed leather detailing embodies the ethos of the Reserve Collection; marrying industrial/vintage design, with a bespoke modern touch.

Hi! My name is Philipp, I am the founder of furniture design studio NUTSANDWOODS. In 2013, I was looking for the perfect wooden dinner table. I couldn’t find it, so I started to design furniture myself. That’s when NUTSANDWOODS was born.

We create bags, totes and gadget accessories. All our products are made by hand, locally, from carefully selected italian leathers, felt and functional techno materials. We have also created an easy "lifestyle" line, made from hi-quality felt with leather straps and details. These very affordable totes are great for a daily carry-around. Of course we could not neglect our precious gadgets, so we're currently developing protective pouches and sleeves for mobile phones, iPads and laptops.

Starting in summer 2012 Räthgloben 1917 Verlag offers a new collection of globes showing a cartography charted by NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC.

National Geographic globes present an enhanced view of the world through expert cartography, proprietary fonts and rich detail. An excellent reference tool, these beautiful globes are carefully researched by National Geographic’s cartographers and editors, ensuring the utmost accuracy.

National Geographic Maps was established as a division of the National Geographic Society in 1915 and publishes a vast collection of wall maps, travel maps, outdoor recreation maps, atlases, globes and digital products that inspire people to care about and explore their world.
The National Geographic Society is one of the world’s largest nonprofit scientific and educational organizations. Founded in 1888 to “increase and diffuse geographic knowledge,” the Society’s mission is to inspire people to care about the planet. National Geographic reflects the world through its magazines, television programs, films, music and radio, books, DVDs, maps, exhibitions, live events, school publishing programs, interactive media and merchandise. National Geographic has funded more than 9,600 scientific research, conservation and exploration projects and supports an education program promoting geography literacy.
National Geographic has been a world leader in cartography for more than 120 years and the combination of its signature cartographic styles with our fresh, innovative materials and designs will create a new globe line of unprecedented style and value. The flexible, efficient, European-based production by our italian parent company Tecnodidattica can meet demands ranging from small quantities to very large orders of accurate and innovative geographic globes. We embrace our leadership position in this market and we are committed to satisfying our customers with the diligence and attentiveness of our after-sales service.

John Brunner and Igor Duc started NATIVE UNION in 2009 with the belief that we all need tools to support this modern way of working. In adopting this lifestyle themselves, they understand the demanding new needs of today’s modern worker.

NATIVE UNION is committed to making timeless design accessories of exceptional quality. The range of products are a unique combination of simplicity, utility and aesthetic that transition easily from the boardroom to the bar. Garnering considerable critical acclaim from the design community, NATIVE UNION has offices in London, New York, San Francisco and Hong Kong; with product available in the finest retailers across the world.

British designer Nick Fraser produces a collection of contemporary interior products, characterised by re-imagining the familiar. His playful designs offer well-considered functionality combined with character and charm. 

Using a range of materials and processes all products are manufactured in the UK, with a large proportion being made by hand in his studio. Nick focuses on quality objects that find a balance between individuality and a refined visual appeal. 

We naturally form memories of objects and materials in our everyday lives. Nick’s aim is to explore and build on these connections in an unexpected way. By playing with the visual and functional attributes of the norm, a new appreciation can be created. 

BACKGROUND

Nick formed his company in 2007 as part of the Design Centre’s business start-up program at University College Falmouth. He then set up his studio in East London where he was based for 4 years, before moving to Frome in Somerset.

Successfully selling his designs for over seven years now, you can find Nick’s products in many countries across Europe, North America and Asia. His refreshing approach has caught the buyers’ eyes at world-class retailers such as Liberty, V&A, Heal’s, Paul Smith and The Design Museum. Other clients include Google, Ted Baker and Channel 4 productions.

Nick has exhibited at various design fairs such as Maison & Objet in Paris, 100% Design in London, and Salone Satellite in Milan. His work has been featured in most major broadsheet and interior design publications in the UK and around the world.

"Niki Jones is a Glasgow based interiors brand creating unique hand-crafted textiles and homewares. Inspired by Creative Director Niki’s discoveries whilst travelling the globe, the designs reflect her traditional Scottish roots where she discovered a love of craft and textiles, mixed with her adventurous and extensive travelling. 

Niki combines different cultural references within her designs with a love of traditional technique, natural materials and colour to create a distinctive collection of textiles and rugs."

Founded in 2005 in East London, city’s hub of young creativity, Nitin Goyal London has fast established its trademark with its instantly recognizable ‘signature look’ of visually and texturally tactile fabrics using hand crafted detailing such as intricate smocking, pleating and stitching along with an interesting mix Hand Crafted textures  & Timeless modern prints for the luxury interior textiles market, catering for both commercial and residential interiors. Quality is key and therefore every piece is handcrafted from start to finish making it even more unique.
 
Nitin Goyal, a post graduate from NTU and an award winning British designer with Indian roots, has an experience of working in the industry for over 12 years and constantly brings together the cultural influences from his childhood and travels around the world and combine them with his strong craft aesthetic to create modern innovative designs that are functional, new yet timeless. “Travel, art, craft, music and nature” are his muses.
 
Global hand crafts, fine materials and a touch of glamour all add to create a contemporary, elegant, timeless yet individual collection. Geometry, symmetry and rhythmic movement of lines play a key role and remain central to all his designs.

The brand is one of the most widely recognized and respected interior textile brands in the UK with an ever growing international celebrity fan list including Robbie Williams, Tom Cruise, Emma Thompson, Keely Shaye Smith and Isla Fisher.

The textile design studio NoMoreTwist unites 3 designers around a giant loom. Michèle, Anne and Marie met at the ARBA-ESA in Brussels. The NoMoreTwist project – a place for collective research as well as a brand of textile objects – came to fruition as their studies ended.

The brand’s DNA is textile. Each new production considers the thread itself, its thickness, texture, colour and, above all, the various ways of interlocking it. Developing different weaves is at the heart of NoMoreTwist’s work, posing a continual challenge to design new and amazing fabrics. They are then highlighted within collections of throws, cushions, large floor cushions,… And all 100% ‘made in Belgium.’                    

With this little characteristic ‘twist,’ the objects bring a touch of originality and colour, giving character to any interior.

NoMoreTwist also offers its expertise to object designers, stylists or architects interested in tailored design.

 


NoMoreTwist collections are auto-edited in small series. They are entirely created in Belgium.

The created objects highlight the woven textile which is the authentic DNA of the brand.The beginning of the creation process is always a thread itself and all his possibilities of arrangement in a textile. After researches on textile structures made in the studio, the patterns and the colors naturally take shape.
NoMoreTwist collections are auto-edited in small series. They are entirely created in Belgium.

The created objects highlight the woven textile which is the authentic DNA of the brand.The beginning of the creation process is always a thread itself and all his possibilities of arrangement in a textile. After researches on textile structures made in the studio, the patterns and the colors naturally take shape.

The Nordic temperament is known for being a bit cool, cold even by some accounts. Challenging that stereotype, 2015 Green Good Design Award-winning Finnish label Nordic Hysteria produces clean and simple lighting and accessories that fuse together warm raw materials and high-end technology for inviting homes. The launch of its first collection at the 2014 Helsinki Design Week caused a somewhat out-of-character frenzy. Created by award-winning designer Tapio Anttila, the range makes use of Anttila's aptitude for working with wood, simple almost ascetic forms, and subtle humour—a beautiful way to defy clichés.

Normann Copenhagen is a Danish design company with the mission to create original, bold and eye-catching products in a simple and contemporary design that withstands the test of time. Or in other words, to challenge conventional thinking and make the ordinary extraordinary through great and innovative design

Some things in the world naturally pull at our attention and we want them to be part of our lives. The best cutting-edge accessories appreciate and tap into these instinctive desires by being convenient tools that blend seamlessly into your life. NuAns is a nuanced new answer to providing that comfort in our lives.

Octàgon Design was born in 2012 as an editor of design products, 100% made in Barcelona, with the aim to market its own production of stationery products such planners, calendars and notebooks. Although living in the digital age and being like everyone else, great digital users, there are moments and activities where we tend to prefer paper, and the quality and agility that handwriting provide us.Time goes by but we consider it something pleasant.

We love everything we do and everything we live everyday and so we note it down to remember it. We are excited about our future plans and we like to see what is going to come next.

Octàgon Design's objective is now to produce and market several products, taking into account innovation, creativity, design and quality.

Octàgon Design was recognised during the ceremony of the Design Management Awards Award 2014 celebrated on the 20th of November in St. Etienne (France). The award ceremony took place at the Cité du Design Centre in St.Etienne.

Octàgon Design got an Honourable Mention as ‘Best management of design in a micro-size company’.

The DME Award competition is the first of its kind to award the management contribution of successful design, and provides a review of the current state of the art of design management for managers, designers and researchers to learn from. The DME Awards have already been referred to as the 'Oscars for design management', being recognition of excellent quality and successful design management.

Entering the DME requires the submission of a poster that summarises each organisations approach to managing design that is then assessed by independent experts.

Click here to see OUR DME AWARD POSTER

Designer: Octavi Serra

Of was created by the italian designer Fabio Carminati. Graduated in Industrial Design at the Politecnico institute in Milan, he moved to Switzerland and begun to work for international brands like Napapijri, Armani, Moleskine and Hugo Boss designing bags and leather goods acquiring a deep experience in the accessories market.
In 2011 he decided to open his own company to run the new brand Officine Federali.
The brand name reminds to the Helvetic Railways factories and it’s inspired by the functionality and beauty of its workwear and its work tools, designed to resist to the time, to extreme use conditions and where each instruments is produced with durable materials and leather inserts, handcrafted to last in time.
In the “Officine” workshop, these elements are re-elaborated by expert Italian hands, joining vegetable tanned leather, military waterproof cottons and technical materials like neoprene or “cordura”. When sown together, through resistant tailored stitches, a unique product is created, which will last in time.
The results?
A young and modern company focused on workmanships, into “doing less but doing it better” with more passion, more sense and easier, discovering a taste for living all over again.
Top Quality Bags discovering traditions and respecting new social behavior in which individuals live simpler to escape from the rat race of obsessive materialism.
Do you think they are just fine words?
Nope, they’re just amazing bags!

Spanish design duo Nenad Katic and Vanesa Moreno create pieces bursting with spontaneity and enthusiasm. Their label OOO My Design does away with difficult, inaccessible design aesthetics, replacing it with a sense of youthful freedom, wrapped up in a vision of unique furnishings made to stand the test of time. Working together since 2010, the multitalented Madrid duo’s backgrounds in art, architecture and design is further inspired by their virtuosic excursions through neighbouring disciplines including performance, photography and installation art. The label may be young, but their inventive creations are already turning heads, and the accolades and awards are rolling in.

Object Interface ( O\I ) is a boutique multidisciplinary design studio in Toronto.

O\I works within graphic, interactive and branding while also designing and manufacturing products for everyday use.

Founded by Ryan Taylor in 2013, O\I has a core goal of creating user experiences through objects & interfaces.

Marco Ripa, craftsman and designer, runs “Officina Art &Craft”. Through it he produces unique and bespoke furniture pieces in iron and steel. Born in 1977, at the age of 15 Marco entered the workshop to learn the craft of an artisan. He chose iron as his signature metal because it’s dirty, noisy and rejects repetition. His metal takes shape, colour and balance inspired by the American sculpturer Calder. Building on Ruskin’s philosophy in the Arts and Crafts Movement Marco believes that a man is as unique and unrepeatable as the objects he makes.

Opium Jewelry is recognised by its simplicity and strong shapes. Every item is made by hand by the designer, Hanna Wilhelmi and your piece will be produced upon order, just for you. 
Opium Jewelry comes from blisters, cuts and burns, aching hands and a beating heart. The designs grow from the passion of creating and is inspired by everything from architecture, raw materials, nature, color and contrasts. In other words it comes with a soul.

Optima is a modern and dynamic company producing small household appliances.

Products are designed and projected by the facilities in Modena, by the modern research & development centre, for being of support to the everyday life and before being launched on the market appliances undergo several safety, resistance and quality tests. Only after having overcome all these tests, the product is ready for mass production and sale.

We try to satisfy your needs, studying the way to solve at the best everyday's difficulties , that's why your interaction would be appreciated. If you have any suggestion or opinion, don't hesitate to express them since they are our strength, your ideas are the energy feeding our motor: without you we wouldn't exist. 

Origin: Italy

Orikomi brand was created in November 2013 and is based on developing products that blend origami techniques with lighting. Orikomi’s are made of high quality paper, created and carefully handcrafted by architectural studio - blaanc. These handmade origami pieces serve much more than an aesthetic purpose: a portion of the sales profits of each piece supports a social cause. Currently the goal is to help the Adobe for Women non-profit association, which empowers women in Mexico to build their own homes and earn a viable living.
N/A

We love to travel, some of us live abroad, and we wanted to create products that would travel with us. For us, the coolest thing about the O&E line is imagining where it might end up in the world and the experiences it will go through to get there.  We're just excited to be along for the ride, to partake in the moveable feast. As a company, we're committed to rediscovering a lost art - how to build things. It's something as a founding team we've spent a lot of time perfecting. Of course, what to make is just as important ashow we make it - and that's the key to our model. We're collaborating with independent fashion designers around the globe to design, produce and distribute products and projects. Not only do designers see their brilliant work reach scale, but our customers receive unique, quality goods at wholesale prices because we control the entire supply chain.

Otto London was founded by Eleonora Perez and Otto Lauterbach in August 2012 to 

provide themselves and other discerning cyclists with a garment that would keep them 

warm and dry while looking good both on and of their bikes.

Husband and wife team, Eleo and Otto met while studying Fine Arts in their home town, 

Caracas, Venezuela and have lived in London for more than 20 years where they raise 

their young family of cycle enthusiasts. 

Cycling For Eleo and Otto represents liberty, happiness, independence and individuality-
qualities they seek to celebrate through their collection of highly functional but stylish 

fashion wear

“We do not own a car, and hope we never will”. Says Otto, “We always jump on our bikes-
whatever the weather or occasion-because we believe it is the only way to get ourselves 

around! We love cycling as a way of transport and we know it keeps us fit and young, 

without a negative impact on the planet”

Otto London was founded in response to a very British problem Eleo recalls: “We kept on 

getting wet in London’s changeable weather because we couldn't find clothes which we 

really wanted to wear that ofered us protection but didn't limit our freedom to ride”

After a few samples and trials, the team came up with a very popular Urban Style Poncho 

which is a fusion of a traditional European capes with native Latin American ponchos with 

a contemporary urban and functional twist.

The Otto London ethos is one of style and practicality. Garments are functional and full of 

cycling features, but it’s all wrapped in slick and minimal design language.

Put simply, Otto London produces accessories for the smart urban cyclist who wants 

practical yet stylish alternatives to the obvious.

Outside the city walls of Chania, we stumbled on the old tanneries of Chalepa during a visit to Crete. Between abandoned factories and ancient ruins we discovered some workshops where leather is still produced in a very time-honoured way, respecting old family traditions and trade secrets. The extraordinary quality of Greek craftsmanship inspired us to build PARK.
Only high-quality, smooth calf leather is used by these Greek workshops for our PARK products. These high quality yet affordable products are simple with a timeless elegance that will last you a lifetime.
Each PARK bag is unique. The exclusive use of natural raw materials and the traditional handicraft techniques gives each bag a unique character, which matures and develops over time.
N/A

Portego had the pleasure to introduce its first products in Milan during Salone del Mobile expo, the most important international exhibition about design and new trend.
/Pòrtego/ means “arcade” in Venetian dialect.
Porch are also one of the most characteristic detail that you can find visiting Venice and his region, where people meet to have a café or in the past to make market and exchange the most precious goods from anywhere the world. 
A place of sharing the good quality.
For that Portego's products are exclusively manufactured by an accurate selection of artisans from Veneto, a special region of Italy, known as Venice, with a historical tradition in the handcraft of different materials, with different manufactory districts (such as Murano glass, ceramic-porcelain, marble and stones, wooden furniture ). 
Starting from the know-how of the manufacturing in Veneto, Portego brings together knowledge of working with local materials with digital technologies and creativity of the designer, to develop innovative concepts of contemporary design furnishings for the house, stylish from the production point of view, but also emotional in their development.
Portego combines the digital prototyping while remaining loyal to the most traditional local techniques, always focused on implementing innovative processes.
