At Portego we like to constantly communicate with those who are part of our community, Portego involves artisans, talent designers and professionals in the whole process of design and product development, ensuring human interaction leaves its mark on the product, at Portego we care about human relationships.

Each material and manufacturing process is carefully chosen with environmental sustainability and respect for the territorial heritage in mind. 

Portego shown his first series of products during Salone del Mobile in Milan on April 2015 having the great opportunity to collaborate with the most important companies of furniture in Italy like Gervasoni 1882 and De Padova, Lema, which they share some of our products in their temporary exhibitions and catalogue.

The young Spaniard founded Pott with the explicit aim of preserving ancient Iberian craftmanship. Far from being a conservative project, Pottery Project creates products perfectly balanced between old and new. Its ceramic objects pair exquisite, exacting handcraft with a boldly contemporary vision—a fantastic example of the creativity and quality at work in the current Spanish design scene.

Our company’s name – Palomar – was taken from the main character in Italo Calvino’s  novel. Our ambition is to offer “timeless” pieces that satisfy the most simple, and most basic needs and this is what releases them from the vagaries of fads and fashions. We can consider it a sort of counter-melody, or counterbalance to the overwhelming spread of digital technology. This return to analogue is not “vintage”, rather it  offers a radically new meaning to the individual experience of looking, contemplating time and representing space. It is our way of saying that there is, indeed a more human, more ironic and perhaps even more attractive dimension that can coexist with technology and its presumed imperatives.

Pani Jurek was founded by Magda Jurek, artist and designer. She graduated in painting at the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw and brings a conceptual approach to her work with the aim of creating products which are not obvious and not standard. She designs products which you can changed and rearranged together with spaces and which also awaken your own creativity. Pani Jurek credits her design approach in part to growing up in Poland during the nineteen eighties. Within limited spaces, products needed to be compact and also multi-functional. She is also an advocate sustainability. With items which can be used in multiple ways, you can limit your purchasing needs. Pani Jurek is also co-founder of the Association "Based in Warsaw" which was set up to achieve social design as well as design for public areas.

Papafoxtrot’s mission is to play with today! Our wooden toys bring the amazing machines behind today’s world into you home. Born from our love of science and engineering, they are for everyone who ever sighed at a container ship or swooned over a satellite. For us, these giant modern marvels are also personal. With offices in London and Hong Kong, modern infrastructure is not just what we celebrate in our products but also essential to the day-to-day operation of our company. Founded by London-based designers Postlerferguson and Hong Kong based manufacturing consultancy ADDA, we produce and sell our wood toys world-wide.

There's nothing quite like working with your hands—as Korean label PAPERO know only too well. Back in 2011, Kangkook Kim was searching for the perfect kit to entertain his five-year-old daughter. He couldn't find a safe and creative one without sharp scissors or messy glue, so he and his friend Halim Lee decide to invent one. The astounding result was a range of sets for both young and old, each made from recycled paper and ready cut so all the user has to do is press and fold. The winner of a Good Design award, PAPERO's kits will get your fingers up and moving and your imaginative juices flowing.
Paramodular is a Berlin-based, environmental design group, that mediates parametric technologies with modular solutions in the context of climate change.

A passion for making products by hand and learning a material and production method is driving Patrick Hartog to design new products. His material of choice is ceramics, shaping it by slip casting.When designing new products the main focus are materials and production techniques. Learning about the production technique and materials is essential in creating these objects, this is why Patrick spend his past years learning about ceramics and slip casting. Inspiration for his products are these materials and production techniques itself.
Patrick Hartog studied industrial design in Delft and The Hague, finishing his studies graduating at Richard Hutten design studio in Rotterdam.  After graduation he worked and works in various industrial design companies in The Netherlands. Now based in Rotterdam he started working on his own projects.

Once a thriving industry, watchmaking has now all but disappeared from the UK. Our aim is to bring the manufacture of affordable, high quality watches back to Britain.

After three years of designing and sourcing components from suppliers around the world, the first Paulin watches have now been assembled at our manufacturing unit in Glasgow.

Peppermint Products was started by Roman Luyken in 2012 with the aim of making home furnishing that make a difference. Their brand philosophy is to make products that start small but unfold big. Peppermint Products recognise that in a world where people are ever more mobile and home is an ever more transient concept, furniture which is beautiful yet mobile is what people need most in their lives. Therefore everything they make can be delivered easily through the post or packed up and taken with you when you move. At the same time, they infuse a sense of originality in everything they create. Peppermint Products' characteristic blend of colour and unusual materials makes them an unmistakable brand.

Phil Procter is a British furniture & product designer based in Rotterdam, Netherlands. Phil was trained at Buckinghamshire University (National School of furniture), a prestigious furniture school located in the heart of the British furniture industry. Following his graduation in 2010 Phil established his design studio in the UK. Since then the studio has focused on developing charming and functional products which are distributed directly by the studio or in collaboration with design labels. Alongside this commercial work the studio continues to realise private commissions for bespoke objects and furniture.

The studio is based in Rotterdam, NL collaborating with retailers, brands and private clients worldwide.

The Ludus Ludi collection of games created by PICO PAO, are notable for their lack of rules; they can be seen more as exquisite raw materials for poetic experimentation, for the stimulation of abstract thought, for the interpretation of random discovery and for the playful enjoyment of the senses through direct contact with artistic objects. The games enable all players to examine the nature of the language of art and to observe the ways in which chance, intuition, curiosity and daring can lead to delightful, unexpected and sometimes unsettling experiences, even revealing intimate truths about ourselves that we may have been unaware of.

PICO PAO is a workshop with a long history of craftsmanship that began in 1979 in Lubián, a small Spanish village nestled in the mountains on the border with Portugal. In the neighboring Portuguese county of Tras os Montes (“Beyond the Mountains”) the local woodpecker is known as PICO PAO (“Stick-Beak”). The song of this handsome green bird, which evokes the whinnying of a horse, alternates with the sound of his pecking at the trees as this resounds through the valley, blending in with the carpenters’ hammers as they work on the wooden roofs of the village houses. The old dwelling where the workshop originated offers a view of the entire valley, with wisps of smoke rising from the chimney tops and where every so often a Pico Pao can be seen flying gracefully towards the chestnut forests.
Some time ago, a woman lived in this house with her six children. The poverty that these children grew up in, along with an industriousness and an ingenuity that enabled them to make use of virtually any material they came across, resulted in some of the finest, most desirable toys a child could wish for. Out of this resourcefulness and an admiration for the subsistence culture of these mountain villages grew this small workshop in Lubián. Here were made the first wooden replicas of old-fashioned toys, along with reproductions of the cameras used by the first street photographers and copies of traditional, pre-industrial looms.
Over the years Javier Bermejo’s attention was increasingly drawn to a collection of old-fashioned toys and games, Juegos de la Antigüedad, of which he salvaged hundreds – of both European and African origin – from oblivion.

A fascination with vehicles was birthed when Julian Meagher at aged eleven would ride around on his bike searching for tucked-away super cars in local underground car parks. Riding 3 stories down and peeking under dust covers while marvelling at the shiny badges, forms and gorgeous paint finishes of the Countach, Muira and Dino. Discovering these thoroughbreds at a young age was integral to the growth of his obsession. 30 years on, Meagher now an award winning industrial designer and label owner harks back to those years of wonder by creating a line of timeless art-toys.

With decades of studying automotive styling cues and figuring out how cars are put together, Meagher hones his research into a coherent series of vehicles. Classics, Midi's, Mini's and Mavericks are an eclectic mix of Art, Fashion, Traditional Product Design, Modernism and of course Car Styling.

Meagher’s long term collaborator, Cameron Treeby, an established industrial designer in his own right, has meticulously production engineered the entire line. The continued meeting of minds has allowed the creative direction of the label to venture further. Treeby works from our London office while Meagher works from his studio just outside Cape Town.

We have a manufacturing partner that truly understands quality and knows exactly what it takes to build beautiful products. We are not in the business of needless cost saving at the expense of performance and build quality. We choose to use the best materials available so the surfaces are flawless and the products are absolutely unrivalled. Our aim is to create virtually indestructible art-toys that last a lifetime.

Classic and contemporary. Fanciful and functional. Simple and sophisticated. At first glance, these characteristics may seem slightly contradictory. But Playsam firmly believes that opposites attract. After all, a small company with a big name. 

As the leading Scandinavian design company in its class, Playsam creates innovative and timeless wooden toys and gifts for the young and young at heart. With each and every toy, we not only strive for physical functionality, but also for an art form that challenges pre-existing artistic concepts and conventions. Take your pick of our exclusive products -- from the miniature Saab Keychain Car to the Streamliner series to Playsam's wonderful Rocking Rabbit -- and give the best of Swedish design as a baby, birthday or business gift. 

The mission is to shape executive wooden toys that exude charm and charisma while simultaneously stimulating the very soul of Playsam's audience. The products' capacity to appeal to the mind's eye is equally as significant as their bright and glossy surfaces. 

The aim is to engage those individuals who welcome a visual challenge, demand superb quality and crave intellectual creativity -- in short, lovers of executive Scandinavian design. And during thirty years of business, doing exactly this by inspiring individuals all around the world with artistic aesthetics and ageless designs. Playsam is a haven for contemporary, cosmopolitan, classic design. Simply put, Playsam is Scandinavian design at its finest. To experience the world, you need only to open your eyes and reach out your hands.

Pleathure is a brand of leather backpacks and baby shoes designed by myself.
 
I'm Natalie Lyutrovnik from Moscow, Russia. 
I'm an artist fascinated by leather.
 
My leather inspirations gained material form in 2012 in my brand Pleathure. Pleathure goods are made by hand from natural leather.
 
I invent these goods for myself.
I like comfort, minimalism and style.

Pleathure is a mix of leather & pleasure.
I love leather and I want to share my love with you.

Dull, grey streets lined with orderly concrete blocks? If this is what comes to mind when you think of Warsaw, it may be time to take a second look. The city is bursting with colour, and Polish label Polka Bikes is adding layers to the rainbow. Piotr, Romuald, and yet a second Piotr, three friends with backgrounds in international business and a passion for cycling, caught the fixie bug just as the phenomeon spread to Poland, adding a decidedly Varsovian spin to the brakeless bikes. Solid, carefully selected parts and a dash of bold, bright colour—Polka's vibrant frames and wheels bring brilliant chromatic lines to the urban landscape.

Polka Bikes was founded in January 2014 in Warsaw, Poland. Our mission is to bring a little bit of colour to urban streets and to restore the beauty and joy of cycling. We want to breathe life to bicycles in order to make them serve not only as a common mean of transport, but also as an element of subculture, a subject of passion and a way of expressing personality.

In 2010, a book editor and a graphic designer joined forces with one modest goal:  to render all of human experience in chart form.

They went on to amass no small renown (that is, a ton of renown) for their infographical treatments of the varieties of beer, the full array of culinary tools, a taxonomy of hip-hop, and dozens more mappings of cultural touchstones.

Now, with a small team of researchers, designers, and soldiers, Pop Chart Lab continues to assemble, sift, cull, and arrange massive amounts of cultural data into meaningful works of art and information.

PLC is a boutique, family company specializing in unique & eco-friendly products that are essential to bringing functional art into your home. We stand by our products 100% and therefore, provide an unconditional money back guarantee on all Culinarium & Zeitgeist Factory purchases. 

Each item is handcrafted with our own special blend of concrete mix & sustainable materials that we have taken over a decade to perfect. Please be aware of imitators! We take pride in all of our work; from new & innovative design ideas to the de-molding & sealing of the final products. 

We do what we love, because we love what we do!

We started Portobello Games in order to launch Snatch, the word game. Snatch is now on sale throughout the UK and America (visit www.usgames.com).
 
We went on to produce Olive’s Garden, a beautiful toy which many of you are begging us to bring back. Thank you for your support, we are working on it. The card game Unhappy Families came next … a humorous take on the classic replacing the washer woman with the homeopathic paediatrian. But unfortunately named!

POS1T1ON Kollektíva was founded by five friends as a result of a creative initiative at the beginning of 2010. Their objective is to perform complex designing tasks by making use of the diverse design skills of the team. Accordingly, POS1T1ON possesses state-of-the-art technical skills as well as a modern approach in all the applied creative fields (graphic design, branding, image design, package design, web design, furniture design and interior design). With the combination of all these skills, POS1T1ON is able to provide creative services, supplying small orders and complex design tasks alike.

Practico Arte which is a Spanish word for practical craft was established by two designers in spring in 2012.
Practico Arte customizes tote bags for Brompton bicycle, tote bag-backpacks for lawyer and other kinds of bag for customers who desire to have their own special bags.
Every process from drawing to designing and handcrafting is directly performed at the studio.
The company studies human hands first when designing a handle of bag and finishes it with great effort in traditional way for leather to withstand for a long time.
Practico Arte tries to make everyone’s daily life be more special and cherishable.

Present Time is a brand factory specializing in wholesale gifts and home decoration items. Present Time’s mission is to allow contemporary design to add fun and a personal touch to life.In the early 1980’s, a small gift company called Kaleidoscoop started. Due to the success of this company it merged with Clockwork and they decided to combine their strengths under the name Present Time. In 1999 Present Time expanded by buying two other companies, Karlsson and Leitmotiv. Today these companies are still recognizable as brands of Present Time. Present Time continued to grow over the past decade and is now the parent company of five brands: pt, Silly, Karlsson, J.I.P and Leitmotiv.

Princess Household Appliances B.V., a Dutch firm specialising in small household appliances, was established in 1994. Thanks to its distinctive approach the company has enjoyed explosive growth. Princess is the world’s largest provider of small chrome household appliances. Worldwide distributors in over 75 countries and nearly 100 employees contribute to the further development of the success of Princess.

Punkt. was founded by Petter Neby in 2008 aside a group of international professionals with a passion for design and simplicity.
Headquartered in Switzerland, Punkt. works with an in-house team of professionals and the world's leading engineering firms. Also on board, as art director, is the British industrial designer Jasper Morrison.
The Punkt. brand began with the launch of its debut product, the DP 01 cordless phone, in January 2011 at Maison et Objet in Paris.

Daily life: you sit, run, wander, carry shopping, and climb stairs, all activities that are important—even fun—but can put your back and joints under more than a little stress. Weekend and after-work rest is essential. Founded by Remigijus Balciunas in 2008, Lithuanian label Pusku Pusku designs Nordic-inspired poufs and bean bags that support those small, relaxing moments in cradling comfort. As ergonomic as they are aesthetic, these seating creations enrich children's and living rooms alike with their welcoming colours and shapes.

"Raising the bar on home entertaining!"

Through smart design and unique functionality, Quench products make it easier to get the party started. So whether it’s happy hour with friends, an evening for two or the parties at your place… we bring the cheers.

Quill & Tine was borne from a desire to bridge the artisanal traditions of the past with the ingenuity of modern innovations. Thus, we set out to develop beautifully crafted and luxurious leather gloves that could interface with touchscreen devices without the use of conductive materials that would otherwise compromise on craftsmanship and aesthetic quality.

Designed in our home and native land, Quill & Tine gloves are handcrafted by expert glove makers with hand-selected Italian lambskin glove leather that is engineered to interface with touchscreen technology, as well as kid leather, peccary, and soft Italian cashmere & Australian lambswool for an added touch of luxury and warmth.

Unlike other materials, leather isn't best when it's shiny and new. It can take years to reach its perfect state—one where it is soft, worn, and resplendent in its textures. REDMAN designs for just this moment. Founded in 2007, the Korean label works with a team of just seven people to handmake each of its fine leather products, designing so that each piece will make a difference in your life, no matter how small. With everyday leather-wares ranging from multi-functional envelopes to simple wallets and trays, the REDMAN approach is to believe that the best things come with time and use—a thought that's good to keep in mind when the next shiny new thing comes along.

Reine Mère encourages local production in order to propose ethical creations which respect both the Man and the Environment. Which is why we are engaged in social and environmental approach: a sustainable design is implemented to cover the whole life of the object, from the creation process to the end of life.

Don't start your day weak and uninspired. Rolling rugged eco-consciousness and endless creativity into one iconically sleek package, London-based label ROK is revolutionising espresso, one handmade cup at a time. A sensation at the 2013 London Coffee Festival and singled out by GQ as one of the best products of 2012, the ROK Espresso Maker's innovative, fully manual engineering and smooth design passes all of the power of a strong cup over to you. Push up your sleeves and get down and dirty with the unbridled freedom to make coffee exactly they way you want it. It's time to experience espresso hands-on.

Origin: United Kingdom

unisex + abstract + modern

Room39, a unisex environment inhabited by bold abstract patterns, strong colours and glamorous accents. We are dedicated to creating original, modern furnishings and accessories with subtle retro undertones, working as far as possible in a sustainable way marrying craft techniques and modern technology.

All Room39 products are manufactured in the United Kingdom and Slovenia. We endeavour to use European raw materials whenever possible and we work almost exclusively with small scale manufacturers, so we have absolute confidence that our goods are being produced ethically and to the highest standard.

Raskl Limited is a design studio specialising in the design and production of highly personalised and individual furniture & lifestyle products, interior problem solving for architects as well as offering prototyping services to the furniture & product design, interiors, architecture and construction industries.
The company is owned and run by a team who share a long history of creative projects, concept development and furniture design and manufacture. With a comprehensively equipped CNC/Robotic and traditional workshop, Raskl has a wealth of experience working with engineering grade laminates and sheet materials, hardwood, metals, glass and plastics.
Raskl approaches each design as a new and exciting opportunity to conceive an original idea either in form or function. The story behind the way a particular piece is made is often as interesting and innovative as the way it looks. This practice has led to a very broad body of work stylistically, and Raskl has produced hundreds of works ranging from smaller art pieces to full-scale room installations for a wide variety of clientele: From the terraces of Newcastle to penthouses of Monte Carlo.
In addition to bespoke work, the design team are continually developing a range of products suitable for retail and interior specification using their wide ranging experience in both custom design and manufacturing knowledge.

Company founded in 2006, but not until 2011 when the brand was relaunched ReallyNiceThings with the aim of bringing furniture design to most people, projects and companies.
The road continues. Very soon will be released a brand new Surdic.

Red Edition was founded by Cyril Laborbe in 2006.
The elegant lines of Red Edition pieces are enhanced by the use of colored lacquers. When Cyril lived in Vietnam a few years ago, he discovered the inhabitants, their culture and their savoir-faire, and the sense of wonder he felt has never left him. He made his adopted country the cornerstone of his project, placing lacquer, Vietnamese savoir-faire, and woodwork at the heart of his creations.
The Red Edition apartment in the heart of the Marais in Paris is Red Edition’s first company-owned boutique. The experience is a reflection of the brand: aesthetic with a penchant for the iconoclastic. The Red Edition apartment offers a personalized, warm and welcoming sales experience.
Roetz-Bikes creates new, stylish city-bikes by re-using frames of discarded bicycles. Truely unique bicycles with surprising materials and components that are ready for a second life.

It is our goal to make products as we think they should be: Of high quality, beautiful, and respectful of both the environment, and the people who work with or for us. 

Our textile patterns intertwine classic Scandinavian minimalism with designer Anne Rosenberg's background studying the intersection of art and religion. With understated, intricate patterns, each piece takes its role of bringing softness, texture and a playful and relaxed attitude to your home. 

Contrary to the general trend, we have kept our entire production in Europe:
- All our textiles are designed, printed and coated in Denmark.
- All fine cotton items are made from 100% organically grown cotton, verified from harvesting through environmentally and socially responsible manufacturing.
- Feather inner cushions are made in Denmark from partly recycled material. No feathers from living birds are used.
- All bed linen is sewn and packaged at sheltered workshops in Denmark, all other styles are sewn and packaged in Lithuania.
- All acrylic coating on oil cloth and canvas bags, laptop sleeves and purses is free from PVC and phtalates.
- Our wool throws are made of 100% merino wool and woven in Lithuania.

Ruxi Sacalis is a designer who is exploring the relation between local identity and contemporary design in order to create simple objects that serve as a background for everyday life, needs and desires. Ruxi brings her philosophy to life by taking inspiration from the materials themselves and from the practical use of the objects with the aim to create long-lasting products that acquire and pass on daily stories of our lives.

The image of our earth as round, as a globe, stands at the very beginning of our modern worldview.

Räthgloben 1917 Verlag has sold hundreds of thousands of globes of the highest cartographic and aesthetic quality on every continent over its long history. Paul Räth, the founder of the company, was a man who knew quite clearly that education has a great deal to do with images.

Two globes from Paul Räth’s workshop are displayed today as first rate exhibits in museums today: what very well may be the first illuminated globe with electrical light from 1921 is exhibited in the Globe Museum of the Vienna National Library. A 64-cm diameter globe with a hand modeled surface relief first produced for a North German Lloyd luxury liner has adorned the collection of the German Museum in Munich since 1925.

The old-established Leipzig company has, albeit with some bitter sections, survived crises, wars, a planned economy and privatization, which speaks for the soundness of our products. 
Hand laminated globes produced precisely by hand, continue to justify the predicate “Quality from Leipzig”.
The wide assortment of inexpensive globes also contributes to the company’s current success.

SAN TORPE (saːn torpè) is a unisex accessories brand established in Tuscany, Italy -  and now operative in the sunny coastal city of Limassol, Cyprus - with designer Dimitris Zoz and architect Maria Christoforou being the Creative Directors, with the dream of reclaiming  the Italian identity that Saint Tropez had. The SAN TORPE brand offers a pop yet glamorous style that relates to an identity of luxury. The versatility of this style allows you to accesorize a look that goes from a day at the beach to having a walk under the moonlight.

SARAH JOHANN is a young label for handmade, minimalistic bags and accessories for women and men. It’s run by Sarah Johann herself, who designs and manufactures all products in her studio in Berlin-Kreuzberg. The bags are characterized by simple design, clear shapes and easy usage. There are neither excessive color combinations nor too much decoration to be found. The used material ranges from cotton canvas, virgin wool, and nylon, to real leather. Every SARAH JOHANN bag is unique and made with great care and love for detail and perfection. It will be a special product for the owner and satisfy his or her wish for quality, design and practicability.
We import and distribute Contemporary Japanese Design
SINCH is the freelance alias of Illustrator and Designer Christian Jackson. He runs his digital art shop from his home in U.S.
N/A

South Lane is a Scandinavian men’s accessories brand with a focus on creating minimalist designs that stand out. Originally inspired by fashion, architectural and cultural trends found in Stockholm’s artistic Södermalm district, the brand’s ethos is a clean, versatile aesthetic featuring daring touches of creative flair.

After establishing a solid reputation as a savvy street-style timepiece designer, South Lane has evolved to incorporate unique, quality materials from the world’s best sources to create a new wave of dramatic, high-end fashion watches and accessories.  

South Lane is the lifestyle brand for style innovators who understand that the difference is in the fine details.

SPECIMEN is a contemporary design brand.
All pieces of furniture, objects and luminaries featured by SPECIMEN come from love at first sight for the creativity and playfulness of a design.

Spencer Devine was launched under the simple philosophy that intuitive design should be just the right mix of high function and style, something we continue to explore each season as we design our collections.  

By embracing the idea of what it means to be a heritage brand: quality, style and a little bit of rugged living, our bags are designed to adjust and give you the freedom to live just the way you want. Built with quality leather and hardware, each element is an expression of our ethos to live simply while paying attention to the details - which to us, mean bags that wear as great as they look. 

Where did we come from?  Founder, Kristine Gottilla has been designing structured, smart leather accessories since she entered the handbag market with a test project in 2008. Over the past 5 years, she has fostered creative relationships with her customers by collaborating on custom orders, weaving projects here and abroad, and now with Spencer Devine.  All born out of a passion for design and creating things that people truly LOVE to wear. This evolving collection was born when Kristine realized that there was a need in the market for something more functional and stylish - a versatile staple bag that would meet the needs of the way we truly live in day to day life.

Made in the USA. Based In Brooklyn.

STACT offers wine racks, and wine storage solutions for people who share a passion for wine and good design. The STACT modular wine rack system offers the best balance of simplicity, usability, and style. We at STACT are passionate about our products. We have a single minded goal to offer the very best in wine storage, with designs that are simple, stunning, and a pleasure to live with for a long period of time.

Studio Hausen is a Berlin based company which was found by Joscha Brose (born 1981 in Berlin/West) and Jörg Höltje (1981 in Berlin/East) during their Industrial Design studies at the University of Arts in Berlin in 2006. Before they graduated in 2009 they complemented their education with studying abroad, Höltje at the Politecnico di Milano and Brose at the FH Johanneum University of Applied Science in Graz, Austria. Jörg Höltje also completed successfully a period of work experience at Studio Patricia Urquiola in Milan and Joscha Brose at Tom Dixon Studio in London. Jörg Höltje is the exclusive managing director of the Studio Hausen after Joscha Brose left in spring 2010.

Since their first independent Project at the UDK Berlin, the Studio Hausen exhibited at the Salone Satellite in Milan 2007, 2008 and 2010, their work has been shown in numerous international exhibitions. like London Design Week, DMY International Design Festival Berlin, Seoul Design Festival in Korea and the ICFF in New York.

The Studio Hausen is working for a variety of clients such as Ligne Roset, De la Espada, Alcantara and Foundry Collection. Their main focus lies in furniture and lighting design as well as consumer goods. Studio Hausens digital-analogue prototyping process includes collaborations with various partners from small workshops in Berlin to innovation leaders like the Frauenhofer research institute.

Jörg Höltje is teaching at the University of the Arts Berlin, the University of Applied Science in Potsdam and the Muthesius Art University in Kiel.
Stukk is a new computer stand that finds innovation in simplicity. Entirely conceived and produced in Italy, the design is modular and versatile.

"I’m passionate about all objects that characterize the domestic environment. I believe that everyday objects give significance to our lives and it is precise these minute shades of difference that distinguish objects from each other that enflame my interest" Sabrina Fossi, Founder, Sabrina Fossi Design.Sabrina Fossi Design is a new Product Design company producing 100% Italian handcrafted homeware products. Our aim is to bring the best Italian master crafts man skills in each product giving to the final customers an outstanding product quality.Sabrina Fossi Design started its own production in 2012 in partnership with LIAF, a company based near Florence that has been creating handmade interiors and products for home and commercial spaces since 1984.  Our products have already received many appreciations by online and offline editorials such: Elle Decor in Greece, Glamour in Italy, Glob Style Advisor in Canada, Challenges in France, Home Style Magazine in China, and GQ in UK.

After her goldsmith diploma in 2009, Sara Mellone started the BA course for Applied Art and Design at the University of Applied Sciences Düsseldorf. In February 2013 Sara presented her graduation project “The simple things” which in July won the German State Award 2013 and was shown as part of the D3 Contest on the international furniture fair in Cologne in 2014.
Sara´s approach to design focuses on the simplicity and longevity of the product, by using materials that work in harmony with the design.
Though all her products are minimalistic, she always keeps the poetic character of a piece, maintaining the sense of narrative and expression.

Scintilla is a home textiles company that brings avant-garde ideas from fashion into home decor. Linda Björg Árnadóttir, Scintilla's creative director, thrived for years in the Paris fashion industry and is now bringing her strong graphic design onto a range of products for the home: bedding, towels, pillows, and more.
Here at Kabloom we make innovative, fun and environmentally friendly products inspired by our interactions with nature and the urban environment.

Strength comes from deep roots. Subtly merging traditional Italian handcraftsmanship with thoroughly modern production techniques, Segno Italiano has been working with an impressive network of top designers, craftsmen, architects and design enthusiasts since 2011 to preserve generations-old artisanal enterprises. Inspired by the Florentine glass traditions of the early 20th century, the collection of exquisitely shaped bottles, jugs, glasses, and jars in rich emerald green easily surpass their status as everyday objects, honouring the design thematics of Italian life.
Exclusive award winning design.

Sestini & Corti is a small business run by a family, located in an ancient house of the eighteenth century in the tuscan hills. Since the very beginning the company has selected only high quality materials and locally products such as terracotta and florentine handmade products or recycled materials such as beams, bricks and stones, and so promoting a market philosophy that combines quality materials and tradition. Making unique objects and original living spaces with recycled materials is the new way of reasearch for our new generation. Today, Sestini & Corti experiments and finds solutions which are conformable to any home or business, thanks to the solid and constant collaboration with local artisans. The goal is always to create a design that combines past and present, through contemporary lines.
N/A

brand_copy.brand_name: Simon Key Bertman Textile Design & Art
brand_copy.brand_copy_description:
Simon Key Bertman is a textile artist and designer, living in Stockholm, who operates both nationally and internationally. With a sharp eye for pattern, texture and color Simon Key Bertman’s work has received considerable recognition over the past few years.

Textiles aren’t just the sum of their fibers – they are the carriers of the ideas woven into their patterns. Bertman draws inspiration from two of his ancestors, writer and educator Ellen Key and renowned Swedish expressionist Isaac Grünewald.  Bertman’s high-quality and dynamically patterned mainly woven textiles bring instant movement to any space and show off the unique processes that led to their design, conceptual dimensions, mathematical sequences, and fascinating play with form and color.

Simon Key Bertman has inspiration flowing through his veins; he creates fabrics that are more than simply decorative accents. The dynamic sequences of color, shading and form the designer uses in his handwoven cotton cushion covers reveal a complex line of thought, pulling playful experiments with color and mathematics together into unique textiles. Delving deeply into new dimensions while expanding the room with exquisite visual textures, each of Bertman’s creations add up to much more than just the sum of their fibers.

The focus of the artistic work is to extract and produce surface textures and patterns that in two or three dimensional textiles reflect a process, a mathematical thought and / or sometimes a game. Unique for the work of Simon Key Bertman is the underlying social codes that his weaving, textures and patterns represent, identify and problematize.

In the boundary between creating high quality products for everyday use and textile works for exhibitions and public spaces the focus is to continuously deepen and discuss what the pattern and structure of a textile object can represent and tell about its context or contemporaries.
 Every encounter between two threads or system of threads in the textile is unique and has a meaningful sense. They do not exist only to bind the textile, but because each thread and system of threads has a purpose and integrate into the system.

The simple things™ design label was conceived in Ireland and born in Peru - a small Irish company, with a big world view. We first encountered some kooky Alpacas in the West of Ireland of all places, and were hooked. On doing our homework we learnt more and more about their incredible fleece, and next thing we were on a plane to Peru. Once we discovered how cosy things were there, we simply had to create our own boutique label – simple things™ was born. So, we began producing luxurious textiles of 100% alpaca for extravagance and warmth.

While we are inspired by the extraordinary traditional craftsmanship of the Andes, we are neither Peruvian nor traditional craftsmen, so our exclusive range of alpaca goods are designed to appeal to contemporary tastes.

SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY: The farmers who deliver the alpaca wool to our weaving mill have organised themselves into communities that secure them a fair price for their work. Our weaving mill also educates the farmers in breeding methods. They therefore gain a greater profit for their effort and the quality of the alpaca wool is secured.

Simple be bags are made in Italy by happy people! 
Comfortable yet versatile, they are timeless bags with a charming discreet appeal. Their personality is shaped by balanced geometries, harmonic lines and well defined volumes. 
Every bag is imbued with the culture and traditions of the locations and individuals behind its creation, from its design to each phase of its manufacturing.  
Crafted entirely by hand with special attention to details and high quality materials (mainly leather), they age naturally through time becoming ever more unique and personal objects.

SNUG.STUDIO
are kerstin reilemann, interior designer and berit lüdecke, architect.
since 2010 they create design-products in their studio in hannover, germany. 
clear, minimalist and classic, this is the style of SNUG.STUDIO 
by shape, paint scheme and processing from ordinary materials such as plywood or laminate they develop high quality interior-products and jewelry. 
each design tells its own story.
""we always follow our intention and we have high ambitions for what we do.
everything what will go into production we would like to have for ourselves.”

Automatically reach for the switch, and the room lights up. For most Europeans, it's a simple routine and a daily reality, so much so that it's almost unthinkable that countless households in South Africa are still unable to connect to a power supply. Ambitious German label Sonnenglas is on a mission to close this gap with its innovative, solar-powered glass lamp. Designed to charge during the day and light up the night, Sonnenglas is also behind 55 new full-time jobs for previously unemployed men and women in Soweto and Alexandra. Creativity meets responsibility—it's time to design a new routine.

A machine will never be able to replicate the touch of a skilled craftsman. Working with masters of their trade, leading Polish lighting label Sotto Luce is transforming the centuries-old tradition of mouth-blown glass into forward-thinking and contemporary forms. The label's Momo Lamp gently hangs from the ceiling as a minimalistic, round form. Striking and elegant, this black opal glass version makes a unique statement that fuses the highest level of skill with imaginative innovation.

We are passionate developer of audio and outdoor products of excellent quality. In the Solar segment, we set trends and new standards. Our products stand for the best in design, sustainable technologies and innovative functionalities. Through 25 years of experience we know how important solar powered products will have in the future. Wherever you are, our products are with you.

Souve Bag Company is a German brand, founded in 2011 by Hendrik Boeing. The company´s design demand is timeless minmalistic. Every product serves a practical need. Souve Bag Company believes in durable quality, genuine style and experienced craftsmanship. The label´s headquarter is based (together with the first flagshipstore) in the old district of Munich´s city centre.

The Spa series is made in Sweden. The soaps are cut by hand making each and everyone unique. The series also includes scented candles, liquid soap, bath oil and bath salt, each one filled by hand.

Each soap is packaged in a brown cardboard box. The liquid soap comes in a convenient dispenser and the other products comes nicely packaged in beautiful amber glass packaging.

The ingredients are natural and in most cases organic. Almond oil, himalayan salt, essential oils and vegetable wax are some of the ingredients.

23 years ago, when Cheryl and Barry Eldridge looked to diversify the farming activities on Stansborough, their New Zealand sheep station, they had no idea the results would eventually be seen on cinema screens around the world. The unique fibre created by their flock of rare grey sheep was used to costume many of the main characters appearing in the blockbuster movies 'The Lord of the Rings’ and 'The Hobbit'. 

It was seen again in two major Disney productions, Narnia's - The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe and Prince Caspian; along with The Waterhorse, BBC's Kidnapped, Avatar and many others. This New Zealand couple says that producing the fabric for the ‘Fellowship Cloaks’ and major costuming in ‘The Lord of the Rings’ movies was their ultimate challenge and their biggest achievement to date.

In 1991, Cheryl and Barry concluded that their hill country sheep and cattle farm, situated in a picturesque valley in the Wairarapa, two hours drive from Wellington, was a marginal farming operation. With the downturn in farming at the time, the Eldridge’s looked for other imaginative options. Their search resulted in them obtaining a small flock of grey sheep, now registered as a wool breed in their own right,  'Stansborough Greys'. The Eldridge's also farm a herd of 80 alpacas,  have some forestry plantations and created some native bush reserves, to cancel out their carbon footprint. 

They also produce a growing amount of high quality UMF honey on the property.

Their flock of blue grey sheep, now have wool that is unusually silky, soft and lustrous. This is the result of many years of selective breeding and hard work, producing a ' Stansborough Grey' flock of over twelve hundred animals, the only ones of their kind in the world. The alpacas on the farm produce fibre which adds warmth and a variety of other natural colours to many of the end products created at their weaving mill.  When on display in New York, the unusual qualities of the 'Stansborough Grey' fibre caught the eyes of the 'Lord of the Rings' costume designers and thus began their ongoing involvement in the Movie industry.

The Eldridge’s personally attend the shearing, hand sorting and grading of the fleece of each animal. After the fleece has been professionally worsted spun, the yarn is then woven at their own historic Weaving Mill in Wellington. 100% grown, inspired, designed and created in New Zealand, the end product is totally natural and eco friendly;  from the sustainable way the animals are farmed,  right through to the hand finished textiles. The fibres used are in totally natural or biodegradable overdyed colours only.

Cheryl , who has a background in the creative arts, along with daughter Kiri, designs all the fabrics, accessories and finished product range.  Barry Eldridge, along with Richard Graham the mill Manager,  draws on his engineering background to expertly operate the historic looms they use in their factory and hand finish the textiles.  

The looms, that came out to New Zealand in the early 1900’s , were developed in England in the 1890’s to make fine worsted textiles and are themselves masterpieces of design and engineering. These were among the very first commercial worsted looms manufactured, at the beginning of the Industrial Revolution, and have the ability to still create heirloom textiles from a bygone era.
Cheryl and the team are constantly developing their range of original and unique fashion, interiors & baby products . 
These are now marketed through high end outlets in UK, Europe, USA, Canada and Australia. They have created exclusive collections for SAKS Fifth Avenue,  Liberty's and David Jones.  Stansborough textiles can been seen on fashion cat walks in Australia and New Zealand. Cheryl has worked with some of the world's best Interior Designers around the world and furnished Super Yachts, Boutique Lodges and Designer Homes  in NZ and overseas. 

Their Designer Blanket range has been gifted to VIP's worldwide,  and has the backing of Campaign for Wool - led by Prince Charles.  The Stansborough Label is now recognized on the world stage for its innovative and highly prized,  sustainable, textile creations.  

What originally started out as an idea to keep a rare sheep from extinction and a farm operating profitably, has grown into a family business that begins out in the paddock and ends in high end fashion outlets and increasingly on blockbuster cinema screens.

Stellé Audio is leading the way in audio technology with wireless products that are the perfect union of sound and style.  Stellé Audio® has been recognized across the industry for bridging the gap between music, technology and design, with accolades including the Innovations Design and Engineering Awards (2014 CES).
Stellé Audio was founded in 2012 in Newport Beach, Calif, by award-winning audio, industry veterans, proven entrepreneurs, and husband and wife team, Anna Perelman and Wayne Ludlum. The company was built on the philosophy that there should be a union between form and function and that audio products should be a perfect marriage of high-end design and exceptional sound quality. CEO Anna Perelman is a featured expert and speaker on how to bring style and fashion to the tech industry.

STUDIO BANANA THiNGS produces ingenious everyday objects for you. Our contemporary lives are in constant evolution. New ways of communicating, working and relaxing are emerging, catering for them is our mission. At STUDIO BANANA THiNGS we believe in the value of innovation and in bringing the fun into the functional. Our products, conceived by up-and-coming designers, make your daily actions that little bit better.

Studio beam is a design studio based in Tel Aviv Israel. The studio designs & manufacturers unique high end lighting fixtures.   
They love the challenges of design and hold a very dynamic approach to the design process, each process starts from a different beginning point - technological, material or conceptual, smart design techniques are applied in order to achieve design synergy between material form and technology.
The studio collaborates with other designers and architects from different fields and expertise in order to realize a shared vision.
The Studio Beam design team includes three designers working together and achieving the almost impossible: Design and creation in a threesome.
The unique way in which they are complementary of each other produces a working process in which material- follows function-follows form. Their ongoing process always begins with throwing a new material in the center of the design triangle- with new passion for new possibilities, and studying its DNA structure function- which leads to a new dialogue form.  The three designers always insist that the path itself be guided by a map of simplicity. 
The design path of each new object is over when the threesome feel they have  achieved the learning experience that is latent in it, and only then they can move on to the next learning experience, the next material adventure.

Studio Eero Aarnio is a growing collection of Eero Aarnio's designs from the 21st century. The collection is manufactured in Finland by Melaja Ltd. The collection started with the Double Bubble lamps in 2003, and has since grown to include numerous lighting products and other design pieces.

Marc Schulthess is a product designer, graduated from Central Saint Martin’s College of Art and Design, living and working between London, Paris and Berlin.

He has been collaborating with designers such as Arik Levy, Christophe Pillet and more recently

Fredrikson Stallard, and set up his studio shorthly after in 2011. His field of investigation is broad with a vivid interest in arts, especially sculpture and architecture, and in experimentation with materials even the most usual.

He has worked on projects for Habitat, Platinum Guild International, Hirsh Hatton Garden, Driade and Swarovski. Marc has also been working as a sourcing consultant for international brands and is the creative director of the recently launched homeware label Untitled Story.

His work has been shown in shows such as Maison et Objet in Paris and ICFF in New York. In the past years he exhibited Pulse and 100% Design in London. His products have been retailing in Europe and as well as countries such as the USA or New Zealand.

Studio Martell started originally as Martell Diseño in Madrid in 1995, by the Dutch designer and photographer Pierre Witteveen.

To focus his work towards designing and developing decoration projects, he settled between Madrid and Amsterdam and since then collaborates with the designer Mar Gómez.

Together they work on the creation and production of original designs with fine finishes.

The creations of Studio Martell combine functionality with beauty and harmony that last over the years.

Together with our three children, we started Kidsonroof in 2005. Our inspiration has always been the beauty of childhood, the 
imagination, nature, peoples of the world, art and craftsmanship, and our drive has above all been the urge to create, and to 
unfold a new imagery. The cardboard playhouse with which we launched Kidsonroof – now a classic piece in many a children’s
room – was soon followed by a great many colourful doll’s houses, horses, dogs, dragonflies, and trees. Now, almost 10 years years down 
the line, we proudly see that our creations are sold worldwide in the most beautiful shops.

And, in 2013, alongside the paper products, there suddenly appeared a small collection of furniture. The roof had become too 
small… our studio had grown… Studio ROOF was born.
 
In 2014, Studio ROOF has come to fruition, and we now produce two collections: the Paper Creative Collection with paper 3D 
objects, toys, and paperware for ALL ages, and the Living Collection, which consists of home accessories and furniture. The 
imagination is always the motive behind the two collections. And imagination is not bound by age. Our products are creations 
for young and old, inviting them to tell stories to each other; to get inspiration; and to create new ambiances.

Romy + Ilya and Studio ROOF team.

René Struttmann, Object Designer and master carpenter Johannes Laue, Object Designer together form the team for Stückwerk.  
During their joint design study, they established this furniture label. They deal with the design of furniture and products for which they provide the functionality to the fore and implement them in an aesthetic form. To pursue this goal, they use both classic design elements and modern processing techniques and materials. In collaboration with sheltered workshops the majority of their designs are manufactured.

The key koncepts of Supershapes design are form and function, and the approach is to make the two come together. Furniture and home accessories are the results. By working with shapes and colors Supershapes creates designs, in which simplicity and details  brings the results to a complex level. The design is characterized in classic, minimalistic yet futuristic lines.

One of the strongest textile brands in Denmark that is designed by our Danish design team. The brand is called Södahl and is a brand that has existed for more than 7 decades of time with Danish design.
It was first established in 1963 by artist and designer, Hans Jürgen Schöbel. He was devoted to high quality products and excellent designs and today Södahl is a recognized, high-profile brand that is closely watched and often quoted in the media in Denmark.

In 2012 I realized my dream and launched my own jewellery design label titled, T Squared. The letter "T" represents the "T" in Tami. "Squared" represents the modern urban geometrical design philosophy and approach.

Architecture, geometric lines, minimalism and monochromatic colors influence the T Squared designs. I draw inspiration from the urban architecture. The designs of T Squared create necklaces, bracelets, pendants rings and earrings that are versatile, elegant, and abstract.

All items are hand-made and created of various materials with use of monochromatic colors. Tami uses primarily silver, gold and anodized brass as well as soft materials such as polyester yarns, silk threads and silicone.

In 2014 Tami and industrial designer, Isaac Eskayo, renovated and designed a new studio in Jaffa to create and exhibit T Squared jewelry. 

The Jaffa studio "is a quiet place to get dirty." Tami enjoys working hands on with her jewellery.

Tami is not afraid to be genuine and vulnerable which is the essence of her design's clean simplicity. This simplicity brings subtle meaning and balance to one's look. There is a quiet delicate sophistication that complements one's own natural beauty. T Squared jewellery gives room for one's unique splendour.

HELLO, We are TABANDA. We would like to introduce you our products and the key ideas behind them. Our work is driven by our love for the materials and curiosity for their potential and limitations. With each of our pieces finished by hand, we are trying to add something very intimate within each of our trademark plywood designs. As a result, our products gain a personality of their own. The ones that we have created so far have become full-fledged members of our team and very often hint us towards new ideas. Together we have developed a style based on subtle contrasts and juxtapositions: smuggling organic themes into geometric modern shapes and balancing raw industrial touch with joyful colors. We try to stick to our crucial motto – to design and produce cool things. We really hope you will enjoy them as much as we do. TABANDA brand was found in 2009. Within six years of business, our collection of high quality furniture designs earned ever increasing recognition in Poland as well as on other european markets. Our projects made it to the pages of such magazines as Wallpaper, Elle Décor, ICON and designboom. Four of our products were also honoured with the Must Have recognition award during three consecutive editions of Łódż Design Festival. At Milan Design Week 2015, together with Ewa Solarz we have curated the “DO IT YOUR WAY – Polish design in pieces” interactive national exhibition that focused on contemporary Polish design. Few months earlier, Design Alive - magazine of fine ideas awarded us the Creator of the Year 2014 Award for organizing the “Test Zone” exhibition during Łódź Design Festival 2014.
Organic Wellness Tea blends for your Body, Mind & Soul

"TEEbooks, for the simple design that manages to be forgotten.Tee, in the words of a golfer is the T-shaped support that is stuck into the ground on which the ball is placed to get started on golfing.It is driven into the ground to make it almost invisible. It is of a  fundamental importance, but only as a support "to serve the ball." I designed TEEbooks following the same principle, a shelf meant to enhance books, DVDs or CDs, in a simple and discreet spirit. When books or CDs and DVDs are placed on the shelf, it becomes invisible and attention is only focused on  "our friends", the books, DVDs and CDs. Those latter design the wall. TEEbooks, the discreet and invisible item. To  the flashy design, I prefer the quiet, plain, sober and discreet one. To the  "sensational " (and often useless) item, I prefer the simple and useful object, dedicated to an action, or as in my case, to another object."Mauro Canfori

Life is like a piece of toast. You can have it either in plain and simple way,
or add different sauces to create plentiful flavors. 
Design is also like cooking; designers create enriching experiences or
products from the most essential elements and ideas.

In 2007 Summer, TOAST was born with this concept.
Our design ideas all come from observations in daily life.
Focusing on the practical aspects and the essential elements of objects,
we  create great experiences and lots of fun for our users.

TOAST always run after fineness and balance,
just like the Chinese words ”jun”: a condition of mellowness.
In ordinary days, we hope to inspire people’s life with mellow products.

TOAST for Life!

TRY FOODS was born by a passion for tasting good foods! TRY FOODS offers exceptional tasting sets, helping people expand their knowledge of, and their palate for, great food. TRY FOODS offers product-specific sets such as: TRY Coffee, TRY Olive Oil, TRY Pepper, TRY Salt, TRY Chocolate. Each set contains five samples of the product, highlighting the breadth of different taste profiles, as well as, an in-depth booklet (at the moment in German only), with interesting background information, practical tips and personal stories. 
In addition, TRY FOODS recently launched its first city set: TRY Berlin, combining five Berlin specialities and a booklet (German/English) about Berlin’s vibrant food scene. 
TRY FOODS is the perfect way to taste and better understand foods at home!
Simple, yet sophisticated. Different every time, and always the same. Accessories designed to express, not to define. We love you in all your diversity. TAKK.

New horizons are emerging in a developing world. 
This necessarily causes frequent and quick changes aimed at making everyday life, in particular household, easier and at the same time more stimulating.
Today, more than ever, Termozeta shows to be capable of grasping and anticipating the changes in the needs and tastes of the Consumer, who is each day more and more demanding and evolved.
This capacity originates from the experience of Termozeta, whose origins date from 1946, as well as from the constant search of innovative solutions, unique style, quality and functionality, combined with a wholly Italian creativity. 
The inner design of every single product ensures an intrinsic quality and represents a design acknowledged as a high added value in every part of the hemisphere. 
Termozeta, with its wide offer, consisting of a variety of products able to meet different needs, is today one of the main reference brands in the field of small household appliances.

Origin: Italy

THABTO (an acronym for Two Heads Are Better Than One) is a contemporary British design brand producing a unique range of unconventional gifts, lifestyle items and home accessories that delight and inspire.

Established in 2008 by British designers Steven Smith & James Wosiek, THABTO has a passion to create perfectly designed objects that twist convention, tell a story and raise many smiles.

Today, from their base in London, their young creative team produce a range of award-winning items that can be found in the best design stores around the world.

THABTO - Discover Different

The French Vikings - Designed with love, made by hand.

The French Vikings was founded by two friends : Nadir and Billy. One studied law and the other worked in finance for many years. They left everything so they could do what they love : design and build great products. Every product is designed with love and handcrafted in their workshop in Paris.

tica copenhagen is a Danish niche company. The founder of the company, Tina Bremholm, develops and designs functional gift ideas and products for boots and shoes.

The collection is a practical solution to the shoe storage problems that come with long winter months and tough weather. The line we present on MONOQI includes more traditional door mats in textile with geometric patterns as well as tougher-wearing rubber mats and shoe/boot storage in rubber.

According to the motto: “Care for your boots and shoes with style!” tica Copenhagen presents mats for the home to help us organize, clean, transport and store shoes and boots in a modern and stylish way.

Tina Bremholm founded the company tica copenhagen in 2008. She worked in marketing and distribution departments of different companies (such as iittala) before, but then the passionate shoes enthusiasts transformed her hobby into her profession.

Since the foundation of the company, Tina Bremholm designs and develops innovative, functional and simple accessories according her favourite topic. Starting from boots and shoe trees over storage and transport boxes up to foot mats, Tina Bremholm wants to fill the market with useful accessories for boots and shoes, making everyday life easier.

Tiipoi is a London-based lifestyle brand and design studio founded by Spandana Gopal.
The brand believes in a common sense attitude to consumption and an all encompassing
design ethos of the Indian subcontinent – where nothing is wasted and where innovation
and improvisation come from the lack of something, rather than from an excess of it.
Through Tiipoi, Spandana wants to engage a wider audience with concepts of good materials
and astute ergonomics as a part of daily life – something she feels has always existed in India,
and has somehow been overlooked. The studio’s material approach to design looks to inspire considered-living in a world where
product lifespans are growing shorter and disposable materials are abundant.
Every Tiipoi product is made with the idea of an evolving lifespan and with an intent
that it will one day be passed on.

Adventurous design and quality craftsmanship

Tom grew up surrounded by the extreme wilderness, tranquility and natural beauty of Exmoor, England - an environment that stimulated his imagination, and inspired freedom to be adventurous in his designs.

Tom’s fascination with the traditional practice of steam bending began whilst studying at Falmouth College of Arts, where he discovered the traditional technique of using a chamber wouldn’t allow him to create the complex 3D bends he had envisaged. Years of research and experimentation allowed him to develop a new steaming method to turn his design visions into reality.

Tom was co-founder of the award-winning collective design company Sixixis, recognised for unique aesthetic, forward-thinking designs and now, through his own company, Tom continues to create spectacular, ecologically sound, innovative furniture and lighting.

Handcrafted in his studios in Cornwall, England, the range of contemporary lighting and furniture Tom now creates is based on beauty, integrity and a desire to create unique, high-specification products that will be cherished by their owners.

Winner of the Lighting Design Association’s Lighting Design Award 2011.

TOMADO , Very old home accessories specialised company from Netherlands , had their moments of glory in 1950´s -´70´s when D Dekker was designing their pieces. This is a great shelving unit, designed around 1960 by D. Dekker for Tomado. The shelf is a typical example of Tomado’s steel furniture of this time period. Tomado, Holland was founded in 1951 by Jan Van Der Togt an industrialist and collector of modern art. These shelves are a long awaited re-issue of D. Dekkers original wall system, designed in 1953. The shelves of which the Tomado brand is famous for. The shelves are completely modular and inter connecting.

Globatrac, LLC (Globatrac) has developed a cutting edge positioning solution that provides worldwide location reporting at a breakthrough price.

After years of applied research and proprietary technology development Globatrac, LLC was officially formed in early 2012 as a California LLC, with corporate headquarters in Los Angeles, California. The Company’s leadership team is composed of seasoned entrepreneurial veterans from successful high-tech start-ups. Team expertise covers networks, systems, telephony source code, operations, product development, marketing and sales.

The value proposition to the consumer is that they can benefit from innovations in wireless technology to share and receive important information not otherwise available. Product development focus is on M2M (machine-to-machine) products and services, especially relative to location awareness.

Globatrac’s mission is to enable consumers to enjoy affordable worldwide freedom over features and functionality regardless of their mobile device or international location. The solution will deliver global mobile independence to the consumer and world-changing applications to mankind. The Technology is here now. The implementation know-how is here now. Execution of the business plan is well in progress.

Tree-Labs is a Swiss company that designs trendy wireless audio devices and accessories for the discerning ears. 
Our passion is audio and design and we strive to combine the two by bringing out the best sound out of our portable, well-crafted designs. 
We want out customers to feel the music in such a way that they want to dance and sing to it. 
We design each of products with distinctive design styles that move us.
Tree-Labs is a Swiss brand established by a team of audio geeks. We come from different places like Switzerland, France, China and Taiwan and each one of us bring his cultural and know-how to design beautiful pieces and professional audio solutions. We come from different professional backgrounds such as audio engineering, manufacturing, and product design. We came together to grow something different that interest and challenge us.
The group was started with the desire to bring a different sound than what is on the market. Most portable speakers follow an American trend toward heavy bass and lackluster middles and highs frequencies (typically where the singing and most instruments are found). This type of sound is heavy on the ears and prolonged listening is physically tiring due to the fact that our ears try to compensate for the missing sounds and force our brains to constantly adjust to try to match its expectations. Our products try to balance all the sounds found in your music to provide a prolonged and enjoyable experience.
Most companies nowadays outsource their sound development to third parties factories with very little involvement or expertise in sound development. They typically have strict launch dates which dictate when the product is finished in such a way that a good version of the product is never achieved.  An ‘acceptable” sound is typically what they think they can get away with and what they think the customer will accept. We develop our products from the ground up and maintain offices closely or within our supply chain. Each of our products goes through multiple generations and modifications phases until we are satisfied with our designs. We don’t have due dates, we have satisfaction for our ears.
We strive to bring different designs than what is found on the market, to give a broader choice to our customers and are not afraid to go after niche looks. We don’t go for a “brand look” or colors, we try to make each of our designs it’s own look and universe. We like to discover and grow designs without any preconception of what a Tree-Labs design should look like, because we think curiosity and tastes are ever changing the world over.

TROIKA – Giving joy

The brand for design gifts that always bring joy.

Whether you are looking for innovative key rings , top quality styli or modern office and desk products, you can find everything that will make your day-to-day business and travels more enjoyable.

Ubikubi is a Romanian design brand that aims to create smart contemporary furniture. Simple yet aesthetic. Functional yet surprising. Qualitative yet affordable.
Our products are made out from durable and beautiful materials, with sustainability care always on our mind. We entirely create, develope and manufacture our products, by combining creative craftsmanship, new technology and forward-looking design. Nevertheless, we are always happy to work with skilled designers and manufacturers.

We are drawn to the natural world. It’s in our nature. And yet we live in cities and stare at the walls. With its products, the label U rbanature fills the gap in everyday life between city living and the longing for something more primal.
Urbanisation is a global trend. While in developing and newly industrialised countries megacities are blooming and birth rates are skyrocketing, Germany , like other European countries, is suffering as a result of demographic change, and has been for decades. Germany is contracting - Less people are being born and life expectancy is increasing. A falling birth rate, unemployment and mass migration from rural areas threatens to turn those areas into an “ocean of poverty and dementia”, to quote the drastic assessment of some scientists. 
This need not necessarily be a catastrophe. It is also possible to gain something positive from such change. The countryside is stagnating – nature is reclaiming lost ground. In Germany’s  Lusatia, wolves can be heard howling once more. Lynx can now be seen in the Harz mountains. Why should Germans go all the way to Tuscany? Holidaying in Germany is more popular than ever.
But for almost everybody, everyday life takes place not in Lusatia, nor in the Harz mountains, but in urban centres and metropolitan areas. It’s where the jobs, kindergartens and schools are. It’s where infrastructure and supply systems function perfectly. It’s home to the arts and culture – to civilisation!
Yet the yearning for green, for nature, for pristine beauty, cannot be satisfied by a few days’ holiday. Urban gardening, neighbourhood gardens, guerrilla gardening; these phenomena are all borne out of this longing. And scientists are seeking new ways to bring horticulture inside urban buildings, with one key thing in mind: More freshness, less travelling. This is why staff at Dresden’s Institute of Horticulture are working as hard  as they can to find solutions to the global trend – urbanisation . www.BrickBorn Farming.de
The label urbanature also attempts to bridge the gap between city life and the rural, in your own home. Urbanature is about products that render the everyday as green as possible. Urbanature brings a little piece of nature into our urban lives.

The label urbanature is a selection of product designer Jörg Brachmann’s ideas. It was founded in early 2013. His designs are inspired by a strong affinity with nature and a passion for cooking, and he has a real eye for the extraordinary. He turns his ideas into prototypes in his own studio on the outskirts of Leipzig, where he then perfects them before creating product series in his own workshops. In collaboration with regional craft specialists, he develops solutions that allow  his products to be manufactured in a way that is both economical and high-quality. He uses wood from sustainable forests as well as recyclable materials – even for the packaging. 
Made in Germany.

URBI ET ORBI workshop is the expression of the new trend in the design and the construction of concrete objects. 
It makes its dynamique debute appearance with the 2012 product catalogue, giving at the same time future promises by its high set standards.  

The people behind URBI ET ORBI, we are a team that although we met accidentally, since then, we work together, completing ideally one another, in order to produce the best possible URBI ET ORBI creation. We pay attention to every detail, taking our creative thinking to the limit. 
                      
The raw material that we use at URBI ET ORBI is internationally acknowledged, environmentally as well as human friendly. Such an example is the special mix GFRC which is the most advanced new proposal of the industry.

This is why we, at URBI ET ORBI, create safe, functional, stylish objects that stand out in every environment.

Ucon established their opening collection in the early summer of 2001. Founders Jochen Smuda and Martin Fussenegger came with a vision to develop a lifestyle brand anchored by creativity, quality tailoring, innovative appliqués and ethical production. With a passion for the work of talented artists and the design community surrounding them, Jochen and Martin embraced collaborations to build a creative environment for the brand.

From the brand’s studio in Berlin, its focus remains on bespoke fabrics, tailored cuts, and notable detailing. Inspired by their friends, the city they call home and the places they choose to travel: this is what sets Ucon apart from their peers. This organic approach challenges the brand to constantly grow, develop and progress. This journey is anchored by a sincere foundation for quality products that is constantly challenged by the theory that you are only as good as your last shirt!

A good garment is hard to find.

When founding Ulterior Motive in 2006, the initiating force was frustration. There simply wasn't enough good designed products out there. Or maybe there was, but they were ... well, simply a bit boring. The ambition was – and still is – to offer something different as opposed to most of the accessories available today. To inspire you to dare cross the conservative line, break free and be a rebel without a pause.

Ulterior Motive is more rock than business. Hell, yes!

Ties are an important part of our product range. When it comes to ties, our philosophy is that you can wear a tie almost anytime. We believe the reason why (almost) nobody does this today is that the ties that you find in stores are either meant for business or dinner parties.

Our question is - why can't you wear a tie at the weekend barbeque?

The products we design today have the goal to carry a subtle edge, not to be in-your-face, but rather something you notice in the details. We would never put out a t-shirt with just our logo, but most likely a woven skull on the back lining of a tie.

Some of the things we like: Pharell Williams, sixties airline logos, Iggy Pop, Oscar Niemey- er’s Brasil, Sir Paul Smith, the cover of Kraftwerk’s ”The Man- Machine” LP, Old Fashioned, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Don Draper & Co ...

UltraLink products reflect the core values of the company; dedication to leading-edge engineering, top build quality and superb audio and video performance. UltraLink uses proprietary – in some cases revolutionary – patented designs including multiple shields, silver-plated alloys, lab-grade 6N and OFHC copper designs. For installers and consumers, from single cables to full integrated system solutions, for every budget and every job where looks count as much as performance, UltraLink has you covered!

Unikke Design jewellery is a constant search for new solutions that combine traditional goldsmithing techniques with new, unexpected materials. The main idea of the brand is to be constantly ahead of the trends and create innovative, but functional design. One of the collections (inspired by participation is Polish National Shooting team) -  „Better Wear Than Use” is made from real bullets, silver and natural stones. The other collection „New Geometry”  was inspired by the possibilities of 3D printing and the architectural, geometric lines. Jewellery is printed in nylon, but also in metals. The possibility of creating our unique style is very important for the brand. “Create your own visual style… let it be unique for yourself and yet identifiable for others. “— Orson Welles

Untitled Story is a new homeware brand created by designer Marc Schulthess. Objects are part of our life experience, our life history. The poetic forms and visual play in the objects of Untitled Story embrace this idea—create your own story.

Clever furniture ideas with cult potential!
 
Towns are a cultural melting pot and are where trends start. Therefore, Urban Favourites is the furniture series for everybody who loves the urban life. Under the label 
Urban Favourites the company Gerling Living  finds and develops pieces of furniture for people who enjoy modern design, ingenious functions and practical solutions

Based in Stockholm, Sweden, Urbanears makes headphones that fit your everyday life. Supplying the perfect listening device for anyone with a pocket full of music and a wish to make the most of it, Urbanears models are designed to optimize sound and captivate self-aware customers by matching preferences in size, style, design, function and relation to music.
Urcover is a brand that sells under its wing best of  cell phone cases, protectors and other accessories.
