VANDEBAG is a young company based in the heart of Berlin that believes in minimalistic design, uncompromising quality and the beauty of simplicity. Our bags and cases are made to protect your gadgets and accompany you in the real and in the digital world. 

VANDEBAG products connect straight design and clear functionality with carefully selected materials and high-quality finishing. Leather and merino wool felt are two of the main components used for our collections covering bags, smartphone skins, tablet cases and notebook sleeves. What all the products share is the fact that every single piece is entirely produced by hand in Germany.

Design ideas shall be perceptible.
The market is full of products, a lot of them interchangeable, short-lived, and anonymous.
We want to create emotions to the objects that surround us: Products with refinements
in function and aesthetics through a clear and up-to-date design, without pure
formalism and modish parapheinalis.
Timeless products, that tell stories, enjoy, for giving away to friends and to oneself.
To give something to somebody means to esteem this person. Let him/her feel, that
you estimate him/her, that he/she is important and something special to you.
See the sparkle in his/her eyes and make yourself happy. Surprise them with something special.
We like to help you: 
with presents with content, sensuousness, fun and from time to time also with a little bit of irony.
We welcome your suggestions and Critique as they help us to continually improve our product and service.
Our products are protected by patent in order to maintain their exclusivity and avoid imitation.

Under the brand VEJTSBERG, OPOSSUM design develops and produces, in addition to lighting, standing furniture such
as wall shelves, side tables or coat stands -
including brand new tables with ingenuous details such as removable fruit bowls and integrated vases, plus additional storage space.
Also new are the leaning sideboards, which are characterized by a variety of surfaces.
Despite their modern, timeless design, these cabinets are very decorative.
Contrasting door elements are incorporated into the main body of the elegant, matte white, powder-coated metal cupboards.
In addition to a RAW version made of raw MDF for purists, there are slate-, stone- or cork-look surfaces to choose from.

VENQUE [pronounced Venk] brand was born in early 2011. Founded by two brothers, Viktor and Simon, were raised in Toronto, Canada. Both are creative and have an interest in fashion and design. After years of working in the fabric industry and in numerous fashion design houses, they decided to launch their own label to fulfill their childhood dreams. Viktor and Simon believe that commitment in design and a focus on quality will make their dreams comes true; a dream of building a brand that signifies beauty, quality and affordability.

Vzór came into existence thanks to passion for design and dream of creating a collection based on the icons of Polish design which in the future shall include designs of prominent contemporary creators.
Thanks to the undertaking, the conditions will be created so that products of which only few people know now, which so far have only decorated walls of museum exhibitions and warehouses, could be produced industrially and become available for consumers of design.
Everything will take place with respect to patent rights and copyrights while using the most modern production technologies.
The collections of the Vzór brand will be presented not by loosely interrelated products but by the profiles of the designers.
The brand debuted in June 2012, introducing to serial production the cult armchair designed by Roman Modzelewski (RM58) into the market. Thanks to the rotational moulding technology which had not been used in the Polish furniture industry so far, the historical model of the armchair was reproduced and now is available in two versions: matt version is the armchair with the seat made of polyethylene dyed in the cake, the classic version is the armchair with the seat made of polyethylene varnished to a high gloss. The precisely developed form constitutes a 100% replica of the original.
The nearest plans of the Vzór brand include other models designed by Roman Modzelewski.

Valentine Goods’ premium leather accessories mediate between technology and a way of life that champions quality, craft, and traditional aesthetics.  

Our products reintroduce an enduring look and feel to the devices you use most and love best. Our current collections respond to the Apple family of devices.

We source the finest grade leathers from respected New York City-based purveyors. Our pressure-sensitive adhesive, developed exclusively for Valentine Goods by 3M, simplifies the process of application and respects your device, leaving no residue upon removal.  All our products can be applied and reapplied multiple times to the same or similar devices.

Our production process is a hybrid of the old-fashioned and the high-tech. We make every individual product by hand with the help of some cutting-edge technology. We proudly design and fabricate each and every Valentine Goods product in New York City.

Each Leather hide has unique marks, colour variations and a personality all it's own. These distinctive marks are barbed wire, nicks, brands, stretch marks, healed scars, grain variations, and nature’s other hallmarks.

Only true leather can boast these marks and pride of ownership is enhanced due to this individuality.

You have to get to the heart of something to push it to the limits of excellence. Slovenian label Vertigo Bird has its roots in the nation's glass-blowing and mining region, where for generations people have quite literally travelled deep into the Earth to bring its rewards to the surface. Metaphorically carrying this local tradition into the world of contemporary lighting, Vertigo Bird reaches for the essence of design, pushing international traditions to new levels of purity with the help of regional materials and tried-and-true ingenuity in production.

Very Wood is an italian furniture company that typically works in the contract market but will be working with MONOQI Business to extend into the domestic interiors market. To do this, we are presenting the complete UNAM seating and table range by young German design talent Sebastian Herkner. The range combines woven rawhide or nautical rope straps with substantial, oversized dowel-constructed frames & foam upholstered seats. It's no surprise the Lounge chair won a 2014 Wallpaper* Design award.

Nina Wilsmann about Vianina: The illustrated city maps give our fond memories a happy new home. Would this way of looking at places be available in Google Maps, I think they would call it “Heart View”. I think my aim was to render the peculiar perception of a child from the country side visiting for the very first time the city, that seems gigantic, over detailed, over expressed, and that happily rushes towards you, out of proportion, almost magically and somehow even quite bizarre.

Wine which has been allowed to breathe tastes better. As wine breathes, it opens up, and releases its intended aromas and flavours. Traditionally, decanters were used to aerate wine. However, decanting is time consuming, cumbersome, and inconvenient. Vinturi's patented design speeds up this process with ease and convenience. Perfect aeration in the time it takes to pour a glass.

Maybe it's the city's status as a cultural capital, maybe it's the fact that the ancient metropolis was founded by the Romans, but whatever the reason London is a city that allows young creatives to thrive. Ensconced in the heart of the East End, formerly home to the Indies trade, label-cum-design agency Vitamin represents the best of a new generation of talent drawing on deep rooted traditions while combining them with contemporary design trends. Mouth-blown in old workshops in the British capital and finished with a distinctive knotted cord, the label’s lamps radiate the deceptive simplicity that comes with true mastery of craft.

WEWOOD is a Portuguese brand that believes in elevating the high-end joinery by producing superb solid furniture that promotes Portuguese culture and design.

Each piece is born from the inspiration and creativity of designers, architects and young talents, turned into reality thanks to the wisdom and experience of our craftsmen.

In Wewood, we believe in elevating the high-end joinery by producing superb solid furniture that promotes Portuguese culture and and design.

WITAMINA D is a design studio and a brand founded in Poland by two designers: Malgorzata Knobloch and Igor Wiktorowicz.
WITAMINA D brand came up with the need to create durable, simple and beautiful things. We call it SLOW design: local material / local producers / small scale of craft production. The main material we use is solid oak wood. We try to treat the material with respect, to exhibit its unique features: beautiful wood graining, warm colors, noble character.  We combine wood with other materials and experiment with different forms and shades.

Wood’d is a lifestyle brand of wooden accessories. Was founded in January 2012 by creativity and productive skills of two brothers, Andrea and Stefano Aschieri.The idea comes from the need to create something together, starting from the know-how that has been characterizing the family’s business for 40 years, aiming to produce wooden accessories for fashion industry.Wood’d iPhone covers gave the chance to the brand to be recognized for its work in Europe, Japan, Korea and United States. The offer now includes covers, bracelets, perfumes and docking stations.

Our aim is to create timeless furniture and accessories inspired by the everyday life of Nordic people, where rough climate and warm materials meet.Warm North is not following as much traditional principles of design but particularly the individual character of  Nordic people, the traditions and culture of our region by reconsidering proven archetypes and principles in furniture making.In the world where everything is very often over-designed we sometimes just love to updatethe honest simplicity of forgotten archetypes.Rather than competing our competitors by trying to design more, we just prefer to design less by making simple and honest pieces of furniture which lasts for years.Everything we do we want to do it just the way it should be done- from sourcing timber that if FSC certified, being a respectful partner to our clients and to businesses we collaborate with.As odd as it might sound- we just want to be normal.

We Do Wood was founded in Copenhagen in 2011 and is based on the vision that eminent design and strict sustainability principles should go hand in hand.
We believe that production aesthetics should never stand in the way of application aesthetics.
We believe that functionality is the key, and that the product must be able to fit smoothly into people’s everyday lives.
We believe in furniture that is created with respect for the environment all the way through.
To us, sustainability is much more than style, material and production. We don’t see the concept of sustainability as a passing phase, we view it as our very foundation.

Sebastian Jørgensen is the designer behind We Do Wood. As a trained furniture- and cabinetmaker, Sebastian is an experienced craftsman. However, Sebastian's understanding of design originally comes from the world of art, which creates a different approach than most. Sebastian’s design process is a bit like painting: he usually make a sketch and goes directly to the workshop to make 1:1 mock ups and prototypes. Eventually Sebastian uses his background as a cabinetmaker to prepare the piece for industrial production.
Common for the two approaches is, however, the desire to move boundaries and give the craft of cabinetmaking a new twist – in terms of design but especially in terms of responsibility. 

Because We Do Wood is not just about furniture - it's also about respect, changes and common sense.

Born one fine sunny Wednesday to us, Chrish & Jenny, WEDNESDAY – PAPER WORKS stands above all for one thing: stationary and gifts made with careful design and handmade skill. Our aim is simple: to create products that fill you with joy and spark your sense of creativity.  That‘s why we design products suitable for work and leisure – products we love ourselves and are glad to share with others.

Well Rounded Sound is a boutique company providing music aficionados with the finest sound achievable in the desktop domain. Usage of eco-friendly materials and refined speaker transducers results in very natural sound. Speakers provide ultra fidelity performance with transparent, detailed and musical sound. All speakers are designed and manufactured in the USA. All materials used for the enclosures are sustainable, renewable, and biodegradable. Well Rounded Sound is owned and operated by Jerry Cmehil - founder and CEO and the Well Rounded Sound Team.

My passion and artistic vision is, however, to give concrete – against all prejudices – a timeless, elegant and modern form to make its aesthetic potential visible. Also the name of my label WertWerke says it all and it´s an integral part of my design ethic.
Making dwelling into a personal, sensual and valuable experience through extraordinary quality and innovative material combination comes first. And this is why every creation is lovingly manufactured in Berlin. My original design combines function and artistic inspiration which is why people who love solid design and fans of tactile experiences equally cherish the objects.
It´s of special regard to me that it´s not the room that has to adapt to design but that I can customize my creations to perfectly fit each room. This is what makes a manufactory different to mass production. When a client´s personality is part of the creative result you can finally call it true, individual and valuable living. That´s WertWerke´s objective.

Wireworks began life in 1988. Based out of a small workshop off London's Edgware Road it's first products caught the eyes of discerning retailers. Wireworks grew rapidly wining awards ranging from 'Best new product' at Top Drawer to inclusion in the RIBA Stirling prize winning 'Home' design.

Now a quarter of a century after producing their first product, Lincoln Rivers and Darren Ziff are still working with these retailers and have built many other productive, long term relationships with leading retailers around the world.

Lincoln, Wireworks' head designer, drives product development. His background is buying and product design. Interests include cooking, food, gardens, things mechanical and architecture.

Darren is sales director. He is responsible for building relationships with retailers and brand owners to deliver exceptional sales across all commercial channels. He has held various sales and business development positions with high profile organisations including Whitbread plc.

Based in London, Wireworks strives to deliver really well designed products that their customers will enjoy using.

Design makes it better!

Woodman is dedicated to delivering high quality design made to exacting standards. With more than a decade’s experience of producing contemporary furniture for home and office, our products combine elegance and functionality with exceptional value.

Woodman’s 2012 offering builds on the success of previous ranges, which are already delivered to retail markets across Europe and North America. Flexible manufacturing techniques allow us to produce furniture in small or large volumes – ideal for a wide variety of retail partners.

Designed by Leonhard Pfeifer, Woodman products are built to last, and exhibit a profound understanding of the requirements of both retailer and consumer. Pfeifer has worked closely with Woodman since 2006, with a shared goal of producing beautifully-made furniture for the mid to high-end market.

Pfeifer’s passion and innovation were noted in 2011 with a clutch of prestigious awards including a Design Guild Mark, Prix Les Découvertes, and an European Consumer Choice Award for his Farringdon laptop desk.

Woody's UG mbH is a small company located in the Ore Mountains of Germany, a region where wood processing has a long tradition. We focus on the development and manufacturing of accessories for Apple devices made out of high quality woods. Once, we had the vision to combine Apple's peripheral devices with natural materials in order to gain a higher grade of ergonomy. We think we accomplished our mission. For the production process we care about high quality materials, digest design, precision fabrication, functionality, environmental aspects and sustainability.

Workstead is a design studio, founded in 2009 by Stefanie Brechbuehler and Robert Highsmith.  Their studios are located in Brooklyn New York and the Hudson Valley, where they focus on architectural and interior design, lighting, furniture, and exhibitions.

Workstead's aim is to design responsible works that create a sense of place for both the objects they contain and the people that experience them.  Their palette is strong and rich, yet simple and efficient.

In 2012, Workstead designed the public spaces for the highly acclaimed Wythe Hotel in Brooklyn.  Workstead currently has projects in New York, Connecticut, Oklahoma, and California.  The studio's lighting is sold through their online store, and through shops in New York City and Los Angeles.  Their installations can be found in the collections of Barneys, Facebook, Levi's, Google, Yelp, the Harpoon Brewery, and in private residences all over the world.

Xcellent, founded in 2001, is a manufacturer of collecting creative, innovative, aesthetics and lifestyle, holding the spirit of development and innovation. Accumulating more than ten years of experience of industrial design service and OEM&ODM leads us to own the brands of lighting, furniture and grill. Xcellent aims to develop better products, proper service and meaningful value, this is based on innovation on function, material and scenario, humanistic oriented thinking, style-led aesthetic experience. We offer "A better choice".

Xcellent Lighting is a new branch of Xcellent Products International, founded in 2001. The goal of the company has always been to design value into our products. To Xcellent, VALUE stands for Variation, Aesthetics, Lifestyle, Utility and Economic; describing the way in which our products aim to deliver an outstanding user experience to meet every demand, from form and function to feeling and affordability.

In the firm’s first decade, Xcellent has designed and developed hundreds of products for outdoor living, cookware, consumer electronics and furniture. These products, some of which were manufactured by Xcellent as well, have been sold by our clients across different brands and channels all over the world. Our experience in marketing, research and development, manufacturing, and quality control combined with new professional optical technology leaves us fully prepared in our second decade of business to expand into the LED lighting market.
A graphic artist from London

Yoshii Towel Company, located in the city of Imabari in Ehime Prefecture, has been producing high­quality towels in Japan since 1957. They harness the inherent qualities of cotton to make towels that are extraordinarily soft, highly absorbent, and quick to dry. From weaving to final production, all stages of manufacture take place at cooperative factories in Imabari.

ZERO PER ZERO is a graphic design studio emerged from two different people coming together.A project themed on the cities of the world, and another project capturing and expressing daily lives of people ­ two projects meet, co-exist, and mix, giving birth to a new breed of graphic design.

Current projects at ZERO PER ZERO revolve around the City Railway System series led by Ji-hwan Kim, and illustration works of Sol Jin. From a small studio in Seoul to the World, we transmit in the graphic language the small yet intricate daily lives of people opposite the expansive and diverse cities of the world.

ZKIN - a designer brand, launched in 2009, which bears resemblance of your skin and is intended to protect your precious gadgets and personal belongings. ZKIN bags are not only multi-functional, but also fashionable in design and timeless, offering user added value from ordinary bags. In design, ZKIN has successfully created a “Modern Vintage” style which picks the essence of “vintage” elements and delivers it in modern style by using various colour contrasts. It also wishes to make everyone shine in unique style regardless of their skin colours with this “Modern Vintage” style. Artek is renowned as one of the most innovative contributions to modern design.
Long-term durability and high quality combined with a clean-lined form language are the essential elements in the creation of every single product that bears the Artek name. Artek's comprehensive furnishing system can be used in all kinds of situations from public spaces to offices, museums to schools, hotels to homes. Artek history
Artek was founded in 1935 by four young Finns led by the visionary modern architect Alvar Aalto.
Alvar Aalto began designing furnishings as a natural and important extension of his architectural thinking. His first modern furniture was created in 1931-32 for the tuberculosis sanatorium in Paimio, which proved to be his international breakthrough. Artek was set up in 1935 to market Aalto's furniture, lamps and textiles, particularly on international markets where Artek focused its operations from the initial stages

Clear and straight design, soft white in combination with natural wood and open space interior arrangements create an atmosphere of comfort, ease and recreation.Whereas washstand, bench or bed of the PRIVATE SPACE furniture collection combine bath- and bedroom to the private zone of an apartment, the collection also extends to the "public" space of a home, which is the place you share with your guests. Well suitable for office use also, the clear and straight designs of these furniture pick up traditional timber joints, but still create a modern atmosphere of comfort and ease.THE MAKING OF DESIGNA good idea has no value without the perfect teamwork of everyone being involved in its realization. "I always try to add a warm touch of ease and recreation to my designs in contrast to the stressful outside world." That is why Jannis Ellenberger continues to use wood as a natural material for his works. Designed with a lot of care and sensitivity he realized the PRIVATE SPACE collection in close cooperation with furniture manufacturer Anders GmbH. Combining modern serial production with strong quality controls, all items of the collection are manufactured under one roof. "Rolf and Franz - a friendship and the beginning of a story of a collection of lights

Franz had an idea.

The idea of a very simple , lovable product that enriches the homely environment and is a charming counterpoint to our over engineered world.

With this idea, he went long pregnant and already had a formal vision, but the baby did not come quite to the world.

So he tells it someday his friend Rolf, whose job it is  after all to give things a beautiful shape.

Rolf was highly impressed immediately started the development. But there were so many questions? Which material? Which design ? . The question of the material But the answers came naturally. The chosen material was boxboard. Familiar to anyone warm, aesthetically white easy to work with and on top of that ecologically. The design was clear but how to connect the parts to a stable body?  How to design a beautiful light distribution Everything should be out of paper, even the packaging. This was an intensive, but fulfilling phase of trial and succeed.
After an uncounted number of attempts the lights had their final form.
Of course there were other challenges like producing, but all the lovely people around the two who were just as enthusiastic about the idea, gave them the necessary support.
Then it was born - the first him + her lamp collection .Since then a lot happened, a growing number of beautiful designs, a growing number of enthusiasts identifying with the idea of sustainable luminaire with pure and simple designs."

lightexture is a collaboration between an architect, a lighting designer and a ceramic artist, creating unique designer lamps.

As it is adjusted, the iris-like light fixture dramatically changes the environment of a space through the volume of direct light it emits, as well as the complex light textures it projects onto space (patent 8,025,430).

Later that year, ceramic artist Sharan Elran joined lightexture and expanded the pallet and vocabulary of materials into clay and porcelain. Together the three designers - an architect, a lighting designer and ceramic artist - have been collaborating to create a robust collection of fixtures that are both playful and sensual. Each of the partner designers brings in a different set of skills and sensibilities to the stage, which makes the lights a conversation through work.

"MOSTLIKELY

MOSTLIKELY combines architecture, computer graphics, design and sound. Their outstanding projects vary from buildings to art-installations as well as from videos to music productions, whereas boundaries between branches are most likely free flowing. The Viennese agency is run by the five partners Wolfgang List, Kurt Mühlbauer, Maik Perfahl, Mark Neuner and Robert Schwarz. 


MOSTLIKELY DESIGN

MOSTLIKELY DESIGN was founded 2012 by Maik Perfahl and Wolfgang List of the interdisdiplinary design/sound/architecture collective MOSTLIKELY. The goal was to create complex objects at a low price that can be used as masks, lampshades or something else.


MOSTLIKELY LAMPSHADES

The ""mostlikely DIY lampshades"" were founded 2012 by Maik Perfahl and Wolfgang List of the interdisdiplinary design/sound/architecture collective ""mostlikely"". The goal was to create complex objects at a low price that can be used as mask, lampshade or something else. Each lampshade starts as a complex 3D computer model. The customer can choose from different objects or design a unique one. Nearly any form is possible. In a second step the 3d computer model gets transformed into a flat plan. This flat plan gets printed on heavy paper with a standard oversize printer used in architecture offices. The printout gets turned over to the customer. In the last step the customer cuts out, folds and glues the parts together. 
At the fair “Maison&Objet” in Paris ""mostlikely"" won the „Prix Découvertes MAISON&OBJET 2012“. "

onktah katuh's power cords are deceptively simple--cast concrete forms with 4 outlets and some colorful textile cables. On closer inspection, the design bureau treats functional home electronics as a ruse for design-pranksterism.

Each of the concrete blocks, and their corresponding colors, are derived from the colorways and shapes of tetris. It's no coincidence that Tetris was one of the USSR's largest cultural exports to the west, either--what other material pays homage to the USSR than beton brut? Taken together, what we have are 8kg concrete blocks that help transmit a nearly immaterial form of energy; digitally derived forms made manifest in one of the heaviest materials there is (that won't give you cancer, at least); power cords that would fit in any post-soviet plattenbau, right down to the juxtaposition of cheery colors with cold cast concrete.

Hand cast in Berlin, these also happen to be functional powerstrips.

Evolve the way you think about time. Slow watches were created to shift the way people read time so rather than focus on the second or the minute we produced an instrument that measures the moment. Slow does not describe a speed. It is a mindset that most of us somehow lost. As a result of our busy lifestyles, we often forget that we actually have a choice of how to live. The slow watch (we named it slow Jo) is a subtle reminder that time is the most precious thing we have so we should enjoy everything we do and stop chasing every minute. In order to be a true symbol of this idea, the slow watch has only one hand that rotates once every 24 hours. It actually moves at half the speed of a normal watch, but allows you to see at one glance the progress of your entire day.
